2005.


Tarozzi, D., Io
faccio così, Chiarelettere, Milano 2013.Sull'educazione, il viaggio e l'homeschoolingBowlby, J., Attaccamento e perdita, Bollati Boringhieri, Torino, 1999Di Martino, E., Homeschooling. Educazione Parentale, Pavia 2014.Gatto, J.T., Dumbing us down, New Society Publishers, Gabriola Island, 2009.Illich, I., Descolarizzare la società, Mimesis, Milano 2010Locke, J., Pensieri sull'educazioneSerravalle, E., Vaccinazioni, alla ricerca del rischio minore, Bambino Naturale, 2014Neufeld, G., Maté, G., I vostri figli hanno bisogno di voi, 




Dove
come quando e perchè, o i luoghi dove vogliamo fermarci ed imparare

Perchè
nomadi? In molti ci hanno posto questa domanda. Potremmo imparare molte di queste cose senza spostarci troppo dalla nostra città natale. Indubbiamente i costi e i problemi si
ridurrebbero molto, ma anche la ricchezza dell'esperienza. Abbiamo scelto di essere ricercatori itineranti:

1)
Perchè pensiamo che il confronto tra diverse realtà arricchirà la nostra esperienza.2) Perchè pensiamo che il viaggio rappresenti un'occasione unica per la nostra bambina di crescere ed imparare da nuove esperienze.

3)
Perchè lavorando a contatto con diverse realtà potremo creare una rete
locale, nazionale e internazionale di conoscenze e di collaborazione
futura.

4)
Perchè abbiamo letto numerose testimonianze di chi ha scelto una
vita di resistenza e moltissimi lamentano un doloroso isolamento:
speriamo di superarlo e di creare invece una fitta e viva rete umana
di reciproco aiuto e di mutuo scambio.

5)
Perchè è tramite il viaggio e la conoscenza di realtà lontane e
differenti tra loro che si possono notare e scoprire punti di forza e
di debolezza, che si possono cogliere i lati migliori, che si possono
apprendere le più geniali strategie di vita.

Qui
di seguito una lista dei luoghi che visiteremo durante gli anni di
ricerca, la lista ovviamente, come in ogni ricerca sul campo, potrebbe essere riorientata in corso d'opera.
Dove andremo.
Autunno 2014: podere Luna Nera, Greve in Chianti, Siena, Toscana. 
Inverno 2014: azienda agricola Il Giardino della Gioia,  Riesi, Caltanissetta, Sicilia.
Primavera 2015: Greece Project 037, Ionian Island, Greece.

Estate 2015: Baza Ulmu, Baia Mare, Maramures, Romania.
Autunno 2015: Happy-Clappy Farm, Cluj, Ardeal, Romania.
Inverno 2015: Monastery Garden, Bakonybél, Veszprem, Hungary. 
Primavera 2016: la Ferme du Collet, La Penne, Nice, Cote d'Azur, France.
Estate 2016: Cortijo el Paso, La Apujarra, Granada, Espana.
Autunno 2016: Vale Grifo, Lisbona, Portugal.
Inverno 2016: Quinta do Barbeito, Braga, Porto, Portugal.
Primavera 2017: Ferma Senra, Galicia, Espana.
Estate 2017: Les Sabots de Lure, Drome, France.
Autunno 2017: azienda agricola Amaltea, Rivalto-Chianni, Pisa, Toscana.
10
linee guida.



	La
	nostra casa sarà il camper.



	Spenderemo
	il meno possibile affidandoci all'ospitalità delle comunità dove
	faremo ricerca. Tutto ciò che ci verrà offerto lo ripagheremo in
	lavoro. La rete wwoofing sarà la prediletta.



	Applicheremo
	la raccolta differenziata ed il riuso e riciclo.



	Diffonderemo
	tramite la rete internet tutto ciò che impareremo, vi terremo
	aggiornati sull'evoluzione di ciò che acquisiremo in conoscenza.


Ogni backer verrà con noi: scriveremo il nome di ognuno sul lato del camper.



	Lavoreremo
	duro, non dimenticheremo che questo viaggio è una grande occasione
	di lavoro.



	Seguiremo
	il ciclo delle stagioni.



	Ci
	sposteremo in diverse realtà per conoscerne limiti e punti di forza
	ed imparare da ognuna di esse.



	A
	conclusione del viaggio creeremo un libro e un documentario video. Sarà
	il nostro ringraziamento più grande ai backer.



	Seguiremo una dieta vegetariana.


Soldi...
A
cosa ci servono?Non abbiamo sponsor per il nostro progetto, e dunque vi investiremo tutti i nostri risparmi per farlo diventare realtà. Con questi riusciremo ad affrontare le principali spese di vita durante gli anni di viaggio, e saranno anni improntati alla semplicità e alla riduzione di ogni spesa.
Con questa campagna di crowdfunding chiediamo il vostro aiuto per acquistare ciò che ancora ci manca per poter concretamente partire: il camper che vedete qui sopra, un Mercedes 407 del 1982. Chiediamo anche un contributo per l'acquisto della foto-videocamera e di un laptop. Tutti i soldi che eventualmente arriveranno in più li useremo per l'attrezzatura necessaria al viaggio e per tutte le altre spese. Anche nell'acquisto di questi oggetti manterremo il nostro impegno nel ridurre il più possibile le spese.  

Camper: 4000 Euro
Macchina fotografica e videocamera, laptop: 500 Euro.Se riusciamo a superare il goal di 4500 euro ogni centesimo in più sarà speso per acquistare: cassetta degli attrezzi, kit pronto soccorso, bombole del gas, sacchi a pelo, ricambi del camper, abiti da lavoro, scarpe da trekking, torce, bussola, mappe e, naturalmente, gasolio per il camper e biglietti autostradali..Come donare:Se volete donare tramite carta di credito senza aprire un conto PayPal, basta cliccare su CONTRIBUTE, scegliere il premio, cliccare su GO TO PAYPAL, scegliere "Pay with credit card" compilare il form e togliere la spunta a "Save this information with a PayPal account" e proseguire con il pagamento.Se volete donare ma non avete nè la carta di credito, nè una carta prepagata, potete fare un bonifico online al numero di conto: IT27U0358901600010570359999    intestato a Veronica Testa, Via Roma 9/g Baldissero Torinese. oppure potete darci i soldi a mano, se preferite, e noi provvederemo, in ambedue i casi, a fare una donazione a vostro nome con la nostra carta di credito.Info:Se avete domande o volete chiedere chiarimenti ecco le nostre mail e i nostri cellulari:mail: naso1905@hotmail.it     cell: 3492987942 (Andrea)mail: olimpiacarlos@libero.it     cell: 3497913752 (Veronica)Dona quello che puoi, se non puoi donare diffondi questa pagina tra tutti i tuoi contatti. Ogni euro guadagnato è per noi prezioso! Grazie a tutti!


BAREFOOT RAMBLERS




A rambling research journey of discovery among resistants to 
modernity. Two anthropologists not yet famous want to learn, record and 
spread a new but old way of life. Rediscover ancient wisdom and skills, 
get back to working with their hands, finding a balance with the planet.


What we want to do.
Our research project is an exploring journey. We will cross Europe 
with our notebooks, our pc, photo and video cameras to discover farm 
communities, eco-villages and families who have chosen to resist 
modernity and lead a life less tied to the consumer system. By 
sharing work we will learn what we think will be useful  the day we 
decide to stop being nomads and to build a community on the model of 
those encountered. What we will do is get in touch and work with 
people who have already made this kind of choice, learn from them how 
you can organize your life in a different way and then document, film 
and spread what we have learned with notes, photos and videos that we 
will post regularly on the blog. This is to make all the people who helped us feel on the road with us, and then one day they can tell their children about that time when they have helped and followed those two fools in camper around Europe. On the way back we will release a video
 documentary of our trip and we will print a book with the best pictures
 and quotes from our road trip journal. 
At the end of the trip we will find a place to apply their knowledge 
and begin our lives as resistants. The trip will allow us to create a 
network of cooperation and knowledge between different communities: this
 network will be the social  base to project our future life.

Fools open roads which cautious will follow.



Who we are.-Andrea Nasi Anthropologist expert in Gypsy studies. Thesis on
 the impact of modern society on traditional Roma culture. Researcher 
for Terre des Hommes in Romania. Collaboration and writing projects for 
several local and international NGOs operating in Eastern Europe with 
the Roma populations. Social worker in a company that works for rights 
and integration of Roma people.-Veronica Testa Africanist anthropologist. Thesis on the rites of
 passage into adulthood among Kabiyè of northern Togo and their 
modifications brought by the Catholic Church. With a "kot à projet" 
management and organization of events aimed at knowledge of the cultures
 of Africa during the three years of university studies in 
Belgium. Social worker in a company that works for rights and 
integration of Roma people.-Maelia Solim Marvellous girl of nearly three years. She attended
 one year of kindergarden, which she loved. She  wants to grow and learn
 with family. She wants to fill her eyes and her hands with real life. 
Sociable, nomadism-lover and camper-lover.
The project.
In the summer of 2013 we went to Romania together with a photographer
 looking for the last traditional nomadic Roma families. We found some 
and we stopped to live with them for a few days. During a night party by
 the campfire we decided to abandon the settled life to begin this 
journey of travel and discovery.During the winter we have been reading many books written by scholars
 of degrowth, environmentalists, representatives of sustainable living, 
scientists and biologists. All these people are aware of the dire state 
of the planet, they are critics of the current consumer model, and also 
witness a different way of living, an alternative way to our consumer 
society. We have become aware of the need for a radical change in 
lifestyle to fit our needs to those of the planet in which we live in.


Our project is designed for those who wish to change their lives.  Based on the 
conviction that revolutions begin with a drop of water, we decided to be
 the first to take this step. We asked ourselves, "What can we do to 
improve our lives and that of the planet?" and we decided to do it in 
the first person.
We do not want to create our
 own little happy island and start to ignore the world's problems, but 
on the contrary we want to give the good example and start doing what we
 can. We don't want to stay still doing nothing, but on the contrary we
 want to start working with our hands.
Our project is  a master of practical studies and a social researching field.
We will focus on:
1) learning the techniques of agricultural production (horticultural 
techniques, synergistic agriculture, permaculture, composting, 
phytodepuration) 
2) learning how to make tools and eco-facilities (solar oven, compost toilet, clay oven etc.)
3) analyzing how different communities organize their social life (decision-making, work division, financial management). 
4) studying the educational paths that these communities have chosen for their children.
5) learning a new life organization in the respect and preservation 
of the biosphere (reduction of the ecological footprint and consumption,
 recycling and reusing materials, conservation of natural capital). 
6) learning, preserving and spreading ancient knowledge related to a non-consumption system.
Where, when, how and why, or the places where we want to stop and learn. 
Why nomads? Many people have asked us this question. We could learn 
many of these things without moving too far from our hometown. 
Undoubtedly costs and problems would be reduced a lot, but so would the 
richness of the experience. We chose to be itinerant researchers: 
1) Because we do think that the comparison among different realities will enrich so much our experience.
2) Because working on different experiences can create a local, 
national and international network of knowledge and future cooperation. 
 

3) Because we read numerous stories of those who have chosen this 
kind of existence and many complain about isolation: we hope to overcome
 it and to instead create a dense and lively human network of mutual aid
 and mutual exchange
4) Because it is by travelling and getting to know distant and 
different realities that we can see and discover the strengths and 
weaknesses of all of them. It's the best way to catch the best side of 
things, the best way to learn the most brilliant life strategies. 
Below is a list of the places we will visit during the years of 
research, the list of course, as in any field research, could be 
redirected during the work in progress.Where to.
Fall 2014:  Luna Nera farming, Greve in Chianti, Siena, Toscana. 
Winter 2014:  Il Giardino della Gioia farming, Riesi, Caltanissetta, Sicilia.
Spring 2015:  Greece Project 037, Ionian Island, Greece. 
Summer 2015: Baza Ulmu, Baia Mare, Maramures, Romania.
Fall 2015: Happy-Clappy Farm, Cluj, Ardeal, Romania.
Spring 2016: Monastery Garden, Bakonybél, Veszprem, Hungary. 
Summer 2016: Cortijo el Paso, La Apujarra, Granada, Espana.
Fall 2016: Vale Grifo, Lisbona, Portugal.
Winter 2016: Quinta do Barbeito, Braga, Porto, Portugal.
Spring 2017: Ferma Senra, Galicia, Espana.

Summer 2017: Les Sabots de Lure, Drome, France.

Fall 2017: La Ferme du Collet, La Penne, Nice, Cote d'Azur, France.

Winter 2017: Amaltea Organic Farm, Rivalto-Chianni, Pisa, Toscana.Our 10 guidelines.
1. Our home will be the camper van.
2. We will spend as little as possible by leaning on the hospitality 
of the communities we study. Everything that will be offered we will 
trade for handwork. The wwoofing network will be the favourite. 
3. We will do waste sorting, recycling and reusing. 
4. We will spread through the internet everything we will learn and we will keep you up to date on what are taught. 
5. Any supporter will come with us: we write everyone's name on the camper truck.
6. We will work hard, we will not forget that this journey is a great opportunity of work.
7. We will follow the seasonal cycle. 
8. We will move among different situations to know the limits and strengths and learn from each of them. 
9. At the end of the trip we will create a documentary video. It will
 be our biggest thanks to all the supporters and a way to make all the 
supporters just like as they are travelling with us. 
10. We will follow a vegetarian diet.
Bucks...


What do we need them for?We do not have sponsors for our project, therefore we will invest all
 our savings to make it come true. With our savings we will be able to 
face the majority of our life's expenses during the years of travel. It 
will be years marked by simplicity and reduction of costs. 
With this crowdfunding campaign we are asking for your help to buy 
what we are still missing to be able to actually go and leave: the 
camper in the picture above, a wonderful 1982 Mercedes 407, the camera and a laptop. Any other fund that will come exceeding our goal will be spent to buy the equipment to travel. Even in the purchase of 
these items we will maintain our commitment to minimize expenses. 
Camper van: 4000 eurosCamera and laptop: 500 Euro If we reach our goal every cent over 4500 euro will be spent for: tool kit, gas bottles, camper parts, first aid kit, sleeping bags, flashlights, compass, maps, work clothes, trekking shoes and, of course, fuel and highway fees...How to contribute:If you want to donate by credit card without opening a PayPal 
account, just click CONTRIBUTE, choose the perk, click GO TO PAYPAL, 
click "Pay with credit card" and fill in the form and uncheck "Save this
 information with PayPal account "and proceed with the payment. If
 you want to donate but do not have neither a credit card nor a prepaid 
card, you can make an online bank transfer to this account number: 
IT27U0358901600010570359999 payable to Veronica Testa, Via Roma 9 / g 
Baldissero Torinese, ItaliaInfo and Contacts:For every further information please do not esitate to contact us by email or phone call:email: naso1905@hotmail.it     mob: 0039 3492987942 (Andrea)email: olimpiacarlos@libero.it     mob: 0039 3497913752 (Veronica)Donate what you can, if you can't donate please share this page among all your contacts. Every euro is so precious for us! Thank you all!

story:
Do you love popcorn? Love spices?

I do and hope you do too! Hello, my name is Mihir Shah, the founder of Dishoom Foods. Thank you for checking out our campaign.

I am passionate about natural foods, spices and their health benefits.

As a childhood cancer survivor, the long-term side effects from the intense medications caused a host of serious health issues including blindness and heart failure. I've since overcome them all and feel fantastic, but because of my experience, I’m proud to offer an all-natural snack for those just as passionate about staying away from Genetically Modified  Organisms (GMO), added chemicals and artificial flavors. 

When I was young, my Mom would go nuts whenever I ate overly processed snacks. She’d say, “Why do these snack companies add all these chemicals and artificial ingredients when you can get flavors and colors straight from nature??!!”

Years later, my Mom mixed good-for-you, flavorful spices such as turmeric, cayenne, and cumin and cooked them with popcorn. I was instantly hooked! But don't take my word on how delicious it is, see our testimonials.

My mom’s popcorn later became our Cobra Corn Bombay Seasoning—our most popular flavor. Since our humble founding in 2010,  we have created some  fabulously delicious flavors beyond the current Indian inspired line.  In order to reflect the more globally-focused flavors, and our strong belief in using the best available, REAL spices, we are rebranding our products from Cobra Corn to Spiced & Infused.

Our products fill a void in the snack aisle by offering an all-American favorite—popcorn--with good-for-you, REAL spices that have healthful attributes. Take a look at some of the spices we use and their benefits here: http://cobracorn.com/our-spices. We are asking for your help so we can bring more healthful spices to the snack aisle by creating new flavors and appeal to more people. 

So if you contribute today, you can help bring Cobra Corn to the masses and be the first to get our Spiced & Infused popcorn available in these flavors: Asian Barbeque, Bombay Seasoning, Chipotle Taco, French Herb, and Himalayan Salt.

What we will do with the funds...

Specifically, we aim to raise $50,000 in order to:

· Obtain official certifications for gluten-free, non-GMO, vegan, and whole grain

· Redesign our packaging with our new brand and create single serve and family size bags

· Formulate new and delectable flavors including: French Herb, Chipotle Taco, and Asian Barbeque to appeal to more palates and spread the spice love

· Purchase quality ingredients (like REAL spices and non-GMO ingredients), materials, and equipment

· Legal mumbo jumbo

· Expand distribution and ramp-up marketing 

· Send you your rewards! 

If you support this campaign, you will be among the first to taste our new flavors of Spiced & Infused, get some of our current flavors and you may even earn the chance to celebrate with me and some of our most loyal fans at a cocktail party or dinner at one of the hottest drink and dining spots in Chicago. (See rewards for details!)

The Impact

- If you believe there should be more all-natural, good-for-you, and non-GMO options in the snack aisle, then you should support this campaign! 

- If you believe there isn’t enough spice and flavor in the snack aisle, then you should support this campaign!

- If you are a friend or fan of Cobra Corn, you should support this campaign!

- If you want to be the first among your crew to get our new popcorn line, then you should support this campaign!

- If you want to support a small business, you should support this campaign!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute at this time, but still want to help, PLEASE:

  • Share this campaign with your family, friends and coworkers through your social networks (Facebook, Twitter etc.) with the Indiegogo tools – or email, phone, fax, and telepathy! 
  • Like Cobra Corn on Facebook and Follow us on Twitter
  • Please pick up Cobra Corn at a store near you (if they have it), request your grocer to carry it, or order it online on Amazon, Abe’s Market, or through our website

THANK YOU SO MUCH and STAY SPICY!

story:
Short Summary

Brianna Underhill is a U19 member of Team BC heading for the North American Indigenous Games, July 20 - 27, 2014.  Proudly representing the 'Namgis (Alert Bay, BC) and Nłeʔkepmx (Lytton First Nation) living in beautiful Chilliwack in the Fraser Valley also proudly representing the city of her birth, in the land of the Upriver Stó:lō.

Your support will help Brianna with the many expenses of travelling to The Games; it will make it possible for her to go and have a great time and focus on the competition.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is $4,000.  It will be used to offset the expenses of attending The Games.  A Heartfelt Thank You; A personal woven Cedar Bark Bracelet with you in mind; the opportunity to have a personal Indigenous tour guide at your invitation on your next trip to BC to include exploring the many award winning Aboriginal Tourism destinations and experiences local to Vancouver, Vancouver Island, or Gold Rush Trail country in the Fraser Canyon are your perk options.  Any funds raised will be greatly appreciated and put to good use.  Excess funds will be “Potlatched” and shared among others in need.  It is a way of redistributing wealth honoured by our ancestors, relatives and friends.

The Impact

Participation in the North American Indigenous Games will further develop Brianna’s ball skills and athletic record.  Playing Fast Pitch since age 7, Brianna has trained diligently through the years; from Pre-Mite to the powerful Rep B and now international level competitive pitcher today.  A winner of many MVPs; Bri is a role model and leader, and community organizer of fun. 

On July 4-6 the Abbotsford Outlaws hosted the BC Provincials for Softball and her team placed 5th overall.  It was a superb tournament, and many kudos went out to the team and to all the volunteers on a job well done. 

NAIG will allow Brianna to be seen by many coaches scouting from Universities across Canada and the USA; a huge potential of benefit for her future as she aspires to become a teacher and help youth achieve their best in physical education and academics.  Brianna is a B Honours Student, excelling in Strength and Conditioning, Spanish Language, English and Legal Studies.  Dance and music hold a special place in Brianna’s life, and joyful singing and music, dancing are a constant for her.  2014/ 2015 will be her final year of Secondary School, and she is looking forward to the future.

Risks & Challenges

 There are no anticipated risks or challenges. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Getting the word out to your family, friends, colleagues, business networks and media contacts will help immensely. 

Brianna’s Facebook Page URL:

https://www.facebook.com/BriFundraisingINDIGENOUSGAMES2014?ref_type=bookmark

Please share links widely; all support will be very much appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

Faithful Heart Foundation has been rescuing and protecting at-risk orphans in Northern Thailand since 2007. We are an independent legal foundation, chartered by the government of Thailand to raise money and use it to provide safe and healthy family-style homes for  poor orphans and abandoned children. 

This year we hope to startup and operate a small on-line business to produce & sell various products such as health tea, hill tribe coffee, etc. All  (100%) of the profits will be used solely to care for the orphans.   

    We want to do all we can to rescue as many orphans as possible, and part of our vision is to teach the children and families how to gradually become self-sufficient. We want to start this business to move us a step closer to our goal. 

    For those people who decide to contribute and help us achieve this new business goal, their reward will be knowing that their involvement is helping to save at-risk children-- from danger and poverty, into a safe and bright future. 

    What We Need & What You Get

    What we need the money for:

    • To begin our on-line business will take at-least $2000 USD. 
    • About $800 will be used to create an on-line website for a catalog of our various products, and for placing orders, etc.
    • We will apply for the Thai version of "FDA testing & approval" for our tea and coffee products. We want customers to have assurance of our high quality.
    • We must setup a "clean-room" location where we will hand-process and package all of our tea & coffee products.
    • We will purchase initial stock & supplies to prepare to fill orders.
    • When we meet our goal, we will manufacture special "gift packages" of our best products to be shipped to every contributor of $50 or more.
    • If we fall short of our goal, the received funds will be used 100% to benefit the orphan children under our care and protection.

    The Impact

    Why should you help?:

    • Every day, poor and helpless children are preyed upon by heartless predators. Every day these poor children go hungry, and every day, they dream of a better life. Your contribution can help create a small business which will have long-lasting positive impact on many young lives.
    • Our Faithful Heart Foundation is already helping almost 85 children. We currently support 5 small orphan homes and four dorms where poor children live and attend school. This new on-line business will enable us to reach and reascue many more orphans.

    Risks & Challenges

     We have been preparing to launch this project for almost 2-years. We've already planted a "Moringa Tea" tree orchard, and developed a unique and delicious "secret blend" of spices for our hand-packaged health tea. We've already spent our personal funds to get this far. If we fail, our foundation and the children will suffer no loss. If we succeed and generate any profits, only the children will benefit. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you simply cannot make a money contribution, please do pass along our website and facebook onformation to others. That too will be helping the orphans!

story:
Help! Transition is Expensive!

Hi! I'm Maypop! You may know me because you've seen me get loud on the internet, look fierce at a dance party or attended one of my charming brunches. Here's the thing: I'm a transwoman, which means I was assigned male at birth and have been spending the last 23 years attempting to correct that error. After beginning hormone treatment over a year ago, it's finally come time for one of the biggest steps in my journey: top surgery, a.k.a breast augmentation. This surgery will help my body become much closer to my identity, my dysphoria be eased, and in general benefit my ability to exist in this world. It's a win/win/win!

Here's what it'll take:

This surgery will be a huge step toward getting my legal gender marker switched from M to F, which means a lot for my safety, psychological and social well-being. Insurance does not cover this sort of surgery, and I am painfully underemployed, so I'm gonna need help from my community: 

  • The surgery will cost about $6300
  • That cost covers operating room fees, anesthesia and the surgery itself
  • If I get $6000, I'll be able to cover the surgery, and the time off work I'll need to recover!
  • Any money beyond the cost of surgery, I'll donate to local rad queer and trans organizations! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Give whatever you can! If every one of my facebook friends gave 11 dollars, the fundraising would end tomorrow! If you can't give any money, signal boost me! Share my link on your facebook wall, tumblr, twitter, whatever! This will help the process so much. 

Help me get the body I can thrive in!

The Perks!

$10-25

Hugs! Literally, you can have all the hugs you want from me any time, all you have to do is ask and they're yours. 

$25-50

An invite to my boob appreciation brunch! Once I get the dang things, I'll throw a brunch and cook a bunch of delicious food to celebrate with everyone who helped me get here.

$50-100

I will send you a tastefully trashy signed-in-lipstick pin up photo featuring the goodies themselves! This is the stuff that boudoir dreams are made of. 

$100

You can request a specific pin up photo of your very own, featuring props and outfits of any kind! Also signed-in-lipstick. Also you can be in the photo if you want.

200$

In addition to fulfilling all of the perks above for you, I'll also do your makeup for the special event of your choice. I'm actually kinda good at makeup so this could be really cool for you.

story:
Typhoon Haiyan relief efforts dedicated to helping families who survived the monster typhoon.  

Mission

Immediate: Roof/Shelter provision to protect families/kids from rain and heat, focusing efforts in the village of Bogo, Cebu where 300 houses were destroyed. We estimate the average cost to repair the roof to be $75/family.

*As of 12/15 we have rebuilt 1 house and repaired 7 houses in the village.

It is our hope to build a bridge connecting these families and their children to a world of generous hearts.

Company Overview

BBC's main mission short term is to help and assist Typhoon victims in their plight by leveraging donations and volunteers, matching them with families most in need. We are working hand in hand with friends and families in the US, in the Philippines, and other countries. 

Description

BBC's goal is to raise awareness of the extreme poverty in Bogo villages, hoping to translate short term efforts into sustainable programs of promoting and expanding educational opportunities for young children.


General information:  Direct donation could also be made to:

Wells Fargo Account:

Account No 331-938-1293
Beneficiary: BANGON BOGO FOR CHILDREN 

                    DBA BBC

story:
We have contacted our contributors by email please check your spam folders on your registered email account. Reach us at Zumbierbrewer@gmail .com

What is ZümBier?

We are passionate about making the freshest, best beer, then helping you experience through interacting with the best food and Zest for life.

  • Larry Bloom is the guy who likes to go counter to popular wisdom.This brewery thing can be done on a micro scale and I'm the guy who's doing it!
  • Waukegan IL is nestled between two mega cities (Chicago and Milwaukee). Both are bustling with breweries. Meanwhile Waukegan has waited for it's next brewery since 1916! The Wait is almost over and the beer will be EPIC! We will keep the beer close and spread word of the greatness to remote corners.
  •  Your contributions will help us invest in initial inventories and building production volume.

Point Blank. We are ready to make you proud! how many of your friends will be able to claim they had a hand in the start up of a beer destination? YOU ARE THE BIGGEST PART OF WHAT WE ARE!  Come with us and OWN the celebration!

We are getting so close we can taste it! We're inviting you into the adventure.

This shiny stuff and unseen cost is ex-pen-sive

  • We are setting the goal at $7000 BUT could benefit by bringing in $15,000 or more!
  • Kegs (called cooperage), Glass/Growlers, and Brewers Hose, as well as outfitting our growler fill station are major expenses in a list of many!
  • In any case we will finish this brewery. The timing for opening for the public can be affected in a big way by your donations.

We are Local and think Globally

Greatness is something seldom achieved and often sought after. We are bringing greatness to Waukegan IL! If you want to sit at our table you'll have to come to us! :

  • Beer Explorers, We want YOU! Because we are so limited in size we will be motivated to bring more to beer by pairing dinners, tours and interacting with our fellow enthusiasts.
  • Exclusive opportunities to be first in line for limited bottle and growler fill releases, limited brewers table dinners, and other festivals and events will be yours for the taking.
  • Our brand will soon be known far and wide, through national and global competition we plan to gather attention from beer travelers from all four corners. Won't it be nice to be able to visit on a Saturday afternoon and say, "I was there when it was lofty goals and an empty warehouse" We will make that happen!

Sometimes it ain't just the money

Look we know what it's like to love a cause but not be able to contribute money:

  • Help us spread the word by telling your friends, neighbors, pastor, and the mailcarrier about us. Seriously, beer lovers come from all walks of life spread the word about ZumBier
  • Use the indiegogo share tools to help us find our audience and audience find us!

And that’s all there is to it.

We're inviting you into the adventure.This shiny stuff and unseen cost is ex-pen-sive
We are setting the goal at $7000 BUT could benefit by bringing in $15,000 or more!
Kegs (called cooperage), Glass/Growlers, and Brewers Hose, as well as outfitting our growler fill station are major expenses in a list of many!

In any case we will finish this brewery. The timing for opening for the public can be affected in a big way by your donations.
We are Local and think GloballyGreatness is something seldom achieved and often sought after. We are bringing greatness to Waukegan IL! If you want to sit at our table you'll have to come to us! :
Beer Explorers, We want YOU! Because we are so limited in size we will be motivated to bring more to beer by pairing dinners, tours and interacting with our fellow enthusiasts.
Exclusive opportunities to be first in line for limited bottle and growler fill releases, limited brewers table dinners, and other festivals and events will be yours for the taking.
Our brand will soon be known far and wide, through national and global competition we plan to gather attention from beer travelers from all four corners. Won't it be nice to be able to visit on a Saturday afternoon and say, "I was there when it was lofty goals and an empty warehouse" We will make that happen!
Sometimes it ain't just the moneyLook we know what it's like to love a cause but not be able to contribute money:
Help us spread the word by telling your friends, neighbors, pastor, and the mailcarrier about us. Seriously, beer lovers come from all walks of life spread the word about ZumBier
Use the indiegogo share tools to help us find our audience and audience find us!
And that’s all there is to it.

story:
What is ChipperList?

ChipperList is a small startup with a big goal.... We want to review assisted living and memory care communities and post state inspection reports online so families can compare options and trust that their loved-one is moving into a safe home.

Searching for senior housing should be as easy as searching for a hotel room! But right now it's far from it. Websites only show an address and a few pretty marketing photos.

But don't take our word for it... Search online for assisted living in your city and you'll see how badly this is needed. There's no websites out there that tell the truth about these communities. Or click here to read an article from the UT San Diego that reported on assisted living violations it uncovered during its investigation.

Help us change all that!


What We Need

Our website is built.
Take a look at www.chipperlist.com to see for yourself (search in San Diego, CA)

We're researching communities in our home town of San Diego.

> But we need your help to:

  1 - Start a marketing campaign to get the word out
        and
  2 - Launch the next city, LA!

Here's how the funds will be used:

  • Marketing
    No one in San Diego knows to check ChipperList and we need to change that! Funds will go towards local and online advertising campaigns to spread the word to always... always... always... check ChipperList before you tour.

  • Munks (What we call our expert reviewers - like ChipMunks)
    We've already hired a staff of reviewers and they are touring in San Diego. Unfortunately, they don't like working for hugs. Funds will go to pay for more tours in San Diego and hire munks to start touring in Los Angeles as well.

    VERY IMPORTANT TO KNOW:
    Munks are all independent reviewers. They get paid up-front for each community so there is no incentive to falsify information to make a community look better than it is. They get paid to write the truth.

  • Data Researcher
    The department of social services has records about every inspection, violation and complaint for all communities in California. But its locked away in files and paper records. The researcher combs thru those records, scans them, and posts the reports free on our website.

Groups and Communities That Support ChipperList

ChipperList has the full backing of both the eldercare community and assisted living chains who also recognize the need for more visibility and transparency with assisted living postings online.
Here's some of the groups and communities that support ChipperList:

 Hazel's Army

 Boomer's Against Elder AbuseSeacrest Village


What Do You Get?

Besides helping thousands of seniors find the best care... by contributing you can also get the following perks found on the right of the page.

 - Free Community Report
 - Q&A with a Munk
 - 6 Months of Violation Alerts
 - T-Shirt
 - Tour with a Munk
 - Play Golf with the ChipperList Team

Or choose from one of our basic levels on the right (Bronze, Silver, Gold, or Platinum) if you just want to give and don't want any of the perks.

Additionally, please follow us on Facebook to stay informed about ChipperList news. Scroll to the bottom of this page and you'll see the Facebook link.


Why Is This Important?

ChipperList is the first website to provide expert reviews
There's other websites where the community can post reviews but its hard to trust that those random reviews are legit or just a worker at the community posing as a family. Instead, we provide a single independent review families can trust. And we make all our listings free to the public.

ChipperList is the first site to put state inspection reports online for free
It's scary to think about... but every month hundreds of families put their loved one's into a senior housing community without ever knowing the violations and complaints that have occurred in the past. 

The data is public but it's locked away in county offices and families don't know how to access it.

We'll be the first site to scan those reports and provide them for free online!

What's more - we analyze the reports and post an easy to read summary listing the low and high severity violations so anyone can see at a glance how one community compares to another.

Low severity means no resident was harmed.
High means a resident was harmed or neglected.


Our research shows that 1 in 4 communities has a high severity violation each year. So 25% of families are moving into a place they probably shouldn't.

That needs to change!


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't contribute money but still want to help. Here's some other ways you can help.

  • Invite Others
    Know someone with a family member in a community right now? Invite them to think about contributing to our campaign to help the next person who searches.

    You can use the share button on the page to email them a link to this site.

  • Share on Facebook/Twitter
    Please use the Facebook/twitter buttons at the bottom of this page to post to your wall and encourage others to contribute.

  • Bring ChipperList to Your CIty
    Are you a interested in starting ChipperList reviews in your city? Contact us and you can interview to become a Lead Munk and start ChipperList in your city.

  • Become a Munk
    Are you an elder care or senior housing expert and interested in becoming a Munk. Contact us and interview to review locations in your city.


QUESTIONS

Here's some common questions and answers about ChipperList.

What is a Munk?
This is what we call our senior housing reviewers. Like chipmunks... not the robed-kind.

How Does ChipperList Make Money to Operate?
We really want to keep the site free to families. So facilities can pay to be featured in search results. Similar to how google advertising works.

How Many Places Are There to Tour?
In San Diego county there are over 500 assisted living and memory care communities. However, 80 of these represent the majority of the beds. The rest are small 6 bed care facilities run out of houses. There's just not enough resources to get them all so our focus is on touring the larger communities over 10 beds.

What is the Building Map in the Video?
We call this a Chipper View. We take pictures throughout each community during our tour. Then we show an aerial view of the building side by side with those pictures so anyone can quickly see what it'd be like to live in that assisted living community.


About Hazel's Army Featured in the Video

We asked Aaron from Hazel's Army to tell his story in the campaign video to show the seriousness of this problem. Hazel's army is a community based advocacy group focused on legislative change in California's senior housing industry.

They are a separate organization from ChipperList but we fully support them. 

You can read more about their cause and follow them on facebook at https://www.facebook.com/HazelsArmy.

story:
PERKS!!!

Company site    

My names Mike, as an avid fisherman and somebody who loves to be by the water I have a great passion for this. I started making rods and lures for myself and friends, it snowballed into a few people here and there. I decided to make a site and post my work on Instagram, the success has been pretty awesome. My next step is to be able to order material and supplies ahead of time and in bulk to keep prices down, and to not rely on orders coming in to fund material. Im about getting a product I would use out to people as fast as possible. Having the material already helps with that.

What We Need & What You Get

$2500 is my goal
Out perks include 2x7 stickers, limited run handmade hoodies, custom painted lures, and 5 custom made 7' split grip freshwater rods. I'm the only one in the company, customers deal directly with me, the money goes towards ordering tools, paint, blanks, all material for the vast amount of custom items i offer
The Impact

Your donations and help to spread the word will help me continue doing what I love and help me do it better and cheaper for the customer. Theres nothing like building something and seeing somebody catch a fish on something you created. Like I said I am a bit of a nut for fishing.

Other Ways You Can Help

First off, thank you for taking the time to read this. Also if ypucant donate please spread the word, the more people that can see this the better. A giant thanks to the supporters and donators. Tightlines

story:
Aercoustics Engineering Limited is an acoustics, noise, and vibration consulting company.  We are a dynamic, energetic, and creative group that is always looking for ways to give back to our community.  So this year, we decided to compete in the 2014 Canstruction event held right here in our awesome City of Toronto!  http://canstructiontoronto.org/ 

The event is a perfect fit for Aercoustics because it creates an opportunity for us to apply our aptitude for creativity, teamwork, analytical problem solving skills to a fun event that benefits hungry people right here in our very own backyard. 

The money we raise in our campaign will go directly to purchasing thousands of cans of food to build our structure with.  All that food is then donated to the Daily Bread Food Bank, which we believe is a fabulous organization. http://www.dailybread.ca/ 

In order to build our top-secret structure, we estimate that we will need approximately 5000 cans of food.  So we will need approximately $4000 dollars to purchase the canned food.  However, we hope to bring in double that amount in order to maximize quality and quantity of the canned food which will be donated to the Daily Bread Food Bank through the structure we build for the competition.

By help making our campaign a success,you know your contribution will help ease the hunger of a person, or even a family. 

We really appreciate any support that you can lend to our campaign, whether it be a monetary donation, or passing along the campaign info to your own contacts!

story:
What is Motavera?

We plan on providing a platform to enable high quality students to find employment and volunteer opportunities with reputable organizations.


Why are we building it?

As students ourselves, we know that internships and work experience will help us gain skills while in school, that will help us be more marketable in the workforce. We are not happy with the current methods of finding internships and want to optimize the experience for all parties involved.


Where does your money go?

We plan on using the money to hire a few college computer science majors to further develop the platform and increase the speed at which new features will be introduced. We want to build an awesome platform that will help students more easily find the opportunities that are out there and help companies hire more students in an affordable and timely fashion.

We are not a money hungry corporation that has to generate revenue for shareholders. We just want to build an awesome platform in a sustainable and cost-effective way that can help so many people efficiently find opportunities.


Who is it for?


  • Students will not pay to use the service.
  • Non-Profits will not be charged to use the service.
  • Firms will be charged to use the service.


How will Motavera earn money?

As a result of our hard work we have not only shown an employer willingness to use the site.  Even without a fully functioning site, we have managed to secure contracts with two local businesses in Kirksville, MO. We are actively working with one of these businesses to create an internship program from scratch built around our service.  The other hired two students who now have a part-time jobs in a field related to their major.  We have discovered that employers are always looking for new and creative ways to hire college students.

We will charge firms to utilize our service to find recruits. The following is our pricing plan for the immediate short run as we test out our Minimum Viable Product. The hidden value with this pricing plan is that a local mom and pop store can choose only to recruit out of 1 school in the Basic Plan. At the same time, we can cater to large corporations who have expansive recruitment needs in the Enterprise Plan and everything in between!

Motavera Pricing Plan




What Schools will have access initially?






                                    

                    


                                                                



Will only those schools have access?

Short Answer: No

Long Answer: These schools will have access during our Minimum Viable Product Phase. We want to test our thesis first and implement the feedback we receive into the platform. Eventually, more and more schools will gain access as we expand.


The Motavera Team

Andrew Estes - I'm a military brat and consider Okinawa, Japan my hometown as I have lived more there than anywhere else  My stateside "home" would be Virginia, although I haven't lived there since I was 10.  I love the water, particularly the ocean, and have my scuba certs - which isn't as awesome as it sounds.  Rugby and basketball are my two favorite sports to play. My favorite hobbies are reading, working out in some way, learning new things. What else.... I enjoy cooking and baking.            

Dustin Staashelm - I am a Marketing and Management major at Truman State University. I enjoy playing basketball and researching random things in my spare time. I find a variety of topics fascinating and am a fairly optimistic person. I really hope our service matches motivated students with opportunities they would never have discovered without it.

Will Ruman -  I am a Computer Science Major at Truman State University. I attended high school in the St. Louis area and am in charge of developing the site. I enjoy keeping up with the latest trends in tech and researching the latest web technologies.

Nep Orshiso -  I am a Finance and Marketing major at Truman State University. I enjoy american football, the rest of the world football, basketball, and futsal. I also enjoy trading, (or trying to trade) when I am not swamped by the workload of school and Motavera and keeping up with global economic and financial news. 

Phil Kegode - My name is Fadhili (Phil) Kegode and I am a junior at Truman State University (TSU), majoring in psychology. I hold the position of Treasurer within TSU’s African Student Association while being involved in the Psych Club and the American Marketing Association. My hobbies include playing guitar, piano, chess, soccer, making YouTube videos, and reading.


What We Need & What You Get

We hope to raise $50,000 for our business. All of the money will go straight back into the business. With the money we will be able to hire more developers to enhance the site's functionality and features. Our campaign revolves around our tech team. We need the money to expand our site to universities around the country and provide a service that truly helps students find employment, internship and volunteer opportunities within the for-profit and non-profit industries.

If you choose to donate, you have the option to choose some of our perks on the right hand side of the page. We chose some fun perks that we think you will like. Our perks display our personalities because we love interacting with others and enjoy having a good time.


The Impact

Our service is made for students by students. We aim to empower the motivated. The service we offer has several goals including improving the process of finding employment and internship opportunities for students. We also hope to provide non-profit organizations a free platform to recruit college students for volunteer and internship opportunities. We want to bring college campuses closer to the communities in which they are located by enhancing opportunities for philanthropic work.

Our site will allow both organizations and students at selected campuses to create a profile. Both organizations and students will have access to a search engine with various criteria to help match the perfect opportunity to the perfect student for said opportunity. Organizations may also take a hands off approach and simply post opportunities and wait for students to apply. With the money, we will be able to further improve our search process and add new features such as a video interviewing service as well as handle other standard operating costs. As a group of students ourselves we want to launch the site without charging students or non-profits anything to utilize our service. With your help we can achieve this goal!

Our idea is not ground-breaking, earth-shattering, or even truly innovative. We simply aim to fix a system that’s broken and out-dated.

story:
ATHROUT charity organisation on the ground working tirelessly with limited resources in helping and rescuing flood affected people of the kashmir valley.

Due to catastrophic flooding, caused by record breaking amounts of rainfall and countless landslides in Jammu & Kashmir a state of emergency has been declared throughout Jammu & Kashmir. 200 plus have already lost their lives, tens of thousands have been evacuated and hundreds of thousands are left without power,drinking water and food supplies. Over 2,000 villages have been affected by the floods.People are running out of supplies needed for survival.

Please donate generously.All your donations with all honesty will be delivered to the flood affected areas.

story:
FREEDOM LIFT and COACHLIFT MISSION:

To give back to our Veterans in need. Wounded, disabled, and injured veterans that are having difficulty with their mobility should be provided their freedom again. Mobility lifts for vehicles are expensive to make, and expensive to install. Our goal is to give away as many lifts as we can to those in need! WE GET MANY REQUESTS FOR HELP FROM OUR MOST HONORABLE TROOPS. We would love to tour the country and give away one lift in each state - one in each city - one to every veteran who needs one! But we are limited by our funds. We need your help. Each time we receive enough money to give away a lift, we can provide it to a much needed veteran.

HELP AND HONOR OUR VETS, THEY DESERVE IT:

Customized Jeep presented to Retired Army Staff Sergeant - Video by ktnv.com:

http://ktnv.video.jrn.com?ndn.trackingGroup=90835&ndn.siteSection=ndn&ndn.videoId=25336694&freewheel=90835&sitesection=ndn&vid=25336694

IN NOVEMBER OF 2013 WE WERE ABLE TO PROVIDE JACE BADIA AN INJURED VETERAN A LIFT SO HE CAN EASILY GET BACK INTO HIS CAR AND DRIVE FOR THE FIRST TIME IN YEARS.

7 years ago, Jace Badia lost his left leg in an IED attack in Iraq. "Having a vehicle where you can go anywhere you want to in a disabled state, it's life altering" said Retired Staff Sgt. Badia.

Audi Angel - Sundance Channel's TV Series (Push Girls)

JACE BADIA HONORED BY PRESIDENT BUSH

Riviera Hotel & Casino To Honor Wounded Warrior

November 7, 2013

Auti Angel from the Sundance Channel's TV Series "Push Girls" to be guest speaker at event

LAS VEGAS - November 6, 2013 - Riviera Hotel & Casino, together with event partners CoachLift Sales and COP 4X4 School of Automotive Excellence, will honor wounded warrior Jace Badia and family on Thursday, November 7 at 1:00 p.m. The even will take place in the Riveria parking lot located at 2901 South Las Vegas Blvd. and will feature guest speaker Auti Angel from Sundance Channel's TV show "Push Girls", a reality show about four woman who have been paralyzed by illness or accident and are now wheelchair-bound. The Riviera and event partners have built a loaded Jeep for Badia and his family to drive home in.

Badia lost a leg and battled other injuries while in Afghanistan in 2006. He spent 29 months recuperating at Walter Reed Hospital before returning to active duty in Iraq and Kuwait. Badia has received two Purple Hearts, three Army Commendations and one Army Achievement, plus a host of other awards.

"Our nations heroes fight for our right to freedom every day of the week" says Ryan Wilson, CEO at CoachLift Sales. "It gives us great pleasure to be able to give back to the Badia Family for all of their sacrifices. Everybody is welcome to the Riviera Hotel and Casino to greet and congratulate the deserving recipient!"

Badia's application was selected by the event sponsors from a pool of submissions by soldiers also wounded in service to our country. The jeep will be specifically painted by Tom Prewitt from Department of Customz, retrofitted with appropriate hand controls, provided by The Ability Center and a CoachLift person lift provided by CoachLift Sales so Badia can once again experience the joys of mobility.

Rugged Ridge has customized the Jeep with a laundry list of after market features, including: Performance Vented Hood, Hood Catch Black, XDH Base Winch, XDH Short Caps, XDH Stinger, XDH Rear Bumper, XDH Tire Carrier, Tire Carrier Linkage, RRC Rock Sliders, 10,500 lbs Performance Winch, 30,000 lbs Recovery Kit, XHD Snorkel with Pre-Filter, Hurricane Fender Flares, 4" Lift Kit with Shocks, Drop Pitman Arm, Inverted Drag Link, Adjustable Track Bar, Extended Stainless Steel Braided Brake Hose, Drakon Wheels Gun Metal Gray, Exhaust System, Exhaust Spacer Kit, Floor Liner Front, Floor Liner Rear, Cargo Liner, A-Pillar 4 Switch Pod Kit, Rear Seat Organizer, Overhead Storage, Neoprene Grab Handles, Grab Handle 5 Piece Kit, Center Console Armrest Pad, Neoprene, Cargo Seat Covers, and a Windshield Decal.

The Riviera is providing lodging for Badia and his family during their stay. Other sponsors for the event include Vegas 4X4 and Offroad, Airlutions, GR8TOPS, COP 4X4 School of Automotive Excellence, CoachLift Sales and several others. For more information on CoachLift visit www.coachlift.com.

http://www.vegas24seven.com/?p=27368

Our Veteran's mobility is important to us, we take pride in being able to help.

CoachLift has been used in all of the following applications:

RV's - Motorhomes - Swimming pools - Travel trailers - Fifth wheels
Manufactured housing - Second floor access - Vans - Suburbans
Pickups - Eighteen wheelers - Farm machinery - Shuttles - Buses - Boats
Boat interiors, for access to upper levels - Airplanes - Nursing homes
And Stairs

CoachLift staff enjoys helping people in need and will continue to introduce new ways to work with anyone or anything that is need of a lift We are offering new financing options and adding new accessories to make our lifts more comfortable, affordable and fun for everyone.

CoachLift has delivered well over 6,000 lifts in over 25 years of service. If a veteran or disabled individual has difficulty stepping up and down, CoachLift makes it possible to keep doing the things they love to do.

What are Handicapped Lifts from Coach Lift®?

Lifts from Coach Lift® are chairs that rise on a lift tube, and swing around to the door. The user sits comfortably, pushes the control button, rises slowly, and swivels the chair into the door opening, where he or she can transfer into the vehicle. It's a simple concept, but one that can change your life. A Handicapped Lift from Coach Lift® is engineered for durability and ease of use. Installation requires a minimum of modification to your vehicle, making it an extremely economical solution.

Real Life Examples:

Jean loves the RV lifestyle. She and her husband, Jim, have seen a lot of this beautiful country during the 10 years since his retirement. They have made lasting friendships with many other RV'ers along the way, and have no desire to settle down just yet. But Jean's arthritis is making it increasingly difficult for her to get into and out of the RV.

Robert depends on the income from his job as a long haul trucker. It's the only life he's known for the last 22 years. But when a stroke that severely weakened his left side left him unable to climb into the cab of his truck, he thought his days on the road were over. He started planning for a scaled-down future on the income his disability pension would provide.

Lifts from Coach Lift® have enabled both Jean and Robert and countless others to keep doing the things they love with dignity. The possible uses are limitless. You may need help getting into your van, farm equipment, boat, airplane, or home. We understand that your situation is unique. Please talk to us... it's part of our business to customize the Coach Lift® to meet your needs.

Risks and challenges

Nobody has ever been injured using our lift and safety with easy mobility is our number one concern. Thank you so much for your support.

story:
Photographing the Small

Greetings, my name is KJ Dakin. I am a Canadian photojournalist and writer, currently working on stories about Syrian refugees in Turkey.

For nearly a decade I have had the privilege of living and maintaining connections with people and communities in Latin America. I have spent a combined total of about three years between Mexico and Peru, predominantly in Colombia, Nicaragua, Peru, Haiti and Costa Rica.

This January I return to the region and join my skills as a photojournalist and journalist to those of my talented comrade,Trina Moyles, a fellow writer and humanitarian. We will document the first chapters of a book about some of the world’s most determined, practical and misunderstood people – the women who farm in “developing” nations.

These are women who farm not only to feed themselves but also their communities; all the while striving against incredible economic and sexual inequality. Often they are literally barefoot and pregnant, with massive transnational resource companies buying their land out from under them even as they battle insidious GMO crops that are infecting their own.

                

           

The book, Small, is the vision of Moyles, whose words I will be adding my visual voice to as a photojournalist.

Trina Moyles is well into the research of the book and has interviewed more than 50 farmers already.

“…when you add up the number of women farmers worldwide, you begin to realize they’re the ones ‘doing the work’ while barefoot and holding a hand-hoe, and quite possibly, eight months pregnant. They're proving that "small" is much more localized, sustainable and effective than "big policy and big dollars. Yet the challenges women farmers are facing, worldwide are enormous,” wrote Moyles on her indiegogo page. To see more about her book in her own words, check out her page; http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/small-stories-of-women-farmers-who-are-changing-the-world  .

My part in this project will be to illustrate the information and personal stories Moyles tells and to provide greater context and understanding through the medium of photography.

To bring visually compelling storytelling to the narrative of these strong, capable women who are taking charge, not only of their own lives but of their larger communities.

I will also take the opportunity to write current and timely articles from a journalistic perspective and work to have them published in public media, to bring attention to the issues.

                 

         

                  

Documenting the realities of foreign resource companies in developing nations

While my primary focus over these two-weeks will be on illustrating Small, it is also the beginning of a much larger documentation project that I have been working towards for years.

I will be returning to Latin America in the summer of 2014 to document the issue of foreign resource companies (particularly Canadian ones) and the consequences and challenges that result from their presence.

Over the last ten years Colombia has seen massive changes as the government has altered laws to promote international mining in the country while effectively making small-scale, self sustaining mining by individuals and families illegal.

As a very timely example of the challenges these people and countries face, the Costa Rican government may face a $1 billion dollar fine from a Canadian mining company, Infinito Gold, after it denied permission to the company to begin an open-pit mine to the country’s north.

The subject of foreign resource companies is finally being discussed in some media outlets in Canada, however there is a much greater need for thorough documentation,  both photographic and written, of how they truly affect the people and environment they operate in. 

        

                     

         

   

Accountability

While I am new to freelancing, until earlier this year I worked at the Prince Albert Daily Herald in Canada where I was expected to write and photograph several stories a week. As a freelancer I was recently published in Al Jazeera America with an article and a 10-page photo spread, looking at Syrian refugees recovering from wounds in southern Turkey. http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2013/10/4/a-house-of-healinginturkeyforthosewoundedinsyria.html

I have also researched the subject of Canadian mining companies in Central America and Colombia and wrote an article a couple of years ago about Gold Corp in Central America.

I’m campaigning to raise $1500 to help me fund the trip to Nicaragua and Guatemala in early 2014, where I will work to capture the individual women and their communities that will be featured in Small. I will also write articles and submit them for publishing by public media outlets. If there is no interest, than they will at least be published online as part of The Bean Tree blog; http://www.thebeantree.org/blog.html

Specifically, fundraising will cover:

·  Portion of flights to and within Central America (Nicaragua & Guatemala) – $800

·  Portion of on-land transport to rural locations and food – $300

·  Portion of logistic & translation fees – $100

·  Portion of gear – (batteries, waterproof camera bag, recorder, SD cards) – $100

·  Portion of insurance for gear – $200

      

          


The Plan: 2014 – 2015

January – March:Photographing subjects on location in Guatemala and Nicaragua, returning to Canada to write articles and submit them for publishing.

March – July:Go treeplanting to finance continuing project on foreign resource companies in Central America and Colombia.

July – August: Return to Guatemala and Colombia to work on stories and photo-documentation of the effects of foreign resource companies.

2014 – 2015 the writing, editing and completion of Small to be published in 2015. See Moyles’ page for more details; http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/small-stories-of-women-farmers-who-are-changing-the-world

Those that know me have known of my affection for and connection to Latin America and especially to Nicaragua and Colombia for many years. They also know that I am a journalist now because of this. They know I care about empowering people who are taking care of themselves and their environment, while being confronted with foreign interest companies with deep pockets and whose priorities are never the people and environments left behind.

Why fundraise? 

I left my job at the Prince Albert Daily Herald last spring so that I could do the stories that I believe are important instead of the stories that my newspaper says are important. As a freelancer that means paying my own way to get to the location and covering all my own costs in the hopes that I can sell a story after I have taken all of the financial and personal risks myself. I am perfectly okay with doing that, but the reality is I have spent the entirety of my savings while working in Turkey and I have no funds to spare to get me to Central America.

What’s the Impact?

If you do not believe that there is any point in looking at the world beyond your own backyard or in telling the stories of people who will never have the opportunity to tell their own stories, then there is no point in funding this project.

The purpose and point of journalism and documentation can be argued about over a cup of coffee for hours and I will be one of the first to raise my voice and say that I have doubts. That I do not know if it really makes a difference. However I am compelled to do something. To show what I see, to communicate the similarities and differences between people and places in the hope that we will someday create a world of generosity and patience, rather than fear and greed.

“Indifference, indifference is the strongest force. It makes everything it touches meaningless. Love, hate, don’t stand a chance against it. It lets neglect and decay and monstrous injustice go unchecked. It doesn’t act, it allows. And that’s what gives it so much power.” Joan d Vinge, ‘The Snow Queen’


Thank you

If you are able to help out financially, thank you. If not, that is fine too. Pass it on to someone else who might be inspired and thank you again for your time and consideration.

Below are links to some articles written for the Prince Albert Daily Herald.

Tow Truck Amy; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2013-01-17/article-3159125/Tow-Truck-Amy/1

Remembering Chrystal Rivet; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2013-01-30/article-3167441/Remembering-Chrystal-Rivet/1#

Man dies after being taken from hospital to cell; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2012-12-03/article-3132913/Man-dies-after-being-taken-from-hospital-to-cell/1

Canadian Challenge dog race - Tough trails and little sleep; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/Sports/2013-02-20/article-3181530/Tough-trails-and-little-sleep/1

Weightlifting – It’s a girl’s sport; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2013-01-06/article-3151383/Weightlifting-%26ndash%3B-It%26rsquo%3Bs-a-girl%26rsquo%3Bs-sport/1

Breaking the silence on residential schools with schools; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2012-11-30/article-3131679/Breaking-the-silence-on-residential-schools-with-schools/1

Remembrance Day ceremony acknowledges contribution of First Nation soldiers; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2012-11-12/article-3118995/Remembrance-ceremony-acknowledges-contribution-of-First-Nation-soldiers/1

If you do not believe that there is
any point in looking at the world beyond your own backyard or in telling the
stories of people who will never have the opportunity to tell their own
stories, then there is no point in funding this project. 
The purpose and point of journalism
and documentation can be argued about over a cup of coffee for hours and I will
be one of the first to raise my voice and say that I have doubts. That I do not
know if it really makes a difference. However I am compelled to do something.
To show what I see, to communicate the similarities and differences between
people and places in the hope that we will someday create a world of generosity
and patience, rather than fear and greed. 
“Indifference, indifference is the
strongest force. It makes everything it touches meaningless. Love, hate, don’t
stand a chance against it. It lets neglect and decay and monstrous injustice go
unchecked. It doesn’t act, it allows. And that’s what gives it so much power.” Joan d Vinge, ‘The Snow
Queen’
Thank
you
If you are able to help out financially, thank you. If not, that is fine too. Pass it on to someone else who might
be inspired and thank you again for your time and consideration. 
Below
are links to some articles written for the Prince Albert Daily Herald. 
Tow Truck Amy; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2013-01-17/article-3159125/Tow-Truck-Amy/1
Remembering Chrystal Rivet; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2013-01-30/article-3167441/Remembering-Chrystal-Rivet/1#
Man dies after being taken from hospital to
cell; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2012-12-03/article-3132913/Man-dies-after-being-taken-from-hospital-to-cell/1

Canadian Challenge dog race - Tough trails
and little sleep; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/Sports/2013-02-20/article-3181530/Tough-trails-and-little-sleep/1
Weightlifting – It’s a girl’s sport; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2013-01-06/article-3151383/Weightlifting-%26ndash%3B-It%26rsquo%3Bs-a-girl%26rsquo%3Bs-sport/1
Breaking the silence on residential schools
with schools; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2012-11-30/article-3131679/Breaking-the-silence-on-residential-schools-with-schools/1

Remembrance Day ceremony acknowledges
contribution of First Nation soldiers; http://www.paherald.sk.ca/News/2012-11-12/article-3118995/Remembrance-ceremony-acknowledges-contribution-of-First-Nation-soldiers/1

story: UPDATE PLEASE READ Campaign is CANCELLED - The backer that I had backing this project has decided not to back it any further and the manufacturer has come back to me raising the prices, making this no longer doable. I have contacted all those who have sent money to initiate a refund. I apologize for not being able to move forward to produce these mounts.

story:
Small business in a growing industry

After working for a company that has been in business for 7 years the owner has decided to move on and sale the company.  Its not everyday that you work for a company that you enjoy.  So a partner and I bought it.  We are a company looking to design and create the best game camera for our customers.  We are passionate about the wireless trail camera as we are about hunting. 

With limited technology in the trail camera there is always room for improvement.


100% of the funds will go to the growth and development of the camera.   Also providing a larger office space and warehouse.  The funds to design the camera and distribution is required to compensate for the minimal required order amount for production.   We are looking to design a more secure trail camera with GPS locator in the camera, added features and the ability to withstand all weather conditions.  Most trail cameras are starting to develop a more secured casing.  However, with the increase of trail cameras being used for security cameras GPS locators need to be installed in the camera.  An outdoor camera should be more secure itself.  Security for the security camera. 


Wireless trail cameras are increasingly monitoring your homes while you are at work.  With the capability to send photos to your phone or email when motion is detected in almost real time will ease your mind in the invent vandals come to your home unannounced.   

 

We have engineers that are ready to design our prototype for testing. We worked firsthand with the engineers and went over all the specs and are ready for prodction. 

 

Please, if you are unable to donate and are a advocate trail camera user please spread the word to help us keep our business around and with the growth of the trail camera design.  


Mike Bonner

story:
We’re creating a festival that puts our country’s finest on a platform for the world to notice. From coast to coast, we’re gathering the very best to congregate in Edmonton, AB. 

The inaugural Northern Lands: The Great Canadian Wine & Craft Beer Adventure (March 27-28, 2015) will be the most significant ALL Canadian wine and food festival ever held.

Over the past 20 years, the quality evolution of the wine, craft beer and craft spirits produced in Canada has been dramatic.  As Canadians, we can take pride in knowing that our country produces wine, beer and spirits comparable to the best in the world.

Yet, as Canadians we do not collectively celebrate the great quality being produced nor those responsible for the innovation and quality evolution we are experiencing and we certainly don’t boast about it to the rest of the world.  As a result, few beyond our borders are aware that we even have a growing and maturing wine and craft beverage industry, let alone the remarkable quality being produced.  We’re going to change that.


This festival will showcase Canada’s finest wine, craft beer, craft spirits and cider producers along with the best chefs, food producers and farmers. The festival will host a marquee grand tasting with winemakers/brewmasters and principals, educational seminars and tastings, intimate producer dinners and events, and an awards competition providing producers with local, national and international exposure.  Many of the most respected international and national wine and food writers have already committed to attending the festival to experience what will be the largest gathering of ALL Canadian wine producers, chefs and food producers.

Help us raise the profile of the Canadian wine, craft beverage and culinary industries locally, nationally and globally.

Your support will put independent Canadian producers responsible for industry innovation and quality on the world stage.  We should be proud of the quality our country is producing.  It’s time to tell the world.

Meet Your Makers (Saturday, March 28) is a marquee grand tasting showcasing over 60 of the best wineries, craft breweries and craft distillers in Canada.

Meet the winemakers, brewmasters and owners.  Taste the creations of Edmonton’s best chefs using products from local food producers and enjoy delicious offerings of some of Canada’s best chefs including Vikram Vij (Vij’s; the newest dragon on CBC’s Dragon’s Den; judge on Chopped Canada), Dale MacKay (Ayden; winner of Top Chef Canada season 1) and Justin Leboe (Model Milk).  

Use of Funds

What the funds will be used for: sponsor the chefs, support the purchase of products from local food producers and farmers for the chefs to use in their culinary creations to be served at the event, support the festival’s efforts to gain national and international exposure for our local chefs and food producers and wineries by assisting with the travel and accommodation for national and international food and wine writers.

The festival will also raise funds for the next generation by splitting all net proceeds from the Meet Your Makers Grand Tasting on March 28 between two local community organizations: the High School Culinary Challenge (provides scholarship and apprenticeship opportunities to young people wishing to pursue a career in the culinary field, thus ensuring the sustainability of the industry) and the Edmonton Community Foundation Grateful Palate Fund (an endowment fund that grants to charities whose main purpose is to feed people). 

Northern Lands is supported and locally organized by the following group of enthusiastic wine and beer adventurers: 

Gurvinder Bhatia
Aimee Hill
Derek Weisbeck
Jerri Cairns
Bonnie Malouin
Nils Skalin
Aleisha Bartier
Spike Maynard
Natasha Susylinski
Steve Derpack
Phil Wilson
Kendall Barber
Simon Smotkowicz
Blair Lebsack
Caitlin Fulton
Jennifer Cockrall-King
Nate Box
Daniel Braun
Dwayne Pohranychny
Todd Babiak
Chris Labossiere
Greg Zeschuk
Dawn Harrison
Paul Shufelt
Jenny Lawrence

story:
Newtown Baking is the place in Staunton for fresh baked artisan breads, pastries, and locally roasted coffee. And now it is our mission to bring the best Wood-Fired Pizza to the Queen City.

We received the Bright Ideas Innovation Grant* from the Staunton Downtown Development Association earlier this year to help fund some of the cost associated with building and installing a traditional wood-fired oven. It is our goal to raise the rest of what is needed in the next 30 days via this fundraising campaign.

We have a lot of fun and tasty gifts for our donors, so please check out our video to learn more about this exciting and delicious endeavor! 

Thank you in advance for all your support! 

Please visit our website and Facebook page for more info. 

Learn more about the Bakery and the Bright Ideas Grant HERE & HERE.

A HUGE THANK YOU to THE JUDY CHOPS for helping to make this project so much cooler than we could have. Check out their website and get their new album!!! 

                             PLEASE LIKE, SHARE, and GIVE WHAT YOU CAN! 
                                       Every little bit helps! Thank you!!!

*The BRIGHT IDEA Innovation Grants, were spearheaded by the Staunton Downtown Development Association (SDDA). The $5,000 commercial grant awarded to Newtown Baking was funded by a $2,500 Virginia Main Street Downtown Improvement Grant through the SDDA and $2,500 in matching funding from the Staunton Department of Economic Development (SDED).  The Staunton Creative Community Fund contributed with in-kind consulting services.
