story:
Short Summary

The Women's Housing Coalition was started by women to support other women who were experiencing homelessness. Since 1979, we have been housing and working with women who were homeless who want to take control of their lives and need help to lead stable lives for the rest of their lives. Last year, 121 women and 46 kids had a safe place to call home and a pathway to progress for themselves and their children. Each year, about 25 women move out on their own, and 25 new women join our program looking for stability. 

As of October 15, we have 15 women set to move in by the end of the year! Help us get everything in place for a fresh start for these ladies.

What We Need

Here are all the pieces we need for each person moving in:

  • $313.50 - Mattress & Cover (to prevent bed bugs - NOBODY likes bed bugs)
  • $25 - Lock Box & Spare Key (many of our residents are living with chronic mental and physical health issues, so we give everyone a lock box with a spare key so that even on the "bad" days they can get into their home)
  • $50 - Welcome Basket (a little touch of hospitality to set each new resident up for success - includes things like new sheets, towels, deodorant, laundry detergent, etc.)
That's $388.50 to get each new resident started. Help us make sure these ladies have a home for the holidays.

The Impact

The lives of women and children who have been through the trauma of homelessness are transformed at Women's Housing Coalition. By providing the stability of safe, affordable permanent housing, and supportive services, our women and families gain the skills and confidence to keep that stability for themselves for the rest of their lives.

For one family in our program, this fall was the fourth consecutive year that the kids went to the same school – a first. Her eldest has even started taking courses at Baltimore City Community College (BCCC). Before coming to the Women’s Housing Coalition, Marissa’s kids (two teenage girls and one 7 year-old boy) changed schools every year because of their housing in stability.

Here are a few more stories:

  • Tammi is a middle aged woman who not only is two years clean and sober, but recently obtained her GED. She is now participating in a Certified Nursing Assistant program so that she can work with the elderly.
  • Jasmine went from volunteer to paid part-time staff member at her volunteer activity site. They are so pleased with her performance that she just received her first pay raise.
  • Four children from our program are attending college this year. Trevor and Turika were accepted and chose from multiple schools. Both Turika and Dalila are first-year students at BCCC, while Diamond has entered her second year in culinary college.
Stable thriving people makes for stable thriving families makes for stable thriving communities in the Greatest City in America.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge to meeting this goal is reaching people. Our women are remarkable. We just want people to know that - to know them - to know that any support makes a difference.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    TO GIVE - The superpower with which we can help many.

    Not everyone can donate, but everyone can give.

    • Thumbs Up - Like and Share The Women's Housing Coalition on Facebook to let people know about our remarkable residents
    • Welcome Baskets - Donate NEW items for the Welcome Baskets (See list at www.WomensHousing.org/Welcome
    • Make Some Noise - tell your friends about Women's Housing Coalition. Use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
www.MillsOrganicHills.com

We are dedicated to helping others afford the food they need most. The next step in the availability of organic food for the average person, is helping your local farmer. Give us what we need to help others.

Note: we are not a non-profit organisation. 




     We have a dual purpose goal, it starts with our decision to go all organic, and our drive to help the poor. We want to make organic successful, but not lose our humanity in the process. So we have made the decision to give 1/10 of our flock to the poor every year. This means that we will give 1 lamb out of every 10 lambs to the poor. So the goal is to make organic run on 90% of its total income. The remaining 10% goes to charity.

     Like sheep we need the flock, we need to work as a community. The power of our flock can change lives, it can give more to the community in ways that one person possibly could. 

     We have seen communities step forward and change lives for the better. That is our goal, to change lives for the better. We desire to help, and to help those that are in need. For every 10 lambs that come to our Ranch, we set aside one for charity. This female sheep is dedicated as breeding stock for the local charity, instead of her offspring going to market, they are given to those who are in need: the disabled, low income seniors, single mothers, veterans, and organizations that distribute food to the hungry.  This is who we are for and the causes we are dedicated to. 





     We need to increase the operation that we already have. This means we need to determine what it would take to be able to produce 10 lambs a year for charity. 

     It worked out that you can support 10 sheep on 1 acre of good pasture land. So we decided to separate the fundraiser into 10 parts. In essence we have 10 goals. 

     

     1. We needed to determine the price per acre for land. After doing a lot of research, we found that it can be purchased for $5,000. (especially if we have cash to offer.)

     2. We had to determine what it would cost to purchase the sheep. Sheep in our area are going for somewhere around $200-$300 a lamb. The price can vary, based on the breed of sheep. We have chosen a Suffolk breed, it is common in our area, and is affordable, considering how much meat this particular breed produces. If we put 10 sheep on an acre that means 1 lamb for the poor and 9 for the Ranch, that would put us around $3000 per acre.

     3. Living costs etc... are going to be around $2000 per acre. If we buy land, most likely we will have to build the living quarters ourselves. This cost will be low because Michael Mills will be doing all the labor.





     We are a couple with 4 children, who are dedicated to their well being. This makes our motivation to be all Organic even more important. This adds accountability to our Ranch.  We don't use any chemical's even the most mild, as they could harm our children's health. Both of our sons have developmental disorders: the eldest of the boys (Joe) has Autistic Spectrum Disorder and the second boy (Isaiah) has forms of Dyspraxia. Because of their developmental delays, it is not wise to use even the mildest chemical on our Ranch. This is one of the greatest reasons why we are fully committed  to the organic, all natural movement, it is because of our children, and our commitment to those children that we can help.

     We have bills to pay just like you, so we feel for the average consumer. We have 4 children to supply for, 2 with developmental disorders, and 1 that was a 7 month old preemie. They all have special requirements, and they are all very precious to us. We can't stress this point enough, we are not a typical business or corporation, but a business run by real people that really care. Visit: www.millsorganichills.com for more.




We have a set of gifts that we want to offer to you for donating to this cause. Take a look at the following:




This is the most important gift you can give. We see your support as one of the highest gifts available. So We Give You Our Thanks.




This is one of the joys of owning animals, you get to know them, and then based on what you know about them, you name them. We want to make this experience available to you today.




You will receive an actual rams horn that has been made into a musical horn. This kit will also include a DVD on how to blow the rams horn. It will be narrated by Michael Mills, (farm owner).



This will give us the ability to give one lamb's worth of meat to a homeless shelter or to someone in need. We will take the lamb to the slaughter house, and have it prepared for the needy. We will then deliver it in your name.




This is one of the most powerful ways that you can give. If you donate $10,000 we will guarantee that a local charity has one lamb a year given to them for life. These are our passion gifts, one that has also driven us to do the same. We currently are setup to give 3 lambs a year to a local charity. Please, assist us in our efforts.

We think that food is the most precious of gifts, and organic is best. We strive to see a world not deprived of real food.


GIVE TODAY!!

This makes our motivation to be all Organic even more important. This
adds accountability to our Ranch. 
We don't
use any chemical's even the most mild, as they could harm our
children's health. Both of our sons have developmental
disorders: the eldest of the boys (Joe) has Autistic Spectrum
Disorder and the second boy (Isaiah) has forms of Dyspraxia. Because
of their developmental delays, it is not wise to use even the mildest
chemical on our Ranch. This is one of the greatest reasons why we are
fully committed  to the organic, all natural movement, it is
because of our children, and
our commitment to those children that we can help.


     We
have bills to pay just like you, so we feel for the average consumer.
We have 4 children to supply for, 2 with developmental disorders, and
1 that was a 7 month old preemie.
They all have special requirements, and they are all very precious to
us. We can't stress this point enough, we are not a typical business
or
corporation,
but a business run by real people that really care. Visit: www.millsorganichills.com for more.


We have a set of gifts that we want to offer to you for donating to this cause. Take a look at the following:




This is the most important gift you can give. We see your support as one of the highest gifts available. So We Give You Our Thanks.
This is one of the joys of owning animals, you get to know them, and then based on what you know about them, you name them. We want to make this experience available to you today.

You will receive an actual rams horn that has been made into a musical horn. This kit will also include a DVD on how to blow the rams horn. It will be narrated by Michael Mills, (farm owner).This will give us the ability to give one lamb's worth of meat to a homeless shelter or to someone in need. We will take the lamb to the slaughter house, and have it prepared for the needy. We will then deliver it in your name.



This is one of the most powerful ways that you can give. If you donate $10,000 we will guarantee that a local charity has one lamb a year given to them for life. These are our passion gifts, one that has also driven us to do the same. We currently are setup to give 3 lambs a year to a local charity. Please, assist us in our efforts.
We think that food is the most precious of gifts, and organic is best. We strive to see a world not deprived of real food.GIVE TODAY!!

story:
Hello,

I want to manufacture mousy and similar toys for children.

I will keep price 5$ only so that all can buy it without any money problem.

Shipping will be free in India, but i need to charge for shipping outside India.

In photo it is just a demo, real product will be more clean and perfect.

I firstly will start in Ludhiana,India.

If i get good response then my next place will be New Delhi.

People from anywhere can buy it online and those who are from Ludhiana can buy it from our outlet.

Thank you

story:
We started as an idea by some parents and teachers at Elwick Community School who wanted a place to meet, share ideas, and have access to some basic resources. At first all we had was a room in the school that people could meet in once in a while but over the last 17 years this small idea has blossomed and grown into a vital, meaningful part of the community. What was once just an idea has become a grass roots independent not for profit and we are in danger of losing our ability to continue to provide the level and quality of resources and programs to the people who matter most, all of you.

We are a safe, nurturing, welcoming place for families and individuals to access all sorts of resources from basic food security through our “Helping Hands Pantry” to social well-being through our “Empowering Yourself Everyday” (E.Y.E.) Series Workshops. To see more of the sorts of programs we run, photos etc please check out our website at www.elwickvillage.org  

You can be a part of keeping this centre alive and vibrant.

So brass tacks what we need is $60,000 plus dollars to keep the place running. The reason why is because one of our funders for the last three years was a short term provincial government program that is ending this March. We didn’t do anything wrong, the community isn’t in less need or any less worthy, the funds just no longer exist.

What do you get for donating? Well beyond the obvious benefits of being able to help out this great organization and being an awesome human being you will receive some great perks that you can see on the side here.

Everyone who donates even $1 will get a special thank you on our website and in our social media. For those able to do a little more we have some really great things including gifts from some of our artist friends out there in the world Chris Walters, Ursula Neufeld and Nereo ll.

One of the great things about this campaign is that even if we do not reach our complete goals here on IndieGoGo every dime donated will still be used for exactly what we are proposing. We will use that money to keep the place going at full strength and keep searching for sustainable funding.

What it means if we don’t find new funds

  • Programming will be cut from 6 days a week to 3 or 4 partial days
  • Less access to essential needs such as food and clothing
  • Less access to outside resources
  • Less access to advocacy and capacity building
  • Less programming

            · for families

            · for children

            · for youth

            · for crime prevention

            · for personal empowerment

If you aren’t able to give monetarily that is ok you can still help out. Spread the word; tell your friends and family, share about us on Facebook and other social media, donate a piece of artwork or time in a class you are teaching that we can offer as a perk, like us on Facebook, check out our website, swing by for a coffee and tell us that Elwick Village matters. We are looking forward to continuing to be a vibrant part of this great community for a long time to come.

At Elwick Village & Resource Centre, we consider ourselves and the centre to be a safe, welcoming and nurturing environment and an LGBT Ally. This means that we recognize that difference, in all its forms enriches our community and we reject types of discrimination. We respect and welcome all persons, regardless of their age, culture, race, religion, perceived or actual sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression.

Above photo is of the perk original artwork by Nereo ll

Above photo are some samples of the hand painted reusable tote bags and T-shirt designed and made by the kids of Elwick Village. There are 3 options to receive one or more of these items as a perk for your donation  :)

Stay tuned for more photos of some of the other perks to come...

story:
In September 1995, roughly 50,000 people, mostly women, streamed into Beijing for the Fourth World Conference on Women with a single purpose in mind: gender equality and the empowerment of all women, everywhere. The conference gave birth to the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, the most progressive blueprint ever for advancing women’s rights.

This year, hundreds of organizations from around the world will convene at the UN Headquarters in New York to review the Beijing Platform for Action and move forward. It is the first conference of its kind since 1995.

NO LIMITS FOR WOMEN is a project of the Re-Evaluation Counseling Community, a grassroots peer-counseling organization that trains people of all backgrounds to assist one another in healing from the emotional scars of oppression. By taking turns listening to another and encouraging emotional release, we heal old wounds and become better able to think, to speak out, to organize, and to lead others in building a world in which no group of people is dehumanized.

This year, NO LIMITS FOR WOMEN, will partner with, learn from, and offer our peer-counseling tools, to organizations that work towards gender equality and the empowerment of women.

The sessions we'll be offering include:

• YOUNG WOMEN ENDING SEXISM WITH YOUNG MEN AS ALLIES

• WOMEN ENDING RACISM

• MEN ENDING SEXISM AND MALE DOMINATION

• WOMEN ENDING SEXUAL VIOLENCE TOWARDS WOMEN, WITH MEN AS ALLIES

• WOMEN AND MEN IN PARTNERSHIP TO END SEXISM AND MALE DOMINATION

• WOMEN AND LEADERSHIP

Our work has spread to over 90 countries, and we're excited to be bringing a diverse delegation of experienced Re-Evaluation Counselors from around the world.

In order to do that, we will be raising $40-50K. These funds will cover flights, lodging, meals, and conference participation. Our foundation is non-profit, and all donations are tax-deductible.

For information about our work, visit our site at https://www.rc.org/tile/nolimits

Below is a video of one of our guys, talking about how our tools have helped him become more effective in our joint efforts towards equality and the empowerment of women.

story:
Hi my name is Ruth

I want to raise funds to start a business, as this has been my dream for many years.

I would like to start a business make money to help myself, family, friends and those in need.

the funds raised will help start my fashion business,selling bags,shoes,clothes......at an affordable price, I want as many people as possible to be able to wear the latest fashions.

I will also help my family financially, my family need money to pay for many things like medication, bills.

I would also use some of the funds to help people in need of money, for instance to help them with food,electricity bills so they wont stave or be cold this winter, I also want to help people who are in debt, I am very passionate in helping people, and your funds will help me achieve my goal.

every amount given is very much appreciated and will be used wisely.

Thank you for your support

story:
My Campaign - (Read the Full Story Below)


I began playing professionally in Trinidad for Zenith Volleyball School last summer and it was a great experience. I made the team through an open tryout that was held in Boston, MA. Zenith was only giving out three contracts and I was lucky enough to battle my way to one of three. 

When I flew into Trinidad and got to their practice facility I soon realized why they only gave out 3 contracts, and it was because they are a community program. What that means is that they distribute all incoming money into each of their programs, so when funds begin to shorten they focus on making sure their youth programs stay afloat.

Zenith takes in many at risk youth and teaches them the game of volleyball in order to provide them with something positive in their lives. This is something that I really took to, because I grew up as an inner city youth, so seeing what Zenith was doing for their community caused me to take that much more pride in my position on their professional men's team. 

I also learned why they came to the states looking for players in the first place. It was their last effort to revamp their professional men's team. See, the problem when running a club that thrives on sponsorships is that you need to continually do well in order to keep those sponsorships. Well, fifteen years ago Zenith was the best men's team in Trinidad, which afforded them the ability to give back to their community. 

But slowly over the years other clubs began to accumulate better and better teams eventually dethroning Zenith of their long held reign as the country's best club. Now Zenith is looking to get back on top and I want to help, because they realized that they need to succeed on the court in order to continue to better the lives of the kids and people off of it. 

Here's where you come in… By donating to my campaign you can help me recruit more foreign players to Trinidad. Now you may ask why can't they just get players from Trinidad? The reason that they're having a hard time doing that is because the five other major clubs in Trinidad have more funds to provide to their players and continually acquire the best talent from the lesser funded clubs. 

In order to sway the tide we need to bring talent from somewhere else and the closest place to get it is in the United States. The reason being that we are one of the only countries that do not have professional volleyball. So getting young players from the US is easier since we have nothing here after college to play in. 

Me and the other two foreigners that were brought in last year made a huge difference, but this league is comprised of the best that Trinidad has to offer, so in order to reach our goal we need to bring in some more talent. To do this we need money, and this campaign is my last effort to get the funds we need. 

We're close to building a team that will put Zenith back on top and solidify their positive impact on their community. On top of all of this, it gives Zenith a professional team that will make their youth teams proud and give them something to strive for. Something that will inspire them... and like I said if I could inspire one kid it would mean the world to me.

 I hope you will donate to my campaign and remember that your money will be used to help Zenith and myself build a team that has the opportunity to make a difference. 

Thank you again for your interest in my campaign.

- Matt Talamantes

story:
Summary of BN F45 #6644

Many steam locomotives were placed in museums and parks, yet people scratched their heads wondering why no one saved a streamlined NYC Hudson. Quite a few E and F diesel units have been saved, and due to the actions of those who spared them from the scrapper's torch, folks are able to appreciate them at the upcoming epic Streamliners gathering at the NC Transportation Museum in Spencer, NC.

What about the next generation of locomotives following the F-unit era? There are plenty of SD40-2s around; in fact, one recently became part of the collection in Pomona in place of the Big Boy locomotive that moved to Cheyenne, WY. Meanwhile, there is one locomotive worthy of your attention: a Burlington Northern F45 diesel locomotive, the second-to-last F45 ever built, and time is critical.

BN F45 #6644 was built in April, 1971. Ordered by Burlington Northern and delivered in its "Cascade" green paint scheme with white stripes, it was used primarily in freight service, but BN F45s have been known to pull Amtrak North Coast Hiawatha trains across Montana, Idaho and Washington. Montana Rail Link, a regional railroad, acquired this unit and renumbered it MRL 390 for use in freight service on their lines. MRL 390 made its last hurrah on a trip to Southern California in 2006, traversing Tehachapi Loop and the Columbia River Gorge.

There are three BN F45 locomotives remaining; two in Livingston, Montana, and one on the NYSW in New York. There are no known plans to preserve any of them, yet folks on rail forums have expressed interest that at least one should be saved. Scrap has been the talk for the one in NY; scrap is the fate of the two in Montana, unless we as the railfan community step in to make a difference.

A group of people came together to acquire a former ATSF F45 for display in Great Northern colors in Essex, MT. Had a GN F45 been saved, they would have been able to display an authentic GN unit on GN territory. The same thing may happen to future BN enthusiasts in 20 years, hoping to present BN heritage in the form of black and green paint with white stripes, but without an authentic BN unit to use.

Photos of BN 6644 / MRL 390:

http://www.railpictures.net/viewphoto.php?id=436372

http://www.railpictures.net/viewphoto.php?id=63416

http://www.railpictures.net/viewphoto.php?id=63415

http://www.railpictures.net/viewphoto.php?id=429747

http://www.railpictures.net/viewphoto.php?id=420130

http://www.railpictures.net/viewphoto.php?id=116695

Where we're at today:

Dynamic Rail Preservation Inc., a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization http://www.dynarail.org has an opportunity to acquire BN F45 #6644. Since the locomotive is under contract for scrap, we have until Monday, May 26, 2014 to inform the owner that we would enter an agreement to purchase the locomotive.

  • Our goal is to raise $75,000 to acquire, relocate and repaint BN #6644.
  • If the goal to preserve #6644 is not met, funds that do come through to us will be dedicated towards the restoration of a similar diesel locomotive on our roster, SDP40F (SDF40-2) Amtrak #644. The Amtrak unit is in need of metal fabrication work on the front, and a Phase I "Pointless Arrow" paint job. See http://dynarail.org/projects/amtrak644.html
  • Due to the nature of this short notice, a location to preserve BN 6644 has yet to be determined. We've reached out to Livingston Depot to gauge their interest, and will be looking to contact other organizations who may be interested in having a neat locomotive on display in their collection. DynaRail Board of Directors is open to suggestions on where #6644 could be cared for and best displayed.
  • Your donation is tax deductible! Donors who contribute $500+ will be individually recognized through a plaque mounted on the locomotive.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

  • An EMD F45 may not look like much today, but future generations will appreciate seeing a piece of history from Burlington Northern's 70-80s era, and MRL's 90-00s era. 
  • Just imagine a "Cowl's Gathering" of diesel locomotives in the future, similar to what NC Transportation Museum did for the Norfolk Southern heritage units, and now the upcoming lineup at Streamliners. 

Contact us at http://dynarail.org/contactus.htm if you have questions or other means to contribute to the cause.

This is likely our last opportunity to preserve a BN F45 locomotive, unless someone steps up to save the one from scrap in NY. Contribute, spread the word and help make a difference!

story:
Atlanta ranks among the top 14 cities in the nation for commercial sexual exploitation of children. In 2007 (the last year for which key data was available), Atlanta's underground sex economy netted $290 million from an extensive network of prostitution. Worldwide, the sex trade industry produces almost $10 billion annually.

It's numbers like these that keep Hillary DeJarnett up at night. As co-founder and program director of Haven ATL, a nonprofit with a mission to end sex trafficking in metro Atlanta and beyond, DeJarnett and her team, including co-founder Sandra Pobjie-Pawar, work to help women go from victims of abuse to leaders in their communities.

"These girls are powerful," DeJarnett says. "They're smart. They're intelligent. They just really need support and they need to be held accountable and have a place to grow, so that's what we try to do."

The idea for Haven came to DeJarnett in 2011 while working on her master's thesis in nonprofit management at the University of Georgia. The assignment turned into a full-time job after DeJarnett presented the idea to Pobjie-Pawar. The pair officially established Haven ATL that summer as a program of the Salvation Army (DeJarnett's parents are Salvation Army officers).

Haven ATL assists women, girls, and transgendered individuals of all ages who have experienced exploitation. Local shelters, including Salvation Army's Red Shield Downtown, which has transgender dorms and houses same-sex families in need, among other things, refers victims of commercial sexual exploitation directly to Haven. While the shelters provide housing in the evening, Haven ATL works around the clock to get the women back on their feet with counseling, education, and job training.

Haven ATL currently operates out of the Salvation Army's 53,000-square-foot Ray and Joan Kroc Corps Community Center in the Pittsburgh neighborhood. Later this year, Haven ATL will move into its own drop-in center and offices. The donated house, also in Pittsburgh, will provide a more intimate setting where the 20 women involved in Haven ATL will be able to experience its services under one roof, including counseling and mentorship, job training, cooking classes, yoga, and voluntary Bible study, among other things. There's a community garden in the backyard, where the women have been working together, learning about farming, and developing a sense of pride in how their landscaping work is paying off.

"I think the house is truly going to be that haven for the women," DeJarnett says. "That place that they can come and know that they are safe and know that they are loved."

As part of Creative Loafing's Do Good Campaign, a series of grassroots partnerships with local organizations, we're collaborating with Haven ATL to raise funds to renovate the new drop-in center and help landscape the yard and garden. Do Good partner the Home Depot Foundation will match the money raised with in-kind donations up to $2,500. All funds raised and matching donations from Home Depot Foundation will go directly to Haven ATL in support of the Pittsburgh drop-in center.

Haven's relationship to the Salvation Army initially raised concerns for us at Creative Loafing because of instances of the organization's reported discrimination toward the LGBT community. Creative Loafing is a strong supporter of gay rights and the fight for equal rights in which the LGBT community is engaged.

"I know that there have been issues in the past that have been brought up with the Salvation Army, but those were isolated instances and I can assure you that the Salvation Army does not discriminate in who we serve as reflected in our mission statement. Our shelter in Atlanta actually has specific services for Transgendered homeless individuals. Haven ATL has served LGBT individuals and we want to continue to champion serving individuals regardless of their background," DeJarnett said in an email earlier this spring. "My hope was that this [Do Good] partnership would help bridge and repair the relationship between the LGBT community and the Salvation Army — it could open the door for reconciliation and positive change."

Pam, a former madam who turned to the sex trade after her family was displaced by Hurricane Katrina, sought help at Haven after being arrested. Pam works with DeJarnett's team to reach out to individuals in the community who may be too afraid or ashamed to seek help. She's now one of the organization's community leaders and helps get women, girls, and transgendered individuals out of the industry rather than into it.

"I kept trying to do it by myself and I kept falling back into it," she says. "If you're already thinking about changing, [Haven ATL is] the place to actually make it happen."

story:
Who We Are And Why This Is Important

 

While studying abroad with this semester through CIEE in Guanajuato, Mexico, we started a relationship with the Colectivo T.A.N. 473, a non-profit that works with marginalized youth, giving art workshops and literacy sessions. Using the CamiónArte – a Classroom on Wheels to reach children – volunteers bring all the materials and workshop leaders to the places where they are needed most. We have volunteered as English tutors and in events reading books to children in the communities that this organization serves.  As CIEE semester abroad students, we believe that literacy programs should be accessible to every child in Guanajuato, and this project is doing just that, one community at a time.

Literacy & Life Skills taught in a Mobile, Digital Classroom! 

That is what we hope to accomplish with this campaign! With your support we can create a digital library & classroom component to accompany the print collection and portable workshop that is housed in CamiónArte. We hope to purchase 10 Kindles (for children). We will stock them with books and educational apps to provide us with yet one more way to engage our children as well as encourage discovery, learning and literacy. 

We are great fans of Mind in the Making! What once was a book, and now an educational movement, focuses on research that examines the direct correlation between executive function skills and success in school & life. We hope to follow their newReading List and tipsfor instruction of the7 essential Life skillsthat all children need to develop. 


Your support will help us build the Digital Component of our mobile classroom & library AND stock it up with wonderful books that not only instill a love of reading but also will help to develop cognitive abilities and emotional intelligence.

Who is the Colectivo T.A.N. 473?

We are a group of people who are committed to working with our community in Guanajuato, Gto, Mexico. We use our diverse educational backgrounds and skill sets to create new opportunities for learning for youth living in underserved communities. We are dedicated to providing children with dynamic experiences that encourage them to learn and love learning. 

The Context

Early childhood brain development takes place across a wide range of social, emotional and cognitive dimensions. One key area of development occurs in terms of language and literacy. Language and literacy encompasses a child’s ability to express their wants and needs, understand a growing vocabulary, and establishes the foundation for developing comfort with reading. Early reading practices can be established very early in life. Early reading, in turn, gives a child a leg up on academic success.

Unfortunately, not all children have high quality early childhood literacy experiences. Researchers have found that while there are more than a dozen books per child in middle-income neighborhoods, in low-income neighborhoods the ratio is closer to one book for every three hundred children.Compounding these differences, low-income families engage in much less conversation and use smaller vocabularies when talking with their children. The result is that there are stark differences in the early exposure to reading of different groups of children. In low-income families, time as well as money are scarce, and books may be considered a costly luxury.

In turn, children from low-income families are further disadvantaged when it comes to early exposure to reading. This, in turn, creates massive reading readiness gaps between even the youngest children. By age three, children from wealthier families have typically heard 30 million more words than children from low-income families.When they reach school, children from low-income families have one-fourth the vocabulary of children from wealthier homes.By the time children from low-income families enter kindergarten, they are 12-14 months below national norms in language and pre-reading skills.

Taken from Urban Child Institute


What is Project CamiónArte?

Remember back to the days of the Book-Mobile? Have you seen these great startups popping up all over (especially the west coast) where education initiatives are housed in vehicles instead of buildings so that learning opportunities go to the students instead of the older model?  

Well, El CamiónArte (translating to The Art Truck) is both! This is a great collaboration between Do Good As You Go and Colectivo T.A.N. 473 to bring a library, educational programming and creative exploration to youth in under-served communities in Guanajuato, GTO.

Who benefits from the program? Children, families and their communities...      

On a weekly basis, we visit and provide programming for roughly 70 children!      

El CamiónArte concentrates its programming on three AWESOME groups of children and teens. One is a boys home located in Irapuato. The other two are colonias (neighborhoods) of the city of Guanajuato. Each group is distinct in their group dynamic and individual life experiences. But they share a certain few  important qualities. Where they live,  geographically and economically, there is a void of after-school enrichment programs (or even basic adult supervision in many cases).  The youth, their families and the community as a whole are ALL benefiting from the consistent presence and programming that CamiónArte is providing!


What are the objectives? Creativity + Education = Change

Do Good As You Go and Colectivo T.A.N. 473 see CamiónArte as a great example of when global and local organizations, as well as individuals, collaborate to yield a  positive impact on communities! Through combined programming and project management, we look to involve the best of both perspectives and knowledge bases. We are moving towards a model of an after-school program that follows the S.T.E.A.M. movement: Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Math, along with a fully stocked old-school and digital library to improve and encourage literacy. CamiónArte will utilize local focuses (art, literacy & math) and relationships and connect Do Good As You Go’s expansive curricula and volunteer network to offer diverse and progressive educational experiences to the youth of Guanajuato.


How does CamiónArte work? Who makes the room "roll"?

This project is truly a labor of love. The development of the classroom in a jeep, projects and workshops, the development of the library and the ability to continue connecting communities we serve, have been achieved through donations and volunteer support. Volunteers of Do Good As You Go are from around the world and bring varying skills, desires to help the community and generous monetary support. Additionally, there are DEDICATED local volunteers who give workshops, seek donations of books and articles of art and money to fill up the jeep and keep rolling!

What Your Contribution Means

$5  - Book. One book added to the CamiónArte library!

$25 - Library Supporter!  This donation will help us purchase books (print & digital) for the CamiónArte. 

$80 - Tank of gas. One tank of gas for our book mobile! The book mobile is typically filled up every 2 weeks.

$125 - Kindle. With this contribution, we would be able to buy a kindle so children  will be able to have an extended digital library, whether at home, at school, or with friends.

$400 - Mind in the Making (book set). Mind in the Making is a complete book set that offers seven different life skills: focus and self control, perspective-taking, communicating, making connections, critical thinking, taking on challenges, and self-directed engaged learning. http://mindinthemaking.org/firstbook/

Creativity Counts Club

Join our club Creativity supporting individual and collective creativity of children and youth who are beneficiary of this project. There are two ways to be part of it: http://colectivotan473.com/apoyanos/donar/

story:
Hello!

My name is Ludmil. I am inventor, researcher, life explorer and visioner.

My vision and my dream is to bring simple, cheap, Earth friendly and sustainable solutions for a humanity that lives in peace with Nature. Yes, I always envision humanity living sustainable and simple life, as one people, in harmony with nature and themselves.

Sprouts and greens are the best food choice for the future generations - they are pure, organic and contain all the required minerals, enzymes and vitamines to keep the body in perfect health. They can be a medicine as well - with their help we reversed and completely cured my son's tooth Decay, see the story.

After 4 years of extensive research, testing and development I came out with a cheap tabletop automatic hydroponic system that provides abundance of green food all year round, for the whole family. The unit manufacturing cost would cost about $50 and will provide sprouts and greens for the whole family for as less as $5 per month! One can grow almost anything in it, even mushrooms. It can be used anywhere and would be a life saver in the third world countries, where people live with less than $3 per day.

Your donation will allow me to improve the design and put this invention into production.

Here you can see fresh broccoly sprouts, right from the sprouter. They are delicious and very healthy.

The machine is stackable - you can stack up to 3 containers one over the other doubling and trippeling the production

Here are sunflower and alfalfa greens, grown into the sprouter.

In the mikroferma sprouter one can grow Mushrooms! Shiitake - delicious, and very healthy.

story:
The Bonfire Coffeehouse is a worker-owned and self-managed cafe, bookstore and all-ages show space committed to providing radical and alternative books and literature, ethically sourced food and drinks, and a friendly, open social space in Santa Barbara.

The space is run by a consensus-based collective promoting the principles of mutual aid, autonomy and direct action.
story_txt:
The Bonfire Coffeehouse is a worker-owned and self-managed cafe, bookstore and all-ages show space committed to providing radical and alternative books and literature, ethically sourced food and drinks, and a friendly, open social space in Santa Barbara.
The space is run by a consensus-based collective promoting the principles of mutual aid, autonomy and direct action.

story:
gas·tro·pub

: a bar that specializes in serving high-quality beer and food.

It has been almost two years since we opened our doors to the wonderful people of Greer and your support has been overwhelming. Since day one, our goal has been to give locals a good place to get great beer. We take pride in the experience we build for our customers with our knowledgeable and helpful staff, fun and relaxing environment, and, of course, 60 rotating craft beers on tap. 

Now we are asking for everyone to get involved in making The Southern Growl even better.. I know, I know, you're wondering how that's even possible..

We are growing out of the small space we have right now, which you've probably noticed. We are now in the works of combining our current space with the vacancy next door. This will give us the opportunity to triple indoor seating, build a patio deck outside, provide more unique games, and, best of all, we are adding a KITCHEN! We are the beer experts as we always say, so we are bringing in local food expert and our good friend Joey McCarter to head up the food side of things. We're so glad to be working with Joey, especially because he has a knack for making great food that tastes best along side a great beer.

The Southern Growl Gastropub will be a laid back casual place, just as it is now. The beer will be as good as always and the food will be the perfect compliment. Our concept was inspired by the food trucks that frequent craft beer hubs around the country. You will order your food at a window from a concise, rotating menu, representing many cultures and flavors. Ingredients will be local when possible, seasonal, and obviously delicious. Our hours will not change much at first; we will be open for dinner everyday and eventually we plan to be open early for brunch on Saturday and Sunday!

A little give.. and a little get..

We are working toward $15,000 in contributions through Indiegogo in order to supplement our existing investments. 

Funds raised will go to purchasing supplies for our kitchen.. things like an oven, a griddle, a stove, a hood, shelving, prep tables, pots, pans, knives and whatever other small stuff we can squeeze out of those dollars to make the most of your contributions.

We have so many great perks for you to choose when you offer up your support..

Matt's obvious favorite is the Ultimate Tasting Experience..You get a 5 oz pour of each of the 60 beers on tap, all at once on the ultimate flight paddle! Bring as many friends as you want and we'll throw in 3 appetizers, plus free soda all night for your DD.

Joey is our awesome chef and, of course, his favorite perk is the Meal to Remember.. for $150 you and a guest get to enjoy a five course beer pairing dinner. Come hungry, thirsty, and ready to indulge.

Anna suggests the Cocktail Hour perk.. You can bring a date ($50) or not ($30) to an exclusive party. We'll start off your beer tab with $15 a person and our chef will be making some killer hor d’oeuvres.

Jason always says, "A beer a day keeps the doctor away", so the Pint Night..Every Night is simply perfect! This is our biggest perk with the biggest possibilities. It lasts you years and years, all the way to the end of 2020.. unless the world ends, then you better drink more sooner! Every pint, every time.. $1 off

Josh wants you to Sponsor a Stool.. Your name will be permanently displayed on a stool that will probably be in the bar until the end of time. We can only fit so many stools, so get it while it lasts!

Andy loves them all.. and if you're really excited, just buy one of each! When you help us out, you get a little something back in return! Every contribution helps us reach our goal.

You will receive an emailed voucher for your purchase. If you need your items shipped to you, no problem.. just reply to that email and let us know the address (U.S. Only).

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Use the Indiegogo share tools, send emails, yell to your neighbors from your front porch.. it all helps!

And as always, you can show your support by stopping in for a beer or two and inviting your friends!

pans, knives and whatever other small stuff we can squeeze out of those dollars to make the most of your contributions.
We have so many great perks for you to choose when you offer up your support.. 
Matt's obvious favorite is the Ultimate Tasting Experience..You get a 5 oz pour of each of the 60 beers on tap, all at once on the ultimate
 flight paddle! Bring as many friends as you want and we'll throw in 3 
appetizers, plus free soda all night for your DD.
Joey is our awesome chef and, of course, his favorite perk is the Meal to Remember..
 for $150 you and a guest get to enjoy a five course beer pairing dinner. Come hungry, 
thirsty, and ready to indulge.
Anna suggests the Cocktail Hour perk.. You can 
bring a date ($50) or not ($30) to an exclusive party. We'll start off your beer tab with $15 a 
person and our chef will be making some killer hor d’oeuvres. 
Jason always says, "A beer a day keeps the doctor away", so the Pint Night..Every Night is
 simply perfect! This is our biggest perk with the biggest 
possibilities. It lasts you years and years, all the way to the end of 2020.. 
unless the world ends, then you better drink more sooner! Every pint, 
every time.. $1 off
Josh wants you to Sponsor a Stool.. Your 
name will be permanently displayed on a stool that will 
probably be in the bar until the end of time. We can only fit so many 
stools, so get it while it lasts!
Andy loves them all.. and if
 you're really excited, just buy one of each! When you help us out, you get a little 
something back in return! Every contribution helps us reach our goal. You will receive an emailed voucher for your purchase. If you need your items shipped to you, no problem.. just reply to that email and let us know the address (U.S. Only). Other Ways You Can Help
Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! 
Use the Indiegogo share tools, send emails, yell to your neighbors from 
your front porch.. it all helps! And as always, you can show your support by stopping in for a beer or two and inviting your friends!

story:
Please scroll for English translation.

Kakav pristup žene trebaju? 

Kada žele utišati glas žena i osporiti njihova prava nad vlastitim tijelom – vrijeme je za akciju. Na Plitvicama se 8. i 9. travnja 2016. održava simpozij Pravni, etički i medicinski aspekti suvremenog vođenja poroda. 

Na ovom simpoziju će biti riječi o ženinu pravu da odlučuje o svojem tijelu - radilo se o trudnoći, porodu ili prekidu trudnoće na zahtjev žene. Pozvali su nas da predstavimo našu ulogu roditeljske udruge, udruge koja zastupa pravo žene  na odlučivanje u svojem porodu. I mi smo prihvatile. No, kad smo vidjele teme skupa, shvatile smo da ovo neće biti običan simpozij. Rasprave i teme naslovljene kako slijedi: 

  • Tko odlučuje o tijeku poroda: roditelji, liječnici ili forum društvenih mreža?
  • Odbijanje za život nužne intervencije na porodu – novo lice čedomorstva?
  • Psihološki profil rodilje koja svjesno odbija medicinsku intervenciju i time ugrožava zdravlje i život djeteta
  • Okrugli stol Priziv savjesti ginekologa kod prekida trudnoća

ne smijemo pustiti da prođu nezapaženo, bez komentara javnosti i bez sudjelovanja korisnica, pacijentica i žena.

Za to trebamo vašu pomoć. Da bi 10 Rodinih članica prisustvovalo Simpoziju, treba nam oko 15.000 kuna. Svaka donacija, pa i ona najmanja, pomoći će nam da postignemo cilj, i da osiguramo da se čuje i naš stav i naš glas: Nama ne treba grublji pristup. Moj porod, moje tijelo, moj izbor. 


Zašto nas podržati? 

Roda već 15 godina aktivno djeluje na promjenama zdravstvenog sustava, zagovarajući pravo žena na zdravstvene usluge utemeljene na najboljim, znanstveno dokazanim praksama koje osiguraju njeno dostojanstvo i sigurnost.

Simpozij Pravni, etički i medicinski aspekti suvremenog vođenja poroda  je mjesto gdje Roda može direktno tražiti i dobiti odgovore hrvatskih ginekologa o njihovim stavovima vezanim uz budućnost maternalne skrbi u Hrvatskoj.

Svojom ćete uplatom pomoći da publiku na simpoziju čine i Rodine aktivistice koje slušaju glas rodilja i žele ga glasno izreći: Nama ne treba grublji pristup. Moj porod, moje tijelo, moj izbor. 


Što će nam 2000 USD?

Novac će se potrošiti na troškove vezane uz prisustvovanje skupu, poput:

  • Kotizacije za sudjelovanje na simpoziju za deset sudionica iz udruge Roda
  • Noćenje s doručkom u pansionu *** kategorije za deset sudionica
  • Putovanje na Plitvice iz Zagreba, Istre i Dalmacije

Nemam više novaca ovaj mjesec. Mogu li pomoći na neki drugi način?
Naravno! Podržite naš cilj i crowdfunding kampanju na društvenim mrežama te aktivno dajte svoje viđenje o temama koje će se raspravljati na simpoziju. Roda će Vas pratiti i prenijeti vaše stavove na simpoziju.

******************************************************

A note for our international friends and supporters

Roda is running a short Indiegogo campaign to raise money for 10 members to attend an OB-GYN symposium being organised at the Plitvica Lakes in April. With topics such as:
  • Who makes decisions about childbirth: parents, doctors or social media?
  • Refusing lifesaving interventions in childbirth - the new face of feticide?
  • The psychological profile of a birthing woman who purposely refuses medical interventions and risks her child's life and health
  • Round-table discussion Physician's ethical objection and termination of pregnancy
it is imperative that we be there and make the voice of women, healthcare consumers, heard.

Our goal is to raise 2000 USD in order to cover travel, lodging and conference fees for 10 of Roda's members to participate and bring women's issues to the forefront of a tide that is turning to limit women's reproductive rights.

Show your solidarity with the women of Croatia as we work to keep and improve women's reproductive rights. Skip just one cuppa' this week or next and send a fiver our way. We'll put it to good use, and you'll begin your morning knowing that you are making this world a little more friendly to all of us blessed with uteri.

story:
Not every business has to be socially responsible, but we're here to show you that they can be.  

Pi Gallery Bar, located in the heart of Chicago, is aiming to help feed the homeless, and displaced population of Chicago, one pizza at a time.

While the issue of feeding those in need will not be solved overnight, our plan is in motion to make that more of a reality. For every Pi pizza you purchase, we will donate a pizza to those who need it most.  It's that simple. "A Pi For A Pi." 

This is only the beginning.  Pi wants to expand worldwide and offer the same relief to every city in which we open.  Our Indiegogo Campaign will help raise awareness about the movement we are creating, and hopefully engage those who enjoy Naples-style pizza, all the while bettering this world with every bite. For every bite you take of our delicious pizza, we promise it will taste that much better knowing that someone who needs it more is benefiting as equally as you are from your purchase.

This campaign will not involve any tooling, building, or licensing to help us get it off the ground.  Pi Gallery Bar already exists, and so do our fresh, locally sourced ingredients, and Naples-style pizzas.  This project can begin right away. 

Getting involved is as simple as purchasing your pizzas through this page. Choose between a single pizza, or multiple pizzas, with tiered rewards offered to some of our higher placed orders.  For every pizza you purchase, one will be donated to those who need it most. The more you purchase, the more we feed, and the faster we spread worldwide, truly making a direct impact on the estimated 791 million people who are without food daily.  After we reach our monetary goal, come in to claim your freshly baked, locally sourced pie, or pies, at Pi! 

Printing coupons or vouchers to redeem your pie won’t be necessary, when you come in just let us know that you are a contributor to the “A Pi For A Pi” campaign.

Oftentimes people would like to help out the less fortunate, but due to time constraints, or financial limitations, we cannot do as much as we'd like.  Pi is simplifying the process and using our business to stop the hunger one pizza at a time.  

From beginning to end, our pizzas, pastas, and calzones are made with fresh, hand picked ingredients, and prepared in our wood-burning oven, imported directly from Italy.  Our dough is made fresh daily, and our ingredients are sourced locally, creating an eco-system for the local community.  Not located in Chicago? No worries! Pledge your order to a friend or a bunch of friends! It makes for an awesome birthday or holiday gift!  Feel good while feeding your friends!

We are looking to raise $25,000 in sales.  That number will aid us to spread the word. The rest we leave up to you to organically grow the nature of our mission. So please join our movement, spread the hashtags #APiForAPi and #ThePiLife, and let's get this world fed together! Check out our site  http://www.apiforapi.com/

story:
What are we doing? 

We are building a diesel powered, Mazda Miata, drift car,  then drifting it, then raffling it off. All of the money raised from the sale, plus any money donated over the cost of the build will be given to a local highschool shop class to help inspire more auto enthusiasts like us!  The part that isn't plain, or simple, is that we will be building this monstrosity in a mere 48 hours or less. You may be asking yourself "How is that even possible?" Well, with a  little help from our friends. We have assembled a small team and will be locking ourselves in a shop for two straight days, only leaving to get supplies and pick up pizza. When the dust settles, we will have a beast of a tire slayer to take to events all over North America. 


 


 What do we need? 

The Money that you will be donating will not only get you cool stuff, it will also help with this crazy build. We are starting from scratch, we already have the car and the engine is on the way, we just need more go fast bits. The more money that we can raise, the crazier that this build will be. We have priced it out, and 10k will be enough to build the car and get you guys your cool stuff. 




Other Donations 

If you can't donate that's cool.... we are broke too... hence the reason for this page. We are looking for people to come out and help with the build as well! The more hands, the easier this will be and the greater the chance that we will get this done. If you work for a company that can help us source parts, food, supplies... beer, please let us know. Anything and everything is needed and appreciated. We want this car to be for everyone and for hundreds of people tell their friends that they helped build this Frankenstein's monster.


The Build...

The Car

We have been graciously donated a 1990 Mazda Miata from Havelock Car and Truck repair. The car has some surface rust that needs to be taken care of, but the frame rails are solid and it is currently in running and driving condition. With some new body panels and some awesome graphics, this car will be ready for its new heart and soul.




Engine

The engine we have chosen for this build is the Cummins 4BT. This is the 3.9L little brother of the famous 12v Cummins that is widely used and abused in the diesel community. Though it has two less cylinders, this engine can make serious power with small, inexpensive upgrades. With an upgraded fuel pump and bigger injectors, we can make substantially more power and roll some serious coal in the process. Changing the rev limiter will open up the power band and keep the car sideways. We will be attaching a ford t19 4 speed transmission to the coal roller. This transmission was chosen due to the availability of parts, its small size and weight. The transmission's gearing will work great with the ford 8.8 rear end equipped with a 410 final drive. This differential is popular among many Miata swaps because of its compatibility with the drive axles and its resilience under high torque. In order to fit this engine, V8roadsters.com will be working with us to adapt their popular LS1 engine cradle for our application. We will also be ordering their ford 8.8 rear end conversion kit, as well as the frame bracing system.


Weight 

As a lot of people have pointed out, this engine is heavy… very heavy, and we understand that it will take the 50/50 weight distribution the Miata is known for and throw it out the window. Our plan to help reduce the weight offset is to run a trunk mounted rad system, as well as a fuel cell as far back as possible. We will also be mounting the engine as far back on the subframe as possible, to keep the nose off the ground. 



Suspension

With the increased weight of the 4BT, the front suspension will have to handle the increased load. We have spoken with a few suspension companies that all agree a set of larger springs on adjustable coils will be needed to help support the weight. At this time we are still looking for the right company to help us with this custom piece

Perks (Details)

First View of the R34 Skyline Adventure:


Our PhP sticker:


T-Shirt: 



Lanyard: 


"Ride in the Soot Salon:" 

Please note that this is only available to those who are local to Ontario, or attend the events that will be announced in early 2016.





Sponsors 




Here is a list of some of the great companies that are helping with this amazing build, and where you can find them.

Northern Upfitters, Muskokas best diesel performance 

 https://www.facebook.com/northupfit/?fref=ts

Daves garage, Ontario's premier miata builder.

http://www.daves-garage.ca/Site/Home.html

Autometer, the first name in gauges. 

http://www.autometer.com/

ARP Bolts, the highest quality engine hardware you can find for your build.

http://arp-bolts.com/

Carbon Miata, hand made miata parts available in Fg or CF

http://www.carbonmiata.com/

Corbeau, the best racing seats built right in the USA.

https://corbeau.com/

Fast Wheels, Canada's own alloy wheel producer. 

https://www.fastwheels.ca/

Ground Control, Building custom suspension for your application

  http://www.ground-control-store.com/products/index.php

Mishimoto, The best rads on the market.

http://www.mishimoto.com/

Nitrous Express, liquid supercharging made easy

http://www.nitrousexpress.com/

Turbo smart, the best way to control your boost

http://www.turbosmartusa.com/ 

CRS Huntsville. Lending us tools to get this crazy job done. www.contractorsrentalsupply.ca/

Fastenal Huntsville, providing quality fasteners.

  https://www.fastenal.com

Moose Delaney’s Huntsville, keeping the team fed over the 48 hours. www.moosedelaneys.ca

Muskoka Roastery, keeps the java flowing all weekend

. www.muskokaroastery.com

Nextmod, providing the best prices and the hardest to find parts. www.nextmod.com/

Lucas Oils, the only name in quality lubes.

  www.lucasoil.com/

Exedy Clutch, taking the rolling coal and turning it into roasting tires. www.exedyusa.com/

V8 Roadsters, if you want a big engine in a tiny car… look no further.  www.v8roadsters.com/

Moss miata, a one stop shop for everything miata

http://www.mossmiata.com/

R theory Motorsports, amazing miata products to keep your miata running at its best

https://www.facebook.com/rtheorymotorsports/

Vibrant Performance, the best fabrication equpment that you can find. 

http://www.vibrantperformance.ca/

story:
The Peer Project x UC Orientation

University College Orientation 2015 is partnering up with The Peer Project | Youth Assisting Youth to raise awareness of at risk-youth in need of peer mentors.  Starting September 7th, 2015, you can participate by completing our t-shirt challenge (more details below). 

What is The Peer Project | Youth Assisting Youth?

The Peer Project | Youth Assisting Youth is a non-profit charitable organization that matches at-risk and newcomer children ages 6-15 with trained and dedicated Volunteer Youth Mentors ages 16-29, who act as positive role models. We create real relationships that matter by partnering kids who need support with peers who can give it, and we’ve seen this city change – one kid at a time!

The T-Shirt Challenge

The challenge: The most amount of t-shirts put on by an individual in 30 seconds.

How can I participate? To participate, upload a video of yourself completing the challenge to Facebook or Twitter (make sure your post is public) and use the hashtags #YAYUC and #LoveMyUC.  At the beginning of your video, say your name, what house you are from (if applicable) and then complete the challenge.  When you post your video, make sure to use the correct hashtags and include a link to the indiegogo campaign.  

House points will be awarded for each video completed by an individual and at the end of the week, we will present a compilation of all of the best videos and announce the winner of the t-shirt challenge.

The message behind the challenge: Since The Peer Project | Youth Assisting youth program is proven to build resiliency in youth, the t-shirt challenge symbolizes the increased layers of resiliency that youth gain from being mentored. Resiliency is measured by several internal and external core competencies.

story:
Founding Story

Bharath Shiva, Founder & Marketing Lead, TrekHub. A dreamer like everybody else, having a background in advertising, I enjoyed my job but spent most of time dreaming of travel, of adventure, of new experiences.

On deciding to do something about what was being dream off, I decided to take up risk. Because taking up risk is a start of an adventurous journey. Knowing my next step, which was resigning my job and to start an endeavor on my own, I was pretty sure about what is next, setting up a company to empower Indian tourism market. With this aim TrekHub was started.  

But it wasn't created for common tourists but for those who wanted to live life on the edge, for people who aren't afraid of the unknown, for people who dream big adventures.

A journey set alone is ambitious but sweeter with partners. Like minds are found in the most unexpected places like I found Shomika, Gandharva, Abhijith, Abhishek & Pavan. Together, we embarked on the project of a lifetime. To help enable people embark on the adventure of their dreams.

TrekHub Today

TrekHub, an anticipation of creating a hub across the globe making adventure tourism accessible and with an aim to make adventure trips hassle free in India.  

TrekHub strives to create perfect adventure travel for all who are obsessed with adventure. We believe in connecting people with genuine adventure experiences around the world facilitating meaningful travel experiences for adventure junkies worldwide.

TrekHub is a technology based start-up, a cumulative effort to bring technology and adventure on one platform, which acts as a marketplace for all types of adventures in India. TrekHub today has tied up with more than 140 service providers including Sky Waltz, Path adventures and many others in the market across 10 cities in India and looking forward to expand services to West Bengal and Madhya Pradesh.

TrekHub is grittily expanding its footprint, surefooted, and with conviction from each success story that it’s scripting. TrekHub have booked 1000 plus tickets in the last seven months and have around 200 registered users despite facing the challenge of not having active market place for adventure activities in India.

Team of Thoughts:

“TrekHub entered the market to solve a simple problem - to provide information and ease the process to plan and book an adventure travel. People usually don't travel as much as they wish to, and we want to help them cross one such hurdle and make them travel and realize how wonderful it is!”,Bharath Shiva, Founder & Marketing Lead, TrekHub.

“Adventure is a moment in life. This moment can only be experienced but not explained. TrekHub is the place where it provides that moment of lifetime”, Abhijith S Gowda, Operations Lead, TrekHub.

“Adventure is one medium where you get to explore the hidden things in you, but TrekHub is the place where you take your first step to adventure”, Shomika S Rao, Vendor Management Lead, TrekHub.

“Adventure is not frightening, unless you are fighting your own fear. Adventure is inspiring, which makes you dream even bigger”, Gandharva K C, Tech Support Lead.

“I want to be the wisest person I can be. When I am old and grey, I want to have this big twinkle full of kick ass life experiences that I can share, that I wasn't scared to live the life that I wanted to live. It is the kind of person I envision myself as. TrekHub is THE place to get those experiences. So, the question was not whether to join TrekHub but to go against my internal compulsion to join this adventure. I would have been a hollow man if I didn't. It would have devalued everything I want to accomplish in my life had I not joined TrekHub. I'm enjoying every moment of my life here”,Pavan Prakash, Strategy Lead, TrekHub.

“A lonely voyage where I find the real me with no designation, no name, no identification. I travel not to reach a destination but to adore the journey of explorations. I travel not only miles but travel a lot further in my thoughts and illusions. I travel because those high mountains, hills, seas, river streams silently promises my existence.” Varsha Parashiva Murthy, Content Developer/SMM, TrekHub.

"As we know adventure tourism is a vast business in India, as it becomes bigger and bigger it gets more difficult to be accessed, in other words it becomes unorganized. For this reason the concept of TrekHub adventure was introduced to make it more organized and to make it accessible to all, so that everyone can enjoy adventure." Abhishek H R, Customer Support Lead, TrekHub.

Our Pitch

In the course of growth, TrekHub now is keeping its teeny steps towards Global travelers. Crowd funding is an effort to reach out all travelers out there. It’s an honest entreaty we are presenting you. Fund us to improve and stretch our services, making your trip to India an incredible one.
