story:
Kinetic Parkour will be a brand new parkour and freerunning training facility located in Salt Lake City, Utah. We are running this campaign to raise funds for a cash injection on a small business loan, which will then be used to purchase space, equipment, and obstacles.

Kinetic Parkour is a team of three people: Richard Coleman (Director), Marisha Parker (Graphic Designer), and Jason Cox (Photographer). Combined, the three of us have noticed a significant need in the Wasatch Front to have a dedicated space where parkour practitioners can come to work out, learn, and train. With your help, we can build a 7,500-square-foot facility dedicated specifically to parkour and freerunning, where the passionate and the curious alike can come to learn and grow.

We have three founding members at Kinetic Parkour: Richard Coleman, Marisha Parker, and Jason Cox. Each has their own reasons for wanting to see Kinetic open its doors.
 
Richard Coleman has been involved in parkour for many years. He had been using it to gain entrance to abandoned buildings long before he knew it was a formal discipline. He credits the video game "Splinter Cell" for sparking his interest in parkour, beginning in high school and continuing throughout his college years (he would have gotten his Bachelor's degree in Parkour instead of Psychology if they would have offered it).
 
Three years ago, Richard became aware of parkour training sessions taking place in and around Salt Lake City, and it was then that the idea of a local parkour gym struck him. Fast forward to the present day, and Richard has all but given up training for the time being, preferring instead to focus on finally getting a Salt Lake City gym up and running so others can learn. Richard is the Executive Director of Kinetic Parkour, and will be handing the operations of the gym after we open (simply put, he'll be there from open to close to make sure everything runs smoothly)!
 
Marisha Parker graduated from Utah State University with her Bachelor's degree in Biology, and is currently employed in a microbiology laboratory. She hopes to one day work with wildlife for her career, but for now, she wants to help Kinetic get going because she would like a place to train in parkour. She started drawing when she was 12 years old and has never stopped, though she credits getting her first digital art tablet with really cementing her drive to create. Marisha is the Chief Graphic Designer of Kinetic Parkour, and has been responsible for our awesome graphics thus far!
 
Jason Cox has recently rediscovered his love for photography. He has been involved in some form of art or another since he was in junior high school, but he discovered several years ago that his favorite canvas was that of a photo. His favorite thing to photograph? People doing what they love. As soon as we heard that, we knew he was going to fit in at Kinetic just fine. Jason is our Chief Photographer, and has taken all the photos and videos so far for Kinetic Parkour. You'll see him around the gym once in a while, snapping pictures of people for gym promotions, but he's also offered to have a "free day" once in a while where he'll take a picture of you practicing parkour and email it to you so you can post it wherever you like!

Our goal is set at $8,000. After Indiegogo's fees and PayPal/credit card fees, we'll have roughly $7,000 left over for the gym. We will then quite literally take that money to the bank, prove to them how many people actually want this business started by showing off how many memberships we've sold before we even open, and within a few weeks we should have the money we need to get going on the gym. We should have a location selected and ready to lease by early May, have our building permit and business license in hand by late May, and be open for business in June!

If we do not reach our full campaign goal, don't worry; the gym will still open and you'll still get your perks! However, depending on how much money we still need, the gym will have to open later than June. If, for some unforeseen reason, the gym is unable to open by December 31, everyone who donated money will be refunded.

But enough about us. Let's talk about you! After all, that's why we're here; we want a parkour gym open so people like you will have a safe, legal space to train that's sheltered from the elements and has an emergency system in place in case something goes wrong. So, in exchange for supporting us while we get started up, we have a dozen perks that you can choose from! They're listed in greater detail on the right side of the screen, but the basic idea is that you can get awesome Kinetic merchandise like t-shirts and tank tops, HUGE discounts on memberships that we will never be able to offer again, and even some cool stuff like locker rentals and your name as a sponsor on our equipment. If you're feeling particularly rich, we've rolled all the available perks into one package way down at the bottom, with a few added bonuses!

T-Shirts:

Women's Tank Tops:

Men's Tank Tops:

Daily, Monthly, and Annual Passes:

Unlimited Drinks for a Year, Your Name on Our Equipment, and Reserved Lockers:

To select a perk, simply click on it and you'll be taken to a payment screen. There are a few things you should know about each perk:

  • T-Shirts/Tank Tops: We need your shirt size. How to get that to us is explained below. If you have a perk that contains multiple shirts, you can choose between t-shirts and tank tops; just let us know.
  • Memberships/Day Passes: The coupon that you will redeem for your membership time will be emailed to you at the email address used for your IndieGoGo account.
  • Other Perks: If you did not get a membership or shirt, we will still email you to confirm details we need for the perk.

Be sure to add "staff@kineticparkour.com" to your address book so that any email we send stays out of the spam box!

How to Tell Us Your Shirt Size/How Many Shirts vs. Tank Tops You Want

After you complete payment, you'll be taken to a screen where you can share the campaign with your friends. A little ways down on the right side of the screen is a comment box (pictured below).

1) Fill out the comment box with your shirt size/how many shirts and tank tops you want with your perk. If you want the shirt shipped to you (and added $6.00 to the price of the perk), this is where you can fill in your shipping information. If you have multiple shirts in your order, you can specify what sizes you would like them; otherwise, we will default to a "Large" on all shirts other than your own.

2) Check the box that says "keep private."

3) Click the "Add Comment" box.

4) You're done! We now have your t-shirt size and all the info we need to get things going.

Kinetic Parkour was started with one goal in mind: To provide a safe, fun, affordable environment where anyone with a desire to learn can come train in parkour or freerunning.  Your donation will help make that a reality!

The fact of the matter is, six months out of the year, Utah is not a safe place to learn parkour. There's ice and snow everywhere, and winter injury rates are very high. Gymnastic gyms offer token parkour and freerunning classes, but only on specific nights, and only for an hour or two at a time. In addition, there are virtually no places outdoors that allow practitioners to train on their property, as liability concerns and lawsuits have made property owners wary of anyone using their land in a way it was not intended for.

So here are the three current options for parkour enthusiasts (traceurs):

1) Train outside. This is not always safe and can open traceurs up to run-ins with law enforcement, even on public property such as parks.

2) Train in a gymnastic gym. This can get costly, and gymnastic gyms can have strict age restrictions prohibiting some people from using their equipment at all. Most gymnastic gyms simply are not equipped for parkour training.

3) Train indoors. There are few places with enough space to train in parkour, and fewer still who are actually okay with their property being used in this manner.

We want to add a fourth option: Train at Kinetic Parkour. Built by traceurs, for traceurs, with all liability concerns and safety hazards already accounted for. No need to worry about snow and ice, no strange age restrictions, and definitely no police coming around every thirty minutes to tell you to get down off of things. Sounds like heaven, right?

We think so, too.

If we hit our campaign goal of $8,000, we will be able to build a training facility with the following amenities:

  • 7,500 square feet of pure parkour joy. A 20-25 foot ceiling height will add a third dimension to your training.
  • A location accessible to the general public, within five miles of Downtown Salt Lake City.
  • A snack bar selling electrolyte drinks, energy bars, and protein shakes.
  • A work-out area with free weights, a treadmill, an elliptical, and an all-in-one exercise machine.
  • A mezzanine area with a couch so you can sit back and relax once in a while.
  • Electronic Admission System: Scan your Kinetic keychain barcode and you're in; no waiting-in-line-for-admission hassles.
  • Daily and Monthly Passes, so you can come in once a month or every single day, depending on your budget, and stay as long as you like.
  • A bars and pipes course for practicing rail skills.
  • Over a dozen plywood obstacles stretching as tall as 15 feet.
  • Precision jump training bars.
  • Balance training bars.
  • Several heights of vault boxes.
  • A modular fence system where you can physically remove the fence from the ground and replace it with another one. This gives you the ability to practice on different types of fences without having to leave the gym.
  • Movable gymnastic mats so you can place one under you to catch your fall if you're not sure you can make a certain jump.
  • Open gym at all times. Unlike other gyms that only offer a maximum two hours of open gym per day, we'll be open six to eight hours a day and will allow open gym for the whole duration.
  • Classes taught by local traceurs and freerunners, many of whom have trained with the founders of parkour.

Not bad for a measly $8,000! If we surpass our campaign goal, we will be able to purchase additional amenities to make your stay at Kinetic that much better.

If we reach:

$10,000

This will be enough to purchase everything listed above, and add a 1000 square foot area of spring gymnastic floor, so you can practice those tricky moves without fear of hitting something hard on your way down.

$13,000

We will be able to add on to the gymnastic floor by adding a 200 square foot area for a foam pit, to make learning techniques that much easier.

$15,000

Kinetic Parkour will be able to hire additional employees to make sure the gym is open seven days per week.

$16,000

A hardwood floor with plenty of mirrors for those of you into break-dancing or martial arts. With this addition, we will also be able to start holding more diverse classes.

$18,000

A Kinetic Parkour truck so that we can pack up our movable obstacles and do promotions for Team Kinetic on the road, allowing us to pick up sponsorships and advertising opportunities.

$19,000

We will be able to add a video editing station for Kinetic Parkour members to use, and Go-Pro camera and helmetcam rentals so you can film your runs in first and third person.

$20,000

We will be able to add on to our plywood and cement obstacles, making them bigger and taller to match your progression in the art of parkour.

...You get the idea! The point is, the more money we raise now, the more capital we have to put into making Kinetic Parkour not only Utah's parkour hotspot, but the world's coolest parkour and freerunning training facility.

Sometimes, you're just not in a position to help out with money. That's totally fine! You can still help Kinetic get off the ground by sharing our campaign with anyone you know who might be interested. The "Share Tools" are located just under the video at the top of this page; click on them and help get the word out about our campaign! We're a local business, meaning that we have to reach as many people in Salt Lake City as possible in order for our campaign to be successful. It'll take a few seconds, but you'll rack up major cool points with us!

If nothing else, simply refer one friend to our page so that our campaign keeps going; after all, parkour is all about momentum and we could use all we can get!

If you haven't already, right below are links to our Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, and Youtube, as well as our website where you can sign up for our newsletter. You can Like, Follow, and Subscribe to keep up to date on the gym's progress and to make it crazy easy to share our updates with everyone.

Thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to read this and help out. We look forward to seeing you run with us at Kinetic when we open!

2) Check the box that says "keep private."
3) Click the "Add Comment" box.
4) You're done! We now have your t-shirt size and all the info we need to get things going.



Kinetic Parkour was started with one goal in mind: To provide a safe, fun, affordable environment where anyone with a desire to learn can come train in parkour or freerunning.  Your donation will help make that a reality!
The fact of the matter is, six months out of the year, Utah is not a safe place to learn parkour. There's ice and snow everywhere, and winter injury rates are very high. Gymnastic gyms offer token parkour and freerunning classes, but only on specific nights, and only for an hour or two at a time. In addition, there are virtually no places outdoors that allow practitioners to train on their property, as liability concerns and lawsuits have made property owners wary of anyone using their land in a way it was not intended for.
So here are the three current options for parkour enthusiasts (traceurs):
1) Train outside. This is not always safe and can open traceurs up to run-ins with law enforcement, even on public property such as parks.
2) Train in a gymnastic gym. This can get costly, and gymnastic gyms can have strict age restrictions prohibiting some people from using their equipment at all. Most gymnastic gyms simply are not equipped for parkour training.
3) Train indoors. There are few places with enough space to train in parkour, and fewer still who are actually okay with their property being used in this manner.
We want to add a fourth option: Train at Kinetic Parkour. Built by traceurs, for traceurs, with all liability concerns and safety hazards already accounted for. No need to worry about snow and ice, no strange age restrictions, and definitely no police coming around every thirty minutes to tell you to get down off of things. Sounds like heaven, right?
We think so, too.
If we hit our campaign goal of $8,000, we will be able to build a training facility with the following amenities:

7,500 square feet of pure parkour joy. A 20-25 foot ceiling height will add a third dimension to your training.
A location accessible to the general public, within five miles of Downtown Salt Lake City.
A snack bar selling electrolyte drinks, energy bars, and protein shakes.
A work-out area with free weights, a treadmill, an elliptical, and an all-in-one exercise machine.
A mezzanine area with a couch so you can sit back and relax once in a while.
Electronic Admission System: Scan your Kinetic keychain barcode and you're in; no waiting-in-line-for-admission hassles.
Daily and Monthly Passes, so you can come in once a month or every single day, depending on your budget, and stay as long as you like.
A bars and pipes course for practicing rail skills.
Over a dozen plywood obstacles stretching as tall as 15 feet.
Precision jump training bars.
Balance training bars.
Several heights of vault boxes.
A modular fence system where you can physically remove the fence from the ground and replace it with another one. This gives you the ability to practice on different types of fences without having to leave the gym.
Movable gymnastic mats so you can place one under you to catch your fall if you're not sure you can make a certain jump.
Open gym at all times. Unlike other gyms that only offer a maximum two hours of open gym per day, we'll be open six to eight hours a day and will allow open gym for the whole duration.
Classes taught by local traceurs and freerunners, many of whom have trained with the founders of parkour.

Not bad for a measly $8,000! If we surpass our campaign goal, we will be able to purchase additional amenities to make your stay at Kinetic that much better.
If we reach:
 $10,000
This will be enough to purchase everything listed above, and add a 1000 square foot area of spring gymnastic floor, so you can practice those tricky moves without fear of hitting something hard on your way down.
$13,000
We will be able to add on to the gymnastic floor by adding a 200 square foot area for a foam pit, to make learning techniques that much easier.
$15,000
Kinetic Parkour will be able to hire additional employees to make sure the gym is open seven days per week.
$16,000
A hardwood floor with plenty of mirrors for those of you into break-dancing or martial arts. With this addition, we will also be able to start holding more diverse classes.
$18,000
A Kinetic Parkour truck so that we can pack up our movable obstacles and do promotions for Team Kinetic on the road, allowing us to pick up sponsorships and advertising opportunities.
$19,000
We will be able to add a video editing station for Kinetic Parkour members to use, and Go-Pro camera and helmetcam rentals so you can film your runs in first and third person.
$20,000
We will be able to add on to our plywood and cement obstacles, making them bigger and taller to match your progression in the art of parkour.
...You get the idea! The point is, the more money we raise now, the more capital we have to put into making Kinetic Parkour not only Utah's parkour hotspot, but the world's coolest parkour and freerunning training facility.



Sometimes, you're just not in a position to help out with money. That's totally fine! You can still help Kinetic get off the ground by sharing our campaign with anyone you know who might be interested. The "Share Tools" are located just under the video at the top of this page; click on them and help get the word out about our campaign! We're a local business, meaning that we have to reach as many people in Salt Lake City as possible in order for our campaign to be successful. It'll take a few seconds, but you'll rack up major cool points with us!
If nothing else, simply refer one friend to our page so that our campaign keeps going; after all, parkour is all about momentum and we could use all we can get!
If you haven't already, right below are links to our Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, and Youtube, as well as our website where you can sign up for our newsletter. You can Like, Follow, and Subscribe to keep up to date on the gym's progress and to make it crazy easy to share our updates with everyone.
Thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to read this and help out. We look forward to seeing you run with us at Kinetic when we open!

story:
The Issue

Economic security gives people the power to choose their path in life. It also gives people a voice and the ability to create their own change. The problem is…sustainable and dignified employment can be elusive.

In fact, in our global population of 7 billion, there are 300 million young people aged 15-24 living on less than $2 per day in this world. Youth unemployment rates are 6 times that of adults and when youth can find employment it is often informal, insecure, and low-wage. This type of ad-hoc work environment feeds long-term instability and limits economic participation. In the US, unemployment rates among high school graduates aged 17-20 hover around 30%, and underemployment is almost 55%. Including these youth in the workforce changes the trajectory of their lives, improves local economies, and increases the nation’s competitiveness.

Many of these youth have high school diplomas and want to find meaningful work to support themselves and their families or continue their education. While college is definitely the answer for some, many are limited by family responsibilities and struggle to justify the cost and time commitment additional schooling requires. So what can be done?

We need to create an opportunity for achievable, sustainable employment – that is where koapii comes in!

Need more convincing? Check out this recent article in The Economist, “Generation Jobless”: http://www.economist.com/news/international/21576657-around-world-almost-300m-15-24-year-olds-are-not-working-what-has-caused

 

The Idea

The idea behind koapii is simple: train marginalized young adults to use existing digital marketing technologies to market local small and medium businesses. This will give the youth access to gainful and meaningful employment and will strengthen local economies by drawing more traffic to local small businesses.

Businesses all around the US are using online marketing tools to great effect. Even so, about half of the 27.5 million small businesses don’t even have websites. Many of these businesses just don’t know where to start and feel overwhelmed by managing a digital presence on top of running a business. McKinsey has found that small businesses engaged in Internet marketing grow twice as fast as those who have no online presence – quite a compelling figure! So why not train and employ young adults to digitally market local small businesses. A local connection is maintained and both the youth and small businesses gain from increased exposure and opportunity.

 

The Deets

koapii is a hybrid social enterprise. We are in the process of registering the educational/training piece as a tax-deductible 501(C)(3) not-for-profit organization and the digital marketing piece as a Benefit Corporation (for more info on B Corps see: http://benefitcorp.net). The long term goal is to fund koapii via fees paid by small businesses for digital marketing services. Although the organization will eventually be self-sustainable, outside funds are needed for start-up costs and expansion phases. This first round of crowd funding is being used to raise funds for the pilot project. koapii wants to use the pilot to create a solid program and work out some of the kinks associated with new ventures, before rolling out to the rest of the US and world.

koapii will teach qualified students how to digitally market small businesses for local (and later national/international) success. It will be a mobile, scalable learning suite with classroom curriculum, interactive online forums, and a knowledge library complete with online videos, interactive exercises, and the like. koapii will charge students a nominal fee to increase sense of ownership in the program. Learning topics will include: basic web creation, pay per click programs, social media campaigns, local search tactics, search engine optimization, basic shopping cart set-up, and more.

After participants pass through the learning modules, they are eligible to work with koapii to digitally market local small businesses. The youth will be paired with mentors until they are able to service clients alone. Local business clients will pay koapii for digital marketing services based on monthly fees for core packages and maintenance work. It will be koapii’s job to on-board small business clients so that the graduates can concentrate on doing what they now do best – marketing those businesses online!

But will these high school graduates from marginalized areas have what it takes to successfully market small businesses?

YES!  Everyone has the potential to learn – especially youth with minds ripe for engaging in the creative process and harnessing new technologies. In fact, we want to capitalize on the different experiences of these youth to formulate creative online marketing campaigns. That being said, we will have admission requirements and will measure each participant’s cognitive potential to succeed in the program. 

So in the end, small businesses will grow and after two years youth participants will garner salaries an estimated 23% higher than current income levels in marginalized areas. The idea is to start small with a pilot in the Bronx and then expand nationally and globally, starting in Latin America. We’ve chosen to expand first in Latin America because 99% of all businesses are small and medium enterprises; most of these enterprises do not have an online presence; in 2012 smart phone sales hit 145 million; and unattached youth rates – those who neither work nor attend school – range from 45-78%. The market in Latin America is largely untapped so koapii’s impact could be tremendous!

 

Funding Deets

The $30k in crowd funding will be used for the following:

  • $3k Business registration and legal fees
  • $7k General operating costs (utilities, salaries, supplies, etc.)
  • $6k Professional fees for curriculum and learning tool development
  • $5k Equipment and software
  • $6k Production and maintenance of informational website, brand building, marketing collateral
  • $3k Partnership building

 

What’s in it for you?

For starters, you get to support a social enterprise that believes in giving people the opportunity to make their own lives better. But since everyone likes a prize, see the right bar for incentives!

*To show our support for local small businesses, we are incorporating prizes from some of our favorites.

Even if you can’t contribute funds, please spread the word about kopaii by sharing this campaign on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Tumblr, and any other social media platform you use.

 

About the Founder

Cecilia Foxworthy has spent years working with entrepreneurial organizations and economic development issues.  She managed and digitally marketed a non-profit organization in New York that partnered with woman entrepreneurs in 30 countries.  While living in South America, she built capacity for several small businesses and studied and advised an international adult education program.  She has an MBA in Sustainable Business, an MS in Global Education, a wealth of experience, and the focus and commitment to bring sustainable opportunity to marginalized youth worldwide.

story:
Hello friends. We are Housing Opportunities Made Equal (HOME), a Buffalo-based, non-profit fair housing organization serving the Western New York region.  We run the Greater Buffalo Community Housing Center (CHC), a program that since 1999 has helped nearly 4,000 families escape concentrated poverty and racial segregation.  Because of reductions in government and foundation support, we will be forced to close the CHC in 2013 unless we raise the funds to keep this successful program going. We are confident that -- with your help and the help of others like you -- we can achieve our goal.  

Buffalo sits at the heart of the nation’s sixth most segregated metropolitan area and is the third poorest city in America.  The CHC addresses the problems of racial segregation and poverty by expanding housing opportunity.  With your support, we can continue the fight for social justice.

The CHC is a cost-effective program that really makes a difference in the lives of participating families.  CHC counselors help people understand their housing rights and the advantages of moving to opportunity communities with access to better schools, employment opportunities, a safer and healthier environment, and a better quality of life.  CHC staff provide apartment listings, emotional support, and even help in paying security deposits.

It costs approximately $135,000 to run the CHC for one year.  We have set the modest goal of generating $5,000 in new support in order to generate awareness and interest from government, foundations, and private donors.  Every dollar raised will go toward helping families move from impoverished and segregated neighborhoods to communities of choice and to start a better life.  In addition to your tax deduction, we have some fun perks to reward your generosity.

Buffalo is known as the City of Good Neighbors.  Let’s live up to that reputation by ensuring a welcome mat at every HOME -- save the CHC.

story:
Short Summary

Shop with a Mustang is a program put together by Kennesaw Mountain High School. The school has provided this program for years. Its purpose is to provide for under privileged children and families in the Kennesaw area with food and clothing. This program is centered around Christmas time with the idea that no child should be denied having a good Christmas. It provides both food and warm clothing for its participants when they need it the most. Each previous year that the program was in effect, we were able to provide for every family that needed this service, but this year the program has a deficit. Last year our school gave so much to the community with this program and helped pay for the treatment of a very sick Mustang student. Please donate so that this year's program will be a success and no child will have to go without some of the things we take for granted.

What We Need & What You Get

All of the money that is amassed will go directly to Kennesaw Mountain's Shop with a Mustang program. It will then go directly into use for the families in the program that need it. Our goal is to raise about 500-1000 dollars but, honestly, any amount would be a blessing to receive. When I heard about what the program needed I had to act because I couldn't imagine having to go through Christmas with little food and no gifts. I realize each day these are some of the things many of us take for granted but they aren't promised. I hope that you, my hopeful donator, can have empathy for these families in need. Remember that we are all people and that our compassion is the definition of our humanity.

The Impact

Your donation will provide a family with a turkey and other items for a proper meal. Many of the families will rely on this meal to get their children through the winter break. Your money will also provide clothing to keep the families warm through the cold month of December. I promise, through previous experience with the program, that each family that receives your help will be very grateful. Afterwards, if possible, I plan to make a video with some of the families that received help to show how grateful they are.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount helps but if a donation isn't possible you can always help spread the word of my cause. You can e-mail me at jacobyship@yahoo.com and I will be happy to send you information, flyers, or anything else you may need to help make a contribution. Thank you for your help, you are greatly appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

It's been over two years since we (Catherine Powell and Ariella Mastroianni) created NKD Mag and we finally feel like we've figured it out. As the publication gets bigger it becomes more time consuming, and we feel like it's time to make NKD Mag an official business so we can start making money and paying our staff. But, until we are an official LLC, we can't legally make a profit. This is where our friends and family come in: your donations will aid us in the process of becoming a business.

What We Need

Main Expenses:

  • Media Temple Host (Website Host) - $200
  • Registrations (5 total) - $875
  • LLC - $200
  • Lawyer + Contracts - Varies
  • Website Layout - $70
  • Domain - $30

Total: Roughly $2,000

Additional Expenses:

  • Paying writers - 16 stories per issue + web content
  • Travel expenses
  • Paying editors, photographer, designer
  • Physical copies
  • Photo shoot expenses (locations, stylists, make up, hair, catering, etc.)
  • Equipment
  • Hiring business manager
  • Office/meeting space rentals

Rewards

Our entire staff is made up of broke college students, so unfortunately we don't have too much to give. But what we can offer is physical copies of the magazine, prints and posters of photos taken for the mag or website, and mix CDs featuring artists we've highlighted in the 'zine! And we will include your name in a "Thank You" section on our website once the campaign is complete!

story:
HUB Oaxaca is a collaborative space for emerging social entrepreneurs in Southern México hoping to transform their region by doing the work they love.

1 part collaborative working space

1 part learning centre

1 part support network

HUB Oaxaca brings talented and tenacious social innovators in the region together, to collaborate, increase their impact and to grow.

We are a locally-run association, with a diverse and dynamic team from inside and outside Oaxaca. Linked to over 40 other HUBs around the globe (http://www.impacthub.net/), we support local non-profits and emerging social entrepreneurs through a diverse array of spaces, services and classes. Come join us in building a stronger community that's working to change our world!

We are looking to sponsor our learning programs for 2014 to offer scholarships to the incredible social innovators in Oaxaca who are addressing poverty, hunger, violence and environmental degradation with immense dedication and the reality of very limited resources.

What we do.

HUB Oaxaca provides a collective office, meeting rooms and event spaces, capacity-building classes, as well as project development services to our community to build stronger projects and a connected community.


In our Learning Space, we give local entrepreneurs access to incredible experts. We build classes with practical content and with the space and support necessary to put into practice the tools they are learning. Topics range from: finding the right investor, strategic marketing, facilitation, impact measurement, operation & administration, business model development, among others.  Since 2011 we have trained over 230 social entrepreneurs, offering scholarships to almost half, thanks to past sponsors. Help us continue to grow this essential local learning space for our region.

Meet the faces that, with access to the HUB's services, are transforming Oaxaca...

Over the last three years the HUB has supported more than 200 entrepreneurs from distinct fields: reforestation, eco-architecture, health, human rights, food security, learning design, urban transit and we continue integrating more each year.

Meet Vicente Cruz, who works alongside Oaxacan communities encouraging the use of native corn varieties with his innovative commercialisation model that employs indigenous women by setting up tortilla stores. Vicente took our 100-day incubator workshop to build out his business concept, and will prototype his project in the HUB's facilities. Access to our space, forums to pitch his idea and incredible mentors has given his initiative the launching pad to strengthen his idea and grow.

Meet Mundo Ceiba in their office at the HUB, where young entrepreneur Rubén García helms an initiative that convenes hundreds of young volunteers to promote alternative urban mobility and ecological sustainability through critical mass bike rides and reforestation campaigns. The HUB affords Mundo Ceiba a collective and central space and interconnected network, to engage his young volunteers and launch his weekly rides.

Meet Lupe Chavez from AgroSanO, an electrical engineer turned organic farmer whose project trains local producers on organic cultivation techniques to promote and build out the sustainable food systems in Oaxaca. She took our Fundraising and Donor Relations workshop last year, and through collaboration with a fellow workshop participant, applied for, and achieved a large collective grant that funded the training they will carry out throughout the year.

What your donation does...

We need to keep these services accessible and available to local entrepreneurs. The small fees we charge for space and classes only covers 20% of operating costs. To keep offering entrepreneurs like Vicente, Rubén and Lupe access to top notch learning opportunities, excellent teachers and mentors, as well as the facilities to incubate their ideas, we need your help. Our $20,000 goal will cover operational costs for the Learning Center--space, teacher salaries, materials, equipment. A generous contribution from sponsor Halloran Philanthropies has covered the additional cost for us to manage and administrate the Learning Space. Now help us bridge the remaining gap to make the Learning Space for the remainder of 2013/2014 a reality. #everybitcounts.

Funding with purpose... 

Be a part of our amazing community of change makers.  Join us in transforming our world for the better. A small contribution can go a long way. We invite you to renew your commitment to help us strengthen our community. Your donation is the difference.

Other ways you can help...

A financial donation isn't the only way to contribute. Share this information via Facebook, Twitter or email with your network. Let your friends and relatives know about HUB Oaxaca. Spread the word. Or offer your talents and expertise to our network! Do you have a field of knowledge or contact that might be helpful to our family of emerging social actors?  Get in touch so we can get you connected!

Rewards!

We have amazing rewards for our collaborators; check it out at the right! As a thank you for your donation you can receive beautiful products created by our members, like a fantastic pitcher from our member project Colectivo 1050° (normally sold at MoMa Design Store). Our best reward will be our sincere thanks.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

HUB Oaxaca es un espacio colaborativo para emprendedores sociales emergentes en el sur de México, con la clara convicción de transformar sus comunidades haciendo lo que aman.

El HUB es: 

Espacio colaborativo

Centro de aprendizaje 

Comunidad 

El HUB Oaxaca atrae a talentosos y arriesgados actores sociales de la región a un mismo espacio, para incrementar el impacto y expandir sus proyectos.

Somos una asociación local, con un equipo diverso y dinámico que se conforma de personas de Oaxaca y otros lugares. Estamos vinculados con más de 40 HUBs alrededor del mundo (http://www.impacthub.net/), y damos soporte a los emprendedores a través de diferentes servicios como espacios de trabajo, servicios y aprendizaje. Ayúdanos a construir una comunidad más fuerte que trabaja duro para transformar el mundo.

Lo que buscamos con ésta campaña es financiamiento para nuestra área de aprendizaje para el 2014, para así ofrecer becas a los increíbles actores sociales que están en nuestra región trabajando en temas como la pobreza, el hambre, la violencia y la degradación ambiental con inmensa dedicación y la constante lucha de no contar con los suficientes recursos para realizar su trabajo.

¿Qué hace el HUB Oaxaca?

El HUB provee una oficina colectiva, salas de juntas, espacios para eventos, talleres especializados, conectividad con otros proyectos, así como servicios para el desarrollo de proyectos que dé como resultado organizaciones más fuertes.

En nuestro espacio de aprendizaje ponemos a disposición de los emprendedores a increíbles expertos. Y la variedad de temas que tenemos van desde encontrar el financiamiento perfecto, hasta la operación y administración de una organización, pasando por estrategias de marketing, facilitación de procesos colaborativos, medición de impacto, modelos de negocios, entre muchos otros. Desde el 2011 hemos entrenado a más de 230 emprendedores sociales, ofreciendo becas a más de la mitad de ellos, gracias el apoyo de diferentes patrocinadores. Ayúdanos a crecer este esencial  centro de aprendizaje para nuestra región.

Conoce a las personas que, a través de ser parte de la comunidad HUB, están transformando Oaxaca…

Desde los últimos 3 años el HUB a apoyado a más de 200 emprendedores que trabajan en diferentes áreas: reforestación, bio-arquitectura, salud, derechos humanos, seguridad alimentaria, diseño, tránsito urbano y cada año seguimos agregando más temas.

Vicente trabaja en comunidades de Oaxaca para mantener la tradición del uso del maíz nativo y sus diferentes variedades, y que también innova en su modelo de comercialización que emplea a mujeres indígenas y que las ayuda a establecer sus propios puntos de venta, y que lo hace a través de la plataforma HUB. Vicente tomo nuestro programa de incubadora de 100 días para construir su modelo de negocios, y además tendrá un prototipo de su empresa en las instalaciones del HUB. Parte del aprendizaje incluye acceso a espacios de trabajo, foros en donde presentar su idea, y mentores increíbles le han dado la perspectiva y las herramientas necesarias para fortalecer y crecer su idea.

Mundo Ceiba opera desde una oficina en el HUB en donde el joven emprendedor Rubén García, dirige una iniciativa que convoca a cientos de jóvenes voluntarios a promover una cultura alternativa de movilidad urbana y sustentabilidad ecológica a través del uso masivo y cotidiano de la bicicleta y campañas para reforestar bosques. El HUB facilita a Mundo Ceiba y espacio colectivo y centralizado además de proveer una red interconectada, para enganchar a esta comunidad de ciclistas en la ciudad para realizar sus recorridos nocturnos.  

Lupe Chavez de AgroSanO es ingeniera eléctrica convertida en productora de alimentos orgánicos, a través de su proyecto entrena a productores de alimentos orgánicos para promover y construir un ecosistema de comida local y sustentable en Oaxaca. Ella tomó nuestro taller para atraer donantes y mantener una relación sana con ellos el año pasado y a través de una colaboración con un participante del mismo taller, aplico para un fondo colectivo que ayudo al entrenamiento que tienen previsto para más agricultores para lo que resta del año. 

En qué contribuye tu donación?

Necesitamos mantener estos servicios disponibles y accesibles para emprendedores sociales. Las pequeñas cuotas que pedimos para el espacio y talleres solo cubren el 20% de nuestra operación total. Para seguir ofreciendo a Vicente, Rubén y Lupe acceso a aprendizajes de primer nivel, excelentes maestros y mentores, así como instalaciones para incubar sus ideas, necesitamos tu ayuda. Nuestra meta de $20,000 dólares cubrirá gastos operativos para el espacio de aprendizaje, salarios para los talleristas, materiales, equipo. Ahora mismo una generosa donación por parte de nuestro principal financiador Halloran Philanthropies está cubriendo una parte solamente para administrar los talleres. Necesitamos de tu ayuda para tener todos los recursos necesarios para que el espacio de aprendizaje para el 2013 y 2014 sea posible. #cadapesocuenta.

Donando con proposito… 

Forma parte de nuestra increíble comunidad de agentes de cambio. Ayúdanos a generar cambios radicales para mejorar nuestro mundo. Una pequeña donación significa una gran diferencia. Ya en otra ocasión has ayudado al HUB, te invitamos a renovr nuestra confianza en nosotros que ayudará a fortalecer nuestra comunidad. Tu donación es la diferencia.

Otras formas de ayudarnos…

Una donación no es la única forma para ayudarnos. Comparte esta información a través de Facebook, Twitter o por el email con tus contactos. Cuéntale a tus familiares y amigos acerca del HUB Oaxaca. U ofrece tus talentos y experiencia a nuestra red! ¿Tienes un conocimiento o contacto que quizás sea de ayuda a nuestra familia de actores sociales emergentes? ¡Ponte en contacto con nosotros!

Recompensas!

Tenemos recompensas bien cheveres, para quien nos ayude, y puedes verlas a la derecha de tu pantalla. Tenemos desde postales digitales hasta fantásticos diseños de nuestra comunidad, como estos vasitos diseño del Colectivo 1050°, los cuales también se venden en MoMA Design Store. Por supuesto nuestra mejor recompensa será nuestro sincero agradecimiento.
story_txt:
HUB Oaxaca is a
collaborative space for emerging social entrepreneurs in Southern México hoping
to transform their region by doing the work they love.
1 part collaborative working space
1 part learning centre
1 part support network
HUB Oaxaca brings talented and tenacious social innovators in the region
together, to collaborate, increase their impact and to grow. 
We are a locally-run association, with a diverse and dynamic team from
inside and outside Oaxaca. Linked to over 40 other HUBs around the globe (http://www.impacthub.net/), we
support local non-profits and emerging social entrepreneurs through a diverse
array of spaces, services and classes. Come join us in building a stronger
community that's working to change our world!
We are looking
to sponsor our learning programs for 2014 to offer scholarships
to the incredible social innovators in Oaxaca who are addressing poverty,
hunger, violence and environmental degradation with immense dedication and the
reality of very limited resources. 

What we do.
HUB Oaxaca provides a collective office, meeting rooms and event spaces,
capacity-building classes, as well as project development services to our
community to build stronger projects and a connected community.

In our Learning Space, we give local entrepreneurs access
to incredible experts. We build classes with practical content and with the space and
support necessary to put into practice the tools they
are learning. Topics range from: finding the right investor, strategic marketing, facilitation,
impact measurement, operation & administration, business model development,
among others.  Since 2011 we have trained
over 230 social entrepreneurs, offering scholarships to almost half, thanks to
past sponsors. Help us continue to grow this essential local learning space for
our region.
Meet the faces
that, with access to the HUB's services, are transforming Oaxaca...
Over the last three years the HUB has supported more than 200
entrepreneurs from distinct fields: reforestation, eco-architecture, health, human
rights, food security, learning design, urban transit and we continue integrating more each year.
Meet Vicente Cruz, who works alongside Oaxacan communities encouraging the use of native corn varieties with his innovative commercialisation
model that employs indigenous women by setting up tortilla stores. Vicente took our 100-day incubator workshop to build out his
business concept, and will prototype his project in the HUB's facilities.
Access to our space, forums to pitch his idea and incredible mentors has given
his initiative the launching pad to strengthen his idea and grow. 
Meet Mundo Ceiba in their office at the HUB, where young entrepreneur Rubén García helms an initiative that convenes hundreds of young volunteers to
promote alternative urban mobility and ecological sustainability through
critical mass bike rides and reforestation campaigns. The HUB affords Mundo
Ceiba a collective and central space and interconnected network, to engage his
young volunteers and launch his weekly rides. 
Meet Lupe Chavez from AgroSanO, an electrical engineer turned organic
farmer whose project trains local producers on organic cultivation techniques
to promote and build out the sustainable food systems in Oaxaca. She took our
Fundraising and Donor Relations workshop last year, and through collaboration
with a fellow workshop participant, applied for, and achieved a large collective
grant that funded the training they will carry out throughout the year. 
What your
donation does...
We need to keep these services accessible and available to local
entrepreneurs. The small fees we charge
for space and classes only covers 20% of
operating costs. To keep offering entrepreneurs like Vicente, Rubén and Lupe
access to top notch learning opportunities, excellent teachers and mentors, as
well as the facilities to incubate their ideas, we need your help. Our $20,000
goal will cover operational costs for the Learning Center--space, teacher
salaries, materials, equipment. A generous contribution from sponsor Halloran
Philanthropies has covered the additional cost for us to manage and
administrate the Learning Space. Now help us bridge the remaining gap to make
the Learning Space for the remainder of 2013/2014 a reality. #everybitcounts.
Funding with
purpose...  
Be a part of our amazing community of change makers.  Join us in transforming our world for the
better. A small contribution can go a long way. We
invite you to renew your commitment to help us strengthen our community. Your
donation is the difference.
Other ways you
can help...
A financial donation isn't the only way to contribute. Share this
information via Facebook, Twitter or email with your network. Let your friends
and relatives know about HUB Oaxaca. Spread
the word. Or offer your talents and expertise to our network! Do you have a
field of knowledge or contact that might be helpful to our family of emerging
social actors?  Get in touch so we can
get you connected! 
Rewards!
We have amazing rewards for our collaborators; check it out at the
right! As a thank you for your donation you can receive beautiful products
created by our members, like a fantastic pitcher from our member project Colectivo
1050° (normally sold at MoMa Design Store). Our best reward will be our sincere
thanks.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
SLeeK Media & Entertainment

Owned & Operated by: Sherrelle Pinkett, V. Lashea Pérez, & Kila Johnson-Campbell

We are intrigued to establish an online radio station to extend opportunities to communities far and wide in all areas of media and entertainment.The goal is to produce quality radio programming through a display of unique, original, and locally developed talent in order to express, inform, and connect with diverse audiences of all ages.

Opportunities include, but not excluded to:

 *Platform for headliners, local talent, Independent Artists, DJs, etc.

 *Host and promote events

 *Designated air time for Public schools, colleges, youth organizations,      religious interest groups, etc.

 *Community Reporting

 *Programming featuring music of every genre and talk radio

 *Internships

 *Advertising

 In 2011, one of the partners of SLeeK Media and Entertainment was diagnosed with Stage 4 Metastatic Breast Cancer and has been fighting 'this fight' for more than 2 years. It is our desire to educate the community on the importance of adopting a healthy lifestyle to help offset the acquisition of certain diseases. We will also partner with non- profit organizations to raise funds for research to eradicate this disease as well as others.

The optimal lifestyle has a equal balance between mind, body, and spirit.  Its our mission to offer the listening community information on how to provide that balance.

We are also passionate about improving the quality of life and restoring "the broken" through offering a platform of holistic programming.

story:
Help us continue to grow this campaign! We reached our first financial goal with just 100 fabulous backers... WOW! 

Spread the word. Sea vegetables are good... and good for you! This message can get to soooooo many more people. You can show the world you agree by joining.

We hit our base goal of $14,000 in five days. (WOW!). We think the buzz around sea vegetables can only GROW with YOUR SUPPORT. In exchange, we are offering super-fun perks: first-release chocolate bars; seaweed harvesting classes on the Sonoma Coast; the chance to become a Mermaid for a day; or, to have the Mermaid Princess come to your next event! 

Your contribution will help us launch the Seaweed Chocolate Bar. And, even more, this project will connect natural foods consumers more deeply to the ocean and its great bounty.

Check out the sidebar to contribute and read on for more about THE Seaweed Chocolate Bar!   

We are the Sea of Change Trading Company. We harvest wild sea vegetables in Northern California and create new and exciting vegan snack foods with these incredible edible gifts of the Ocean. 

We already make Sea Bakin' -- a tasty treat that combines tender nori with organic coconut oil and maple syrup.  Now it's time to unite Land and Sea in a new way: Seaweed Chocolate.


Why Seaweed Chocolate?

Why not? Cole was playing around one day with nori and some extra chocolate he had on hand before a community dinner. He combined these two ingredients, let it firm up into squares and took the treat to his landmates. They were AMAZED. "Oh my!" was heard around the room. Everyone loved the subtle, salty flavor and the crazy crunch. And thus the very early prototype of seaweed chocolate was born. 

Our snacks like to play where land and sea unite. We've already made Sea Bakin' from the nori sea vegetable, mixed it with organic coconut oil and maple syrup, and brought it into natural foods stores. It has a cult following and we are working on expanding distribution throughout California! 

Now we want to bring the cacao bean, one of land's most celebrated fruits and, quite literally, gift of the gods (Theobroma cacao) together with Mother Ocean's treasured vegetables.

We've worked for several months to find just the right sea vegetables and just the right cacao for this project. We began collaboration with a long-time chocolatier, fine-tuned our recipes and took the prototypes out to farmers' markets for taste testing. This process has let us get direct feedback from potential customers and it has put seaweed into the local conversation in a way it wasn't before. Suddenly, folks know the difference between nori, wakame and dulse. They understand the diversity of edible plant life in the ocean. And they've become more willing to try sea vegetables in more ways.

Are you a chocolate lover? Are you a seaweed fanatic? Either way, this is for you!

Dark chocolate lovers will swoon over this heirloom, unroasted cacao. You'll find your energy sustained, not spiked, by the medicinal effect of cacao, the low-glycemic nature of coconut sugar, and the mineral-rich crunch of seaweed.

Sea vegetables add that salty goodness so many of us love in our chocolate, with an extra depth of flavor. Each of our three Seaweed Chocolate Bars carries its own subtle flavor profile, depending on the seaweed. 

  • Deep Dark Dulse puts the ocean flavors at the front, with soft anise end notes and a subtle crunch. This one is for true seaweed lovers!
  • Wild Nori Crunch brings a softer flavor (like putting Sea Bakin' in chocolate!) and adds a hearty crunch. Reminiscent of a crunch bar, but soooo much better for you.
  • Velvety Wakame gives you a smooth, nutty sensation. This one is for seaweed newbies who like a little salt on their dark chocolate!

ABOVE: CALIFORNIA NORI IN MID-JUNE

You can help change the way we relate to the ocean

Right now, few people view the ocean as a viable or sustainable food source and, yet, sea vegetables abound! Sea vegetables are highly nutritious, quickly regenerating vegetables from the ocean. They require no added water! Some grow up to three feet a day. And sea vegetables contain good stuff: iodine, B vitamins, all the trace minerals your body needs. 

You might not know this, but there are hundreds of edible sea vegetables growing out there. By experimenting over the last three years, we've found new ways to incorporate sea vegetables into our diet. As we've learned to eat from the ocean, we've learned to care more and more deeply for it. 

We want our food systems to be regenerative at their core. We want to integrate these amazing ocean plants into the way we eat, gathering and letting them regrow each year. By bringing these foods to market, we can create awareness and action around Ocean Health and Ocean Life. We want people to see that by changing the way they eat, they can create change in how their communities view and care for their food sources.

Let's turn more people on to seaweed! Let's make sea vegetables interesting to the masses. Here's the way... THE Seaweed Chocolate Bar. 

Check out the ways you can contribute
over in the sidebar and join us in this adventure! 

Let's Get Down to Numbers

We need a minimum of $14,000 to make the first Seaweed Chocolate Bar run. Our stretch goal of $24,000 means we can turn more people on to sea vegetables, making bite size versions of the product and producing the bars at greater efficiency. Plus we can step up the brilliant packaging.

We are a small independent business in Sonoma County and we are growing! That means our cash is tied up in growing and expanding Sea Bakin' into all of California. But we can't stop with Sea Bakin'. Nor do we want to! We have to keep the momentum going if we hope to achieve our goal of bringing sea vegetables to natural food stores in new and innovative ways.

So we're asking for your help. We've got natural foods buyers ready to go, but we need to know that YOU are interested. Are you ready for something new? 

Let's show the market that people are ready for sea vegetables.

Our heart's desire is to bring this bar in a way that everyone will want to buy and at a scale that makes sense. We can't just make 1000 bars and be able to bring that to you. Our chocolate partner is willing to do a small run with us so that we can share this with the world. But that's still over 6000 bars. 

The money we are raising will go directly to a first production run. This includes all the ingredients (organic unroasted cacao, organic cacao butter, organic coconut sugar and our wild-harvested seaweeds) plus the crew we need to make these bars at scale. It also covers wrapping and labels. Growing this campaign to $24,000 lets us add on bite size chocolates and produce more bars with greater efficiency and lower cost per bar. Growing this campaign to 300+ backers means more and more people are able to learn about the value of sea vegetables.

Funding us will allow us to give you the very first production-run seaweed chocolate bars. You will get them delivered right to your doorstep so you can be the first to try them and share with your friends. 

Will you support us today?

Founders Cole Meeker and Anastasia Emmons

We want to thank you for your support!!! 

We want to share with you innovative, acclaimed seaweed snacks. We want to take you to the ocean, get you in touch with the rise and fall of the waves, and share with you the myriad vegetables people commonly just call "seaweed." 
We even want to bring the ocean to you. Do you have kids who love stories of the sea? Bring the Mermaid Princess to your kid's school or birthday party and hear her regale them with adventures of the high seas (plus yummy seaweed treats to eat).
This is as much an opportunity for you to help us bring this chocolate bar to market as it is for us to bring you into touch with the ocean's plant life. Want a campout taken care of? Ever wondered how to forage your own food? Join us in this adventure!
Check out the perks over there in the sidebar!    
Partnership: Our New Foray

This is our first manufacturing partnership. We work with a great chocolatier in California who understands the TEMPERmental ways of cacao and values organic, raw ingredients. We bring the seaweed know-how. It's a good relationship, and a FUN one.  We work in the chocolate factory too, from tempering to wrapping so we really understand how our foods are made.

Seaweed Education: The Big Challenge

When we demo our wild-harvested, single-ingredient seaweeds, we constantly find ourselves going back to basics. "Seaweed" is not a single thing, but really hundreds of different kinds of sea vegetables.  Sea vegetables are as plentiful and diverse as the leafy greens and flowers of any land garden, each with its own flavor profile and texture.

Like with any of our seaweed-based foods, we have major market education to do. This takes time and effort, from the whole team and particularly from our sales folks. It means that we don't just need to get the product on the shelf, we need to also make sure it sells from the shelf. This requires lots of in-store demos and education efforts. This campaign is the very beginning! Please share it with your friends and join us on Facebook and our mailing list to keep learning more.

Our seaweed snacks are not the traditional paper nori; we know that and we have committed from the beginning to the added effort required to truly educate our communities about sea vegetables as a food source.

At our core, we want to help people be able to ReDefine how they eat from the ocean in a way that is Healthy for them AND the planet.

Helping us help people connect to seaweed via the Seaweed Chocolate Bar might be the most important thing you do today!



Join the Crew!

We'd be thrilled if you would contribute to this project. Of course, you'll get tasty, innovative foods that fit in your lunchbox or at your next picnic in the park. You'll be the first to get the seaweed chocolate bar. And most of all, you'll be supporting continued education about the ocean and the many edible gifts it provides.

If you love our project, you can also help by spreading the word. Click on those share buttons up at the top left of this page!

Send a short email to your friend circle with a link to this campaign. Join us on Facebook to spread the love. Sign up for our mailing list. Share the campaign on all your favorite social media sites. Bring some seaweed to your next dinner party. And most of all, TALK to people about this stuff. We love the internet, but nothing beats a face to face conversation.

Join the campaign! Check out the perks over in the sidebar and contribute now.

Welcome aboard!
story_txt:
Help us continue to grow this campaign! We reached our first financial goal with just 100 fabulous backers... WOW! 
Spread the word. Sea vegetables are good... and good for you! This message can get to soooooo many more people. You can show the world you agree by joining.


We hit our base goal of $14,000 in five days. (WOW!). We think the buzz around sea vegetables can only GROW with YOUR SUPPORT. In exchange, we are offering super-fun perks: first-release chocolate bars; seaweed harvesting classes on the Sonoma Coast; the chance to become a Mermaid for a day; or, to have the Mermaid Princess come to your next event! 
Your contribution will help us launch the Seaweed Chocolate Bar. And, even more, this project will connect natural foods consumers more deeply to the ocean and its great bounty.
Check out the sidebar to contribute and read on for more about THE Seaweed Chocolate Bar!   


We are the Sea of Change Trading Company. We harvest wild sea vegetables in Northern California and create new and exciting vegan snack foods with these incredible edible gifts of the Ocean. 
We already make Sea Bakin' -- a tasty treat that combines tender nori with organic coconut oil and maple syrup.  Now it's time to unite Land and Sea in a new way: Seaweed Chocolate.

Why Seaweed Chocolate?Why not? Cole was playing around one day with nori and some extra chocolate he had on hand before a community dinner. He combined these two ingredients, let it firm up into squares and took the treat to his landmates. They were AMAZED. "Oh my!" was heard around the room. Everyone loved the subtle, salty flavor and the crazy crunch. And thus the very early prototype of seaweed chocolate was born. Our snacks like to play where land and sea unite. We've already made Sea Bakin' from the nori sea vegetable, mixed it with organic coconut oil and maple syrup, and brought it into natural foods stores. It has a cult following and we are working on expanding distribution throughout California! Now we want to bring the cacao bean, one of land's most celebrated fruits and, quite literally, gift of the gods (Theobroma cacao) together with Mother Ocean's treasured vegetables.
We've worked for several months to find just the right sea vegetables and just the right cacao for this project. We began collaboration with a long-time chocolatier, fine-tuned our recipes and took the prototypes out to farmers' markets for taste testing. This process has let us get direct feedback from potential customers and it has put seaweed into the local conversation in a way it wasn't before. Suddenly, folks know the difference between nori, wakame and dulse. They understand the diversity of edible plant life in the ocean. And they've become more willing to try sea vegetables in more ways.Are you a chocolate lover? Are you a seaweed fanatic? Either way, this is for you!Dark chocolate lovers will swoon over this heirloom, unroasted cacao. You'll find your energy sustained, not spiked, by the medicinal effect of cacao, the low-glycemic nature of coconut sugar, and the mineral-rich crunch of seaweed.Sea vegetables add that salty goodness so many of us love in our chocolate, with an extra depth of flavor. Each of our three Seaweed Chocolate Bars carries its own subtle flavor profile, depending on the seaweed. 
Deep Dark Dulse puts the ocean flavors at the front, with soft anise end notes and a subtle crunch. This one is for true seaweed lovers!
Wild Nori Crunch brings a softer flavor (like putting Sea Bakin' in chocolate!) and adds a hearty crunch. Reminiscent of a crunch bar, but soooo much better for you.
Velvety Wakame gives you a smooth, nutty sensation. This one is for seaweed newbies who like a little salt on their dark chocolate!ABOVE: CALIFORNIA NORI IN MID-JUNEYou can help change the way we relate to the oceanRight now, few people view the ocean as a viable or sustainable food source and, yet, sea vegetables abound! Sea vegetables are highly nutritious, quickly regenerating vegetables from the ocean. They require no added water! Some grow up to three feet a day. And sea vegetables contain good stuff: iodine, B vitamins, all the trace minerals your body needs. You might not know this, but there are hundreds of edible sea vegetables growing out there. By experimenting over the last three years, we've found new ways to incorporate sea vegetables into our diet. As we've learned to eat from the ocean, we've learned to care more and more deeply for it. 
We want our food systems to be regenerative at their core. We want to integrate these amazing ocean plants into the way we eat, gathering and letting them regrow each year. By bringing these foods to market, we can create awareness and action around Ocean Health and Ocean Life. We want people to see that by changing the way they eat, they can create change in how their communities view and care for their food sources.
Let's turn more people on to seaweed! Let's make sea vegetables interesting to the masses. Here's the way... THE Seaweed Chocolate Bar. 
Check out the ways you can contribute over in the sidebar and join us in this adventure! 
Let's Get Down to Numbers

We need a minimum of $14,000 to make the first Seaweed Chocolate Bar run. Our stretch goal of $24,000 means we can turn more people on to sea vegetables, making bite size versions of the product and producing the bars at greater efficiency. Plus we can step up the brilliant packaging.
We are a small independent business in Sonoma County and we are growing! That means our cash is tied up in growing and expanding Sea Bakin' into all of California. But we can't stop with Sea Bakin'. Nor do we want to! We have to keep the momentum going if we hope to achieve our goal of bringing sea vegetables to natural food stores in new and innovative ways.
So we're asking for your help. We've got natural foods buyers ready to go, but we need to know that YOU are interested. Are you ready for something new? 
Let's show the market that people are ready for sea vegetables.
Our heart's desire is to bring this bar in a way that everyone will want to buy and at a scale that makes sense. We can't just make 1000 bars and be able to bring that to you. Our chocolate partner is willing to do a small run with us so that we can share this with the world. But that's still over 6000 bars. 
The money we are raising will go directly to a first production run. This includes all the ingredients (organic unroasted cacao, organic cacao butter, organic coconut sugar and our wild-harvested seaweeds) plus the crew we need to make these bars at scale. It also covers wrapping and labels. Growing this campaign to $24,000 lets us add on bite size chocolates and produce more bars with greater efficiency and lower cost per bar. Growing this campaign to 300+ backers means more and more people are able to learn about the value of sea vegetables.
Funding us will allow us to give you the very first production-run seaweed chocolate bars. You will get them delivered right to your doorstep so you can be the first to try them and share with your friends. 
Will you support us today?

Founders Cole Meeker and Anastasia Emmons
We want to thank you for your support!!! 

We want to share with you innovative, acclaimed seaweed snacks. We want to take you to the ocean, get you in touch with the rise and fall of the waves, and share with you the myriad vegetables people commonly just call "seaweed." 
We even want to bring the ocean to you. Do you have kids who love stories of the sea? Bring the Mermaid Princess to your kid's school or birthday party and hear her regale them with adventures of the high seas (plus yummy seaweed treats to eat).This is as much an opportunity for you to help us bring this chocolate bar to market as it is for us to bring you into touch with the ocean's plant life. Want a campout taken care of? Ever wondered how to forage your own food? Join us in this adventure!
Check out the perks over there in the sidebar!

Like with any of our seaweed-based foods, we have major market education to do. This takes time and effort, from the whole team and particularly from our sales folks. It means that we don't just need to get the product on the shelf, we need to also make sure it sells from the shelf. This requires lots of in-store demos and education efforts. This campaign is the very beginning! Please share it with your friends and join us on Facebook and our mailing list to keep learning more.
Our seaweed snacks are not the traditional paper nori; we know that and we have committed from the beginning to the added effort required to truly educate our communities about sea vegetables as a food source.

Join the Crew!

We love the internet, but nothing beats a face to face conversation.

Welcome aboard!

story:
Welcome to The 52nd Street Market.

The 52nd Street Market, LLC will serve as a one stop shop for grocery staples, fresh produce and prepared foods. Brewed coffee, limited seating and  free wi-fi for customers will also be be available. We hope our market will provide a much needed venue to get to know your neighbors. Because we wholeheartedly believe in contributing to the health of the community, we will not sell tobacco products or lottery.

The market is located on the corner of  52nd and Holmes Streets in Upper Lawrenceville, easily accessible from Butler Street and Stanton Avenue. We look forward to serving individuals who live and work in the Lawrenceville, Stanton Heights and Morningside neighborhoods! Once successful, we hope to make our model available to other neighborhoods interested in establishing a fresh retail community corner store.

Who We Are.

Opening The 52nd Street Market has been the work of Deirdre Kane and Dora Walmsley, we’re two residents of Upper Lawrenceville who want to ensure this rapidly revitalizing neighborhood maintains its local charm. We hope to accomplish this by providing opportunities for residents through employment, education and good, healthy food.

In Our Words.

Hi, I’m Deirdre, a Lawrenceville native.  I  began to more fully invest in the community by participating in Lawrenceville United’s monthly clean ups.  My volunteering expanded into joining committees to get more directly involved in the transformation of the neighborhood.  In 2009, I was  voted onto the Board of Lawrenceville United and remain an active Board Member today. It was my involvement in the community which lead directly to the creation of The 52nd Street Market. I decided Lawrenceville was not only going to be my home, but my future. I really want to be a part of the neighborhood fabric!

Hiya, I’m Dora, a transplant who grew up north of Pittsburgh. I’ve lived in Lawrenceville since 2008 and, most recently, purchased my first home just a few blocks from what soon will be The 52nd Street Market. While moving into the neighborhood I recall a roofer, working nearby, calling down and welcoming me to the neighborhood. This sense of community and willingness to know your neighbors is what drew me in and left me wanting to do more. Since then, I’ve volunteered with numerous community groups and was recently elected onto the Board of Directors for Lawrenceville United.

Together, we have 25 years of restaurant industry and food service experience. Our experience and knowledge will inform food preparation, inventory management and stellar customer service. We also know nothing is created in a vacuum and have derived much of our business plan from community meetings, surveys and many professional mentors who have graced us with their time and expertise. As an employee at Greater Pittsburgh Food Bank, Dora works directly with food insecurity and equitable access to food. In addition to providing a convenient location for neighbors to get their grocery basics, The 52nd Street Market hopes to also make healthy food accessible, affordable and inclusive. Deirdre, has worked at Highmark for the past 15 years and is working to connect community health to community assets. We believe that a neighborhood can provide all the resources and support needed to make families and individuals successful. The 52nd Street Market will serve its part by providing healthy food options and a platform to get to know your neighbors.

Why Do This.

As ‘accidental entrepreneurs’ neither one of us had envisioned running a community corner store as part of our future. When the opportunity presented itself however, the momentum, passion, and commitment was there and it just felt right. We feel we have the skill sets and ability to make The 52nd Street Market a viable business.  However, starting a business requires a significant amount of capital and your contributions will provide critical start-up funds. We have invested a substantial amount of time and personal money, and now are asking for your support. We hope, by doing so, you’ll feel personally invested in our success and the success of the neighborhood.

What We’re Asking For.

We’re bargain hunters by nature and have worked tirelessly to keep costs and our environmental impact low. The building owner has also worked with us to build out the space, provide the use of existing coolers and has agreed to a graduated lease - all at no additional cost to us. We’re still in need of substantial start-up funds and look to raise $50,000 which will be used to purchase start-up inventory, equipment and an additional cooler to store deli meats (A must have as expressed by over 100 residents!). To also help keep initial costs low, we are keeping our full-time jobs and will employ a full and part time local residents to run The Market during daylight hours. These funds will guarantee those salaries.

Funds will go towards purchasing:

  • Initial inventory and inventory purchase reserve

  • Equipment including point of sales system, refurbished refrigeration units, coffee brewing system and coffee grinder, scales, meat slicer .

  • Furniture including seating, shelving storage, counter tops and food prep space.

  • 6 Month salary reserve for employees

In Addition to Our Deepest Thanks...

We think we’ve put together some pretty awesome incentives in exchange for your contribution. We plan to offer a variation of all of these items at The 52nd Street Market however, what you get here will be limited to this campaign. Picture this, your co-worker is super jealous of your vintage milk bottle looking water bottle and wants to know where he/she can score one. Well, too bad for them, the answer is nowhere.

All items are safe to use and will feature the 52nd Street Market logo or 52nd Street Market Roosters on a Wire. Contributions of any level will receive our coffee punch card with the first coffee on us. For those contributing outside of the Greater Pittsburgh Area, we’ll send you our custom bumper sticker.

Items can be picked up by appointment (term used loosely) at The 52nd Street Market, or mailed via USPS. Please allow up to 30 days after the campaign has ended to receive your items. We realize this is kind of a long time to wait for your goods but thank you in advance for your patience. We’re two ladies trying to do a whole lot!

The Impact!

In short, your contribution will allow us to avoid the risks associated with taking out a loan. While this endeavor will hopefully provide a livelihood for us in the long term, we are acting on behalf of the community and are asking for your financial contribution in return. If successful, we hope our model can positively impact communities in Pittsburgh and beyond!

The support for this project has been overwhelming. In just a few short weeks, over 300 residents have responded to our community survey, voicing their well wishes and commitment to shopping at The 52nd Street Market. Numerous neighbors have contacted us inquiring about opportunities to sell their locally made goods and have offered various services at discounted or no cost to us. We can honestly tell you any amount contributed will be responsibly used in the most efficient and cost conscious way possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

These days we understand that discretionary funds are limited; so if you’re not able to contribute financially, you can still have a hand in our success. Please help get the word out by posting a link to our campaign in any and every capacity you can; Facebook, Twitter, reddit, and beyond.  Every little plug helps and is just as much appreciated. Indiegogo also has some great sharing tools that makes this easy to do!

story:
PANDOO is Building Your Personal Computer, on the Cloud!

Big news! PANDOO has come a long way since its inception in 2013. We are excited to announce the launch of a new crowdfunding campaign here on Indiegogo. We're raising money to fund the world's first way to turn any web browser into YOUR personal computer—for free!

Visit the new campaign for all the details at http://igg.me/at/pandoo-os

Also, check out our PANDOO website for more information.


Press Coverage

CNN: http://bit.ly/13IKoUO

Cyber Blog (Stathis Kassios): http://bit.ly/1cWFaYH

Growing.gr: http://bit.ly/16DWInN
