story:
Our story, like our Club, is unique and special. Since opening our doors in 1964, each and every day we have provided space for AA and NA meetings along with the "meetings between meetings" where those suffering can connect and develop friendships with others who have been there themselves and successfully turned their lives around.  We give freely to the newcomer what was freely given to us and keep what we have by giving it away.  

Currently we provide space for 37 meetings a week, serving 100’s of men and women. We are open early in the morning and close late at night – 365 days a year. We’re the oldest club of our kind in Dade County and one of the oldest in the country and the world.  Over the last 50 years we have positively impacted the lives of thousands upon thousands of men and woman afflicted with alcoholism and drug addiction and served thousands more of thier family and friends.

Located in Miami, Florida we are privileged to have met thousands of recovering vacationer’s and business travelers from every state in the country, as well as many other countries around the world. Our members have countless stories of attending AA or NA meetings from South Dakota to South Africa or Pittsburgh to Paris - and joyfully meeting someone that has either been to the Club or knows of our welcoming reputation and spirit.

TESTIMONIAL:

"Little River Club saved my life 14 and 1/2 years ago…..my blood runs through with  Little River sobriety because the people there never gave up on me. I was asked to do service work to help others and as a result I have a life beyond anything I could have imagined. We take in broken and dying people and allow new life to be breathed into them by the process that occurs within the walls. The club is an unparalleled asset to Miami.        Annie P. ($500 Donation)


In late 2011, after almost 50 years of service, we came to the club one morning to find the entrance to our parking lot (behind our building) blocked by a cement barricade. Overnight and without warning, via a directive from the city’s council where we reside (as part of a new initiative to accommodate increased pedestrian walkways) all traffic was cut off from entering our parking lot. 

Also included in the directive were our additional parking places, located on the street in front, which were designated as a no-parking zone as well. 

On that one morning the all-too-familiar story of “the little guy versus city hall” and the politics of “us versus them “ had officially begun.  And just as familiar, the story of contacting attorneys, ensuing legal battles, community groups expressing outrage on the steps of city hall, inside court rooms, and at city council meetings, as well as local media involvement – all followed. 

For the last year and a half we’ve pursued a solution, via city hall, thru attorneys, politicians and court proceedings, spent tens of thousands of dollars and invested countless hours, all the while being met with resistance and a blanket denial for regaining access to our parking lot in the manner we’ve enjoyed for the last 22 years. During the last 18 months, for the first time in our history, we have watched our membership slowly decline.  Our members and guests have simply been
forced to seek more convenient meeting places. Lack of reasonable access to the Club has tried and tested even some of our most loyal members and ardent supporters.  All of them promising to return, waiting for promised changes.  Well those changes are at hand and we truly need your help.   


THE PROJECT:

The solution to re-opening our parking lot and saving our Club is through a multi-phase construction project that entails tearing down the east-end of our building and putting in a driveway to provide thru access via the street running in front of our business (79th Street).

This project will require great leadership and a lot of work and coordination that includes but is not limited to:

CONSTRUCTION:

Demolition of far, east-end of building 

Electrical, plumbing, roofing, interior upgrades

Implementing drive-way from street to parking lot

Building a concrete wall - 125 ft X 6 ft high

Expanding existing parking lot

VOLUNTEERING:

This is also a great project for our volunteers who are inspired and dedicated to doing whatever it takes to get the job done.  A wide cross-section of our general membership, with varied skills and resources, will donate their time, services (and sometimes goods) at no cost to the project.

Their only reward is the satisfaction that they will know they’ve helped in part to ensure the continuation of our solemn tradition of helping those in need and then providing those same people with the opportunity to pass on the gift of recovery to others in the future.  They get to keep their gift by giving it away.


 OVERVIEW:

The overall project is estimated to cost $180,000.  The work will be conducted over a 7-month period, broken down into three (3) phases, each costing $60,000. To show our appreciation we will be providing special gifts, each corresponding with the level of your generous donation.  This site currently reflects only our introductory-story and our initial plans to move the project forward. There will be frequent updates highlighting the progress of the project including pictures, short videos, interesting stories and developments and will include comments from our donors.
story_txt:
Our story, like our Club, is unique and special. Since opening our doors in 1964, each and every day we have provided space for AA and NA meetings along with the "meetings between meetings" where those suffering can connect and develop friendships with others who have been there themselves and successfully turned their lives around.  We give freely to the newcomer what was freely given to us and keep what we have by giving it away.   
Currently we provide space for 37 meetings a week, serving 100’s of men and women. We are open early in the morning and close late at night – 365 days a year. We’re the oldest club of our kind in Dade County and one of the oldest in the country and the world.  Over the last 50 years we have positively impacted the lives of thousands upon thousands of men and woman afflicted with alcoholism and drug addiction and served thousands more of thier family and friends.
Located in Miami, Florida we are privileged to have met thousands of recovering vacationer’s and business travelers from every state in the country, as well as many other countries around the world. Our members have countless stories of attending AA or NA meetings from South Dakota to South Africa or Pittsburgh to Paris - and joyfully meeting someone that has either been to the Club or knows of our welcoming reputation and spirit.
TESTIMONIAL:
"Little River Club saved my life 14 and 1/2 years ago…..my blood runs through with  Little River sobriety because the people there never gave up on me. I was asked to do service work to help others and as a result I have a life beyond anything I could have imagined. We take in broken and dying people and allow new life to be breathed into them by the process that occurs within the walls. The club is an unparalleled asset to Miami.        Annie P. ($500 Donation)

In late 2011, after almost 50 years of service, we came to the club one morning to find the entrance to our parking lot (behind our building) blocked by a cement barricade. Overnight and without warning, via a directive from the city’s council where we reside (as part of a new initiative to accommodate increased pedestrian walkways) all traffic was cut off from entering our parking lot.  

Also included in the directive were our additional parking places, located on the street in front, which were designated as a no-parking zone as well.  
On that one morning the all-too-familiar story of “the little guy versus city hall” and the politics of “us versus them “ had officially begun.  And just as familiar, the story of contacting attorneys, ensuing legal battles, community groups expressing outrage on the steps of city hall, inside court rooms, and at city council meetings, as well as local media involvement – all followed.  
For the last year and a half we’ve pursued a solution, via city hall, thru attorneys, politicians and court proceedings, spent tens of thousands of dollars and invested countless hours, all the while being met with resistance and a blanket denial for regaining access to our parking lot in the manner we’ve enjoyed for the last 22 years. During the last 18 months, for the first time in our history, we have watched our membership slowly decline.  Our members and guests have simply beenforced to seek more convenient meeting places. Lack of reasonable access to the Club has tried and tested even some of our most loyal members and ardent supporters.  All of them promising to return, waiting for promised changes.  Well those changes are at hand and we truly need your help.    
THE PROJECT:
The solution to re-opening our parking lot and saving our Club is through a multi-phase construction project that entails tearing down the east-end of our building and putting in a driveway to provide thru access via the street running in front of our business (79th Street).
This project will require great leadership and a lot of work and coordination that includes but is not limited to:
CONSTRUCTION:
Demolition of far, east-end of building 
Electrical, plumbing, roofing, interior upgrades
Implementing drive-way from street to parking lot
Building a concrete wall - 125 ft X 6 ft high
Expanding existing parking lot
VOLUNTEERING:
This is also a great project for our volunteers who are inspired and dedicated to doing whatever it takes to get the job done.  A wide cross-section of our general membership, with varied skills and resources, will donate their time, services (and sometimes goods) at no cost to the project.
Their only reward is the satisfaction that they will know they’ve helped in part to ensure the continuation of our solemn tradition of helping those in need and then providing those same people with the opportunity to pass on the gift of recovery to others in the future.  They get to keep their gift by giving it away.
 OVERVIEW:
The overall project is estimated to cost $180,000.  The work will be conducted over a 7-month period, broken down into three (3) phases, each costing $60,000. To show our appreciation we will be providing special gifts, each corresponding with the level of your generous donation.  This site currently reflects only our introductory-story and our initial plans to move the project forward. There will be frequent updates highlighting the progress of the project including pictures, short videos, interesting stories and developments and will include comments from our donors.

story:
This campaign is raising funds on behalf on 2nd Bothwell Scout Group which is a member of the Scout Association (UK). As such we are a registered charity in the UK. Unfortunately, since we are based in the UK this campaign cannot be verified as nonprofit by Indiegogo. All contributions will however go directly to 2nd Bothwell Scout Group.

Who are we?

2nd Bothwell Scout Group are based in Glasgow, Scotland. We've been established since 1919 - only twelve years after Scouting was born! We currently have over 50 members who are aged from 8 all the way up to 17 years old. The Group is completely voluntary and is supported by 6 leaders.
 
In 2005 we decided to change our Neckie of Green and White and adopt the Modern Douglas Tartan. As a Scottish troop we felt a tartan neckie was more apt. Modern Douglas was chosen as it was the Tartan worn by the Cameronians, Lanarkshires own army regiment with a historical base in Hamilton. Until 2008, Hamilton was the Scout District we fell under.
 

The Project

The Group currently has only one tent which was gifted to us by another Scout Group. We have used this tent for the past few years at summer camps and at jamborees where Scouts from around the World meet up. Unfortunately, this tent is over 25 years old and as such is no longer suitable as it does not provide enough protection from the wind and rain - especially on week long camps!
 
 
We are therefore looking to secure funding to help purchase two new tents. This will enable us to replace our existing tent as well as increase the number of people who can attend camps/jamborees. The tents that we are hoping to purchase are the 'old fashioned' canvas style Scout Patrol tent. These tents are made from heavy duty canvas and will easily last over 20 years. Therefore your contribution will have a lasting effect and will benefit both current and future members of the Scout Group!
 

Perks

Remember that any contribution can be made. However. the following perks can be obtained by making the following contributions:

$50 (~£32) Gets You:

  • Our members will send you a personalised thank you note letting you know how your contribution has helped.
  • We will ask you to send us a small picture (such as your avatar/company logo/etc) which we will place on our website under a new section titled    "Friends of Bothwell Scouts'.

$100 (~£65) Gets You:

  • Our members will send you a personalised thank you note letting you know how your contribution has helped.
  • We will ask you to send us a medium sized picture (such as your avatar/company logo/etc) which we will place on our website under a new section titled "Friends of Bothwell Scouts'.
  • We will also send you three badges which our Scout Group wears on their uniform (Clyde Region, Strathcalder District and Scottish National Flag) as well as a Scottish Scouts campfire blanket badge.

$250 (~£162) Gets You:

  • Our members will send you a personalised thank you note letting you know how your contribution has helped.
  • We will ask you to send us a large sized picture (such as your avatar/company logo/etc) which we will place on our website under a new section titled "Friends of Bothwell Scouts'.
  • We will also send you three badges which our Scout Group wears on their uniform (Clyde Region, Strathcalder District and Scottish National Flag) as well as a Scottish Scouts campfire blanket badge.
  • In addition, we will send you one of our Modern Douglas Tartan neckies/necker.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our project. Tell your friends and family. Use the Indiegogo share tools and post us on your Facebook!

Are you a member of the Scouting family? Were you once a member of the organisation? If so, please contact us via our website www.gotwoggle.com. 
 
We would love to chat to you and share Scouting stories and even organise badge swaps!

story:
Why?

We believe that it is our collective responsibility to raise creative, inquisitive, and healthy children, who will nurture our communities and the planet. We don’t think geography should get in the way of maintaining a relationship with a loved one, so we’ve built our service, with three concepts in mind:

1) Gift Experiences.  

You will have the opportunity to gift an experience, to inspire your child's creativity and talent.  Toys capture a child's attention for a short period - experiences can shape a lifetime.

2) The Virtual Village. 

You will have the opportunity to invite friends and family into your virtual village, so that they can participate in your child's growth and inspire their talents and dreams. Members can pool their resources together, so that their dollars go further and create a meaningful impact.

3) The Marketplace. 

You can purchase a service from a local, independent provider.  From a math tutor to grandma next door, we connect you to people in your neighborhood.

The Impact

With your support, we will create a new way for people to stay connected, and to inspire and shape the next generation.  When we facilitate the safe interaction between your child and say, grandma next door, a piano teacher and artist who has raised two generations of children, both parties win!  Knowledge is safely passed on to the next generation, but just as important, this interaction can bring new life and joy into the life of an older person.

Our team has over 50+ years of collective business expertise in the fields of education, technology, environmental sustainability, corporate responsibility, non-profit, policy, government services and entrepreneurship.  We’ve got just the right balance of idealism and pragmatism. Having extensively tested this model, we know it works and we are confident of the value. But we need your help to scale up operations, so we can connect friends and families around the country and soon, anywhere in the world.

The Opportunity

We've made the early investment to build a prototype and are currently testing this beta model. But we need $50,000 to help take this idea, from its early stage to develop it into a live publicly-accessible service.  Your investment will help us scale up and market.  We’ll use some of these funds to incentivize early adopters (both users and service providers) to become regular users.

As a funder, you will receive some exciting perks, including our eco-friendly, sweatshop-free, MADE IN AMERICA, ecoMUKTI tee and sweatshirt, early access to our service, and money back to purchase gifts on our site.  If we don’t reach our goal, we’ll still use every cent to enlist providers and users.  If we exceed our funding goals we'll expand sooner - see section on Stretch Goals below.

How You Can Support

We are reaching out to you, our own virtual village of friends and family, because we know it takes more than a good idea to go to market.  You can support by sharing our platform with your friends and family via an email or social media, blogging about ecoMUKTI gifts, offering comments or feedback, and providing financial support.  Your support can bring this idea to life.  Take a more active role in the life of a loved one. It virtually does take a village to raise a child.  We hope you will join us.

story:
Be apart of a unique avatar community!

Everyone remembers the "glory" days of small internet communities. They were tightly knit communal spaces where people could chat in a casual environment and express their creativity. Now fast forward to 2014 the main internet trending sites now are Facebook, Instagram. Yes, these sites do have giant communities...
However, that same intimacy is gone.
Fed up with this growing trend of "cold" internet community, Miranda (Phoenix), along with the help of her small team, set off to create her own avatar website that could bring back the awesome that is collaborative internet community once more.
So, after spending numerous hours of coding, networking and toiling away at her computer, the avatar website Caedon (SAY-DON) was born!

Alright, I get it, you're an Avatar Site. What makes Caedon so special? 

Besides being forged from the tears and sweat from it's creators, here's a nice bullet point list stating why you SHOULD be so inclined to support us:
  • Unlike most avatar communities that have a generic "Anime" feel to it, Ceadon is set in a High Renaissance Fantasy universe. With added Steampunk flavor.  
  • Our Avatars are even different! Users have the choice of picking not only a male or female avatar but a gender neutral avatar!
  • Caedon is actually fueled by an intense storyline. Want a website that has NPC's with a sloppy backstory slapped on to them for giggles? Sorry. Look else where. 
Sure, those features are all fine and great, but you know what's also pretty neat? You can rest easy knowing that not only are you funding another website but you are also donating towards someone else's dream. Miranda has always wanted to put together such a website, but it's only with the help of her friends and generous fantastique people out there who are just as passionate about these websites as we are.

Okay, you got me. I'm going to donate. Now where the does all the money go?

Money towards this Indigogo campaign will go to directly fixing our website and other small expenses. Which is broken up like this:
  • A shiny new website layout.
  • Our web developers to maintain our website and fix some of our technical issues.

Other Ways You Can Help Caedon Grow!

Not everyone can give a donation, and that's alright but there are ways that you can help us! 
Like us on Facebook! 
Speard the word to your friends, most importantly your friends who want to take part in the awesome that is Caedon!

story:
Hello! I am Chris Foye, father of 13 year old Chris Shakim Owens who was killed by a stray bullet on April 26th, 2009 in Harlem, NY. I am also the CEO/Founder of THE CHRIS S. OWENS FOUNDATION a 501c(3) gun violence prevention and intervention youth and community development organization created in honor of my son to prevent parents like me from experiencing the loss of a child to gun violence. 

I am asking you to partner with CSO and save lives by contributing  funds for the operational costs required to effectively deliver the Gun Violence Prevention and Intervention Youth Empowerment Program. The program consists of conflict resolution techniques and mental health components to prevent the death of innocent children and reckless shootings across the nation.

Your contribution will help us save lives by providing resources and information to at risk teens and young adults who experience financial hardship, lack of resources and positive role models. These resources will increase the impact of CSO programs and services across various schools and communities impacted by gun violence. Together we will make history by doing our part to create a new generation of critical thinkers and safer communities for children to live and grow.

What We Need & What You Get

 We are raising $270,000.00 to operate and administer our program annually in schools and communities impacted by gun violence. Funds will go directly to providing an effective program model staffed with skilled educators and facilitators with expertise in the area of youth gun violence and mental health services. Your contribution will accompany a tax write off and various perks of being a donor of THE CHRIS S. OWENS FOUNDATION Gun Violence Prevention and Intervention Youth Empowerment Program. This includes special VIP tickets to annual events with proof of contribution, subscriber to email list, updates on program progress, social media shares of program participants and access to keynote speakers.

The Impact

Social Transformation:The Impact of our Gun Violence Prevention and Intervention Youth Empowerment Program has influenced hundreds of youth, adults and community members across New York City. We provide alternative solutions to social issues like bullying, peer pressure, gang involvement, violence and negative youth images in the media. 

    Civic Engagement:We successfully engage a variety of stakeholders with projects like our annual Celebrity Holiday Toy Drive, Comedy 4 a Cause, Back to School Events and an Alternative to Gun Violence Sports program. 

    Advocacy: Chris Foye is a keynote speaker for various local and national campaigns like Mayor Michael Bloomberg's, Mayors Against Illegal Guns. Mr. Foye was also an invited guest to the White House to meet with First Lady Michelle Obama to discuss the death of his son and youth gun violence in communities across the Nation. He also participates in senate meetings in Washington DC, and secured 120 thousand signatures from NYC residents to Senators Kristen Gillibrand and Charles Schumer; Demanding a Plan from our nations leaders to effectively address gun control. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with potential contributors and Help us Help Others by funding  

THE CHRIS S. OWENS FOUNDATION Gun Violence Prevention and Intervention Youth Empowerment Program.

Please Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools and make a donation

story:
Steven has Autism.  He competes with the Cumberland County, North Carolina Special Olympics.  He LOVES motorcycles but probably won't ever be able to get a license. That does NOT keep him off his 49cc Honda Ruckus however (it doesn't require a license).  Two years ago he decided he wanted to lead a motorcycle ride around town.  We invited some folks and about six motorcycles showed up.  It was AWESOME!! The next year he decided to do it again.  We thought, there is a great opportunity here for Steven to not only have fun doing what he loves but also to teach him about giving back.  So, we used the ride to raise a little money for our local Special Olympics Teams that Steven competes with and, JUST as importantly, to get each participant to sign a pledge to end the use of the R-word."  26 motorcycles showed up and we raised $400.00.  Every penny raised went to our Athletes and EVERY rider and passenger participated in the recitation of the pledge.  This year, we are upping the ante.  Our goal is 50 motorcycles and $1500.00!  Any little bit is greatly appreciated and hey, if you're in town, get on your bike and c'mon and Ride With THE DOCTAH!  

Oh, and hit the links down below to follow us on Facebook, learn about our program, take the pledge, and watch the full video from last year (it really IS pretty cool)!

 ______________________________________________________________________

The details of what our Special Olympics local program needs and what your generous donation will support:

  • This year, our Unified Volleyball Team has been invited to play at the US Volleyball Invitational in Phoenix, Arizona!  This trip has to be funded by our local program.  We hope to help them realize this dream!
  • This year, for the first time in many years, we are sending Athletes to the Special Olympics USA Games in New Jersey.  We hope to offset some of the costs associated with this so our Athletes can focus on the competition!
  • Equipment!  We have teams in many sports (Soccer, Basketball, Bocce, Cycling, Cheerleading, Equestrian, Aquatics, Athletics...just to name a few) and they need good, serviceable equipment.  Some of what we have is donated but often we have to come out of pocket for replacement items.
  • Uniforms!  Every Athlete in every sport needs to have a jersey or uniform that sets them apart, that tells the WORLD who they are and why they have so much pride!  Our Athletes are no different.
  • Reimbursement of volunteer expenses.  We have a few sports (Equestrian and Cycling come to mind) that are VERY logistically intense.  We like to help offset our volunteers' out of pocket costs as much as possible.  Consider what it takes to support an Equestrian team with 10 Riders that have to practice every week for ten weeks and then move ALL the horses and equipment to and from our State Tournament.  Every little bit helps.

Other ways to help:

  • Spread the word!  Share this with your friends.  Here are some useful links:
  • https://www.facebook.com/#!/doctahsteve
  • http://sonc.net/cumberland/
  • http://www.r-word.org/   Please go to this site and sign the pledge!
  • And finally....last years Vid:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SzUjH9Ik6DM
story_txt:
Steven has Autism.  He competes with the Cumberland County, North Carolina Special Olympics.  He LOVES motorcycles but probably won't ever be able to get a license. That does NOT keep him off his 49cc Honda Ruckus however (it doesn't require a license).  Two years ago he decided he wanted to lead a motorcycle ride around town.  We invited some folks and about six motorcycles showed up.  It was AWESOME!! The next year he decided to do it again.  We thought, there is a great opportunity here for Steven to not only have fun doing what he loves but also to teach him about giving back.  So, we used the ride to raise a little money for our local Special Olympics Teams that Steven competes with and, JUST as importantly, to get each participant to sign a pledge to end the use of the R-word."  26 motorcycles showed up and we raised $400.00.  Every penny raised went to our Athletes and EVERY rider and passenger participated in the recitation of the pledge.  This year, we are upping the ante.  Our goal is 50 motorcycles and $1500.00!  Any little bit is greatly appreciated and hey, if you're in town, get on your bike and c'mon and Ride With THE DOCTAH!  
Oh, and hit the links down below to follow us on Facebook, learn about our program, take the pledge, and watch the full video from last year (it really IS pretty cool)!
 ______________________________________________________________________
The details of what our Special Olympics local program needs and what your generous donation will support:



This year, our Unified Volleyball Team has been invited to play at the US Volleyball Invitational in Phoenix, Arizona!  This trip has to be funded by our local program.  We hope to help them realize this dream!
This year, for the first time in many years, we are sending Athletes to the Special Olympics USA Games in New Jersey.  We hope to offset some of the costs associated with this so our Athletes can focus on the competition!
Equipment!  We have teams in many sports (Soccer, Basketball, Bocce, Cycling, Cheerleading, Equestrian, Aquatics, Athletics...just to name a few) and they need good, serviceable equipment.  Some of what we have is donated but often we have to come out of pocket for replacement items.
Uniforms!  Every Athlete in every sport needs to have a jersey or uniform that sets them apart, that tells the WORLD who they are and why they have so much pride!  Our Athletes are no different.
Reimbursement of volunteer expenses.  We have a few sports (Equestrian and Cycling come to mind) that are VERY logistically intense.  We like to help offset our volunteers' out of pocket costs as much as possible.  Consider what it takes to support an Equestrian team with 10 Riders that have to practice every week for ten weeks and then move ALL the horses and equipment to and from our State Tournament.  Every little bit helps.


Other ways to help:

Spread the word!  Share this with your friends.  Here are some useful links:
https://www.facebook.com/#!/doctahsteve
http://sonc.net/cumberland/

http://www.r-word.org/   Please go to this site and sign the pledge!
And finally....last years Vid:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SzUjH9Ik6DM

story:
Help me raise money to buy food for my team to carry by bike!!  We will be "racing" again this year in the 8th annual SuperMarket Street Sweep on Saturday, December 7, 2013.  Last year I carried 282 lbs. of food across the finish line to donate to those in need on my bike!! 

This year I'm helping to raise funds to support my team: George, Neil and Frankie and I need your help to pay for it! Any money we don't use (because we are unable to carry an ounce more!!) will be DONATED directly to the SF Food Bank.

Every little bit helps!!! thank you so much!!

The Supermarket Street Sweep is an annual bike race that benefits the San Francisco Food Bank! For the past six years, hundreds of participants have zipped around the city to local supermarkets and brought back thousands of pounds of food to donate to this wonderful charity.

http://supermarketstreetsweep.blogspot.com/

SMSW stats:
2006: 80 racers - 1,172 lbs of food
2007: 110 racers - 1,595 lbs.
2008: 150 racers - 5,266 lbs.
2009: 198 racers - 7,507 lbs.
2010: 171 racers - 6,920 lbs. + $4,877

2011: 201 racers - 7,990 lbs. + $9,552

2012: 119 racers - 6,552 lbs. + $7405.64 

Total Meals To Date:
118,169


You can also sign up to join the race! it is tons of fun! Big fun after-party too!

love,

bridget

story:
Short Summary

My name is Andrew Barnett, I am the owner operator of "Friends Not Food Ltd".

For the past 14 years I have worked in hospitality in Inverness in various roles from waiting staff to general manager. About 4 years ago I decided to turn vegetarian and quickly realised I missed my favourite food - Haggis. Not quite content with the vegetarian alternatives I set out to make a vegan haggis that tasted and felt like the real deal. The success of doing this inspired me to continue re inventing the foods that we all miss, inspired me to go vegan and ultimately to open a cafe/restaurant that would both inspire and delight vegans and also be accessible to omnivores and carnivores.   

On the 1st December we will get the keys to our beautiful new city centre premises, and that is when the hard work will start. This campaign will help to fit our kitchen, build our bar and furnish our place with tables and chairs etc. Your contribution and the success of this campaign will help to make the difference between being a place for vegans, and being the coolest place in town that just happens to be 100% vegan.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have placed a goal of £500 as that is the minimum. I have put my life savings in to this venture as I am extremely passionate about what we do and determined to make a success of it. Your contributions and support will determine the degree of that success.

We understand that people don't like to fork out, so to sweeten the deal we have a range of benefits up for grabs from coffee, merchandise, food and drink to Lifetime discounts!

The campaign is scheduled to end in the first week of December and all rewards will be available in time for Christmas presents!

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any new cafe or restaurant there may be risks and challenges, however I feel we are in a beneficial start point for several reasons. Having operated pop up restaurant evenings and running stalls at food and craft fairs we have an established customer base from which to build on.

We have been approached several times when doing pop ups by local journalists who are keen to run a story about the first vegan restaurant or cafe in Inverness and along with Inverness Bid, WhatsHappening Inverness, Vegan Inverness and our own followers I believe we will have lots of excitement and anticipation from free advertising and word of mouth.

 

Further more I believe that my time within the hospitality trade has given me the knowledge and experience necessary to navigate this challenging road ahead.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't get involved and help out.

You can share this campaign on social media and amongst your friends and families, talk about what we are planning to do, and shout about the need for a vegan place in the capital of the highlands. 

Or if your friends or family don't know what to get you for christmas, have a look at our rewards and make a christmas list!

story:
Who we are

  • Segundo Barrio Futbol Club promotes the development of youth soccer players and teams in El Paso's Segundo Barrio neighborhood. We are committed to the growth of well rounded youth through sportsmanship, teamwork, discipline and fun.
  • We work with at-risk youth in one of the poorest neighborhoods in the country. We currently have two youth teams: Under 10s and under 11s.
  • Segundo Barrio Futbol Club is seeking to raise funds to enable us to register as a 501 (c)(3) non profit corporation. 
  • Up to now we have had to rely on the generosity of individual donors. Obtaining 501 (c)(3) status will allow up to apply for the many grants and other types of financial support that are available for sports programs that work with at-risk youth. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $750 to cover the IRS fee to apply to register as a 501 (c)(3) non profit corporation.

           Perks are:

  • $25: Signed photograph of the team
  • $50: Signed photograph of the team plus an embroidered Segundo Barrio Futbol Club patch
  • $100: Segundo Barrio Futbol Club shirt

 

The Impact

  • Once we obtain 501 (c)(3) non profit corporation status we will be able to apply for grants and other financial support which will enable us to not only strenghten our program but also to expand it.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are not able to help out right now please share this information with friends and family who you think may be interested in helping out.

story:
Start a Ripple With Us...

We are two grandmothers on a mission to inspire kindness in individuals and our communities.

Did you know

  • It is estimated that 160,000 children miss school every day due to fear of attack or intimidation by other students.
  • 1 out of 20 students has seen a student with a gun at school
  • 86% of students said, “other kids picking on them, making fun of them or bullying them” causes teenagers to turn to lethal violence in the schools
  • In 2011, an estimated 1,203,564 violent crimes occurred nationwide
  • Some 2 million American workers are victims of workplace violence each year
  • The number of hate groups in the U.S.  has grown each year for the past 11 years, according to a new report from the Southern Poverty Law Center
  • Community breakdown is related to public attitudes and society's weakening belief in the power of community and communal responses

Our society is rapidly changing and it's time for a KINDNESS MOVEMENT. We are raising funds here to create The Kindness Wave, a movement to inspire individuals and communities to create a kinder, more caring place to live.  And we want to build an awesome and interactive website, a focal point where "all things kind" can come together and awaken everyday kindness in everyone.

There are organizations out there already, many of them targeting our schools, to help make the world a kinder place. However, many of these efforts are suffering during these difficult economic times. The Kindness Wave will link them all together and help fund their success. We have worked hard over the last year putting together the details to make this dream happen. Now we need your help.

 

 

 

Do you believe kindness can change the world?             The Kindness Wave does and we need your help spreading the word! Will you join us?

Each and every one of us is important and when we recognize this very significant fact, we are empowered       to make a real difference.

The Kindness Wave believes everyone has the ability to be kind and that a little kindness creates more kindness. What if all of us were kind everyday? The world would be a different place; that's for sure.

 

Benefits of Being Kind

Research suggests that once you start doing nice things for other people, you won't want to stop. Studies have proven giving to others makes us happy, maybe even happier than spending on ourselves. There is some evidence that being habitually altruistic raises dopamine levels in the brain, which leaves people feeling a sense of calm, greater self-worth, an absence of emotional stress, and generally happier. In addition, scientists have discovered ‘mirror neurons’ in the brain that mimic what people see on the faces of others so that they can feel what those others are feeling. Being kind is contagious, creating a ripple effect that truly has no end, making the world a kinder place.

                            

The Website Details

The Kindness Wave will be creating an online social community where each member will have an online profile so they can share and grow kindness together. The site will link communities together showcasing their events and inspire other communities to join them. There are numerous organizations that promote kindness and we will be seeking to link all of them on the site and featuring one monthly. Each organization featured will receive 10% of that months net profit. We will generate revenue through the sale of a trackable kindness card, a kindness store and business sponsorship. The site will be filled with infomation about kindness including, quotes, ideas, what kindness is, why be kind, kindness in action and much more. Our Wave News will feature stories about kind acts from all over the world. All this and much more coming soon!

 

Where the Funds are Going

  1. Towards building a truly innovative, interactive social-networking website
  2. To create a tracking system to track the kindness cards around the globe
  3. Advertising on social media, the internet and radio to get the word out
  4. Initiate a Resolution for a National Day of Kindness in the US
  5. To cover the perks here on Indiegogo and the campaign fee
  6. 10% of the funds will be donated to organizations promoting kindness


Just in case the goal isn't met here, we want all of you to know we are completely commited to fulfilling this mission!

 

The Impact

You've heard the term "Random Acts of Kindness" right? It is a term that was coined over 30 years ago that has produced countless acts of kindness. While it has produced many good things, it is now time to awaken Everyday Kindness in the hearts of everyone everywhere. The Kindness Wave will lead the way by providing a platform where everyone can join together in a collective effort, creating kinder communities everyday. We've already had great response on our Facebook page with over 17,000 likes in less a month from people all over the globe. Now we want to create a unique social networking website that provides lots of opportunities for people to share and grow kindness, improving the lives of all who join us. Will you be one of them?

 

   

   Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can donate or not, we would love it if you helped us get the word out! Please use Indiegogo’s helpful share tools to create a ripple effect with your kind gesture. The  tools are right here on this page under the video for Twitter, Facebook, email, and other methods for letting your friends, family, and social network know about The Kindness Wave. Also, please share your thoughts and ideas with us in the comments section found at the top of this campaign.

 

 

 

 

Special Thanks

To everyone everywhere for sharing kindness everyday!

Start a ripple... Create a wave. It begins with YOU!

story:
Here's the plan

  • Assemble a group of individuals that are passionate about tech and donating it to people and organizations in need.
  • Reach out to schools, libraries, homeless shelters, and community centers and determine what essential software they need on the computers.
  • Gather donated equipment.
  • Do the work. Install Linux and other free and open source software. 
  • Deliver and train staff at the site on how to make use of their new equipment.

Follow #techrehabnj on Twitter to see what we do

How the money will be utilized

Here are some estimated costs so people can see where our money will be spent.

  • Work Space - We'll need to rent a space to work in that has a few power outlets we can use. $100 per weekend * 3 weekends = $300.
  • 5' x 5' Storage Space -  To keep the computers, monitors, and accessories. $70 per month.
  • Teaching Materials - When we go onsite we'll train staff. We think we'll make that experience better with some printed materials, a whiteboard, and some paper. $60
  • Transportation, Parking - We need gas to fuel the cars that we will use to transport computers, and money to cover parking costs. $45
  • Odds and Ends - We will need to purchase power strips, mice, mouse pads, networking equipment, etc. $100

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Assembling a very usable final product for our target audience. Most computer users are familiar with Windows, and we're going to have to convince those in charge of spaces and organizations that free and open source software can work for them, and furthermore, is a tool that is better in many respects.

We'll do this by asking people what their needs are first, and using that information to guide what we offer. We'll thoughtfully articulate how the computers we donate can easily be used and provide valuable, need-to-know training.

Images licensed under the Creative Commons. Thanks towoodleywonderworks ,_Max-, Enokson.il_g, Holtsman, Mindful_one

story:
Who are we

We started a group with a bunch of people from the UAE interested in being involved with communities. The aim of this group is to work with communities helping in their development and empowerment making them sustainable in the long run. The NGO we are working with for this current project KYEMPAPU based in Central Uganda shares a common objective with us which is to mitigate climate change and promote environmentally conscious behavior. In 2011 KYEMPAPU received the Environment award at the Eno Act Now Forest Conference in Finland. Some of their other objectives are to work towards community cohesion, empowering the youth by education and promote the importance of healthcare and sanitation. In this current project we want to help them raise funds for one of their community development programs to be held on the International Women's Day. The objective is to empower the women of the society by involving them in different activities throughout the day and communicating the importance of women in the society.

What we want to do

Women from different towns/districts will be involved in this event. The day will host a number of events including the likes of planting trees, environmental advocacy, discussions about domestic violence against women, netball games, crafts making by women, etc. 

Why it is important

Community unity is an integral step towards development and growth. One can achieve this through creating a platform for interaction between the different members of the community. Communication and sharing of ideas are key aspects in this road towards development which is why it is so important for us to organize this event. The main goal of this day would be to create Unity among women from different communities and Talk about ideas on how to handle gender based violence. It would also lead to increased number of trees planted in the community. Since there is a problem of illiteracy among the youth of the community, it is important that direct communication is involved to discuss social issues like the one mentioned above. Through the course of discussions and activities involving and revolving around women, a clear message will be sent out to the community on the role and importance of women.

What we need

For the entire event, we require about US $2200. Most of it goes into buying seedlings for tree planting. A part of the fund will be required for providing food and drinks for the day, renting tents, chairs etc., paying the staff and the press and basic transportation needs.

The community is faced with another problem of large number of teenaged girls dropping out of school due to the unavailability of proper sanitation. They do not have enough money to buy sanitary towels and thus, abstain from school during their period to avoid being made fun of by the boys when their clothes have blood stains. This eventually leads to early age marriages in most cases as the girls usually stay home and are uneducated. In order to overcome this issue our team would be developing an educational program on sanitation and health for young kids at school. Through skype meetings or sending over the program structure to the teachers at the local schools, we aim to overcome this problem. In the meantime the funds that are in excess to the pledged amount will be used to buy sanitary napkins for the 800 odd school girls in 3 schools in the Masaka district.

What you get

Of course all this is only possible by your generosity. Your donations will not only make this event a reality but also achieve more long term goals of Women Empowerment and Community Cohesion. The event involves a lot of tree plantings helping achieve the community their long term goal of climate change mitigation.

 In order to show you our appreciation for your endeavoring support and trust in us we are setting up a system for perks based on your contributions. Check out the right panel for a list of what you can get.

Other Ways you can help

We understand that it’s not always possible to contribute monetarily even though one has the urge to make a difference. Don’t worry, we have something else in mind for you. Post the link on your social media pages including Indiegogo share tools and promote our campaign to all your friends and colleagues.
story_txt:
Who are we
We started a group with a bunch of people from the UAE interested in being involved with communities. The aim of this group is to work with communities helping in their development and empowerment making them sustainable in the long run. The NGO we are working with for this current project KYEMPAPU based in Central Uganda shares a common objective with us which is to mitigate climate change and promote environmentally conscious behavior. In 2011 KYEMPAPU received the Environment award at the Eno Act Now Forest Conference in Finland. Some of their other objectives are to work towards community cohesion, empowering the youth by education and promote the importance of healthcare and sanitation. In this current project we want to help them raise funds for one of their community development programs to be held on the International Women's Day. The objective is to empower the women of the society by involving them in different activities throughout the day and communicating the importance of women in the society.
What we want to do
Women from different towns/districts will be involved in this event. The day will host a number of events including the likes of planting trees, environmental advocacy, discussions about domestic violence against women, netball games, crafts making by women, etc. 
Why it is important
Community unity is an integral step towards development and growth. One can achieve this through creating a platform for interaction between the different members of the community. Communication and sharing of ideas are key aspects in this road towards development which is why it is so important for us to organize this event. The main goal of this day would be to create Unity among women from different communities and Talk about ideas on how to handle gender based violence. It would also lead to increased number of trees planted in the community. Since there is a problem of illiteracy among the youth of the community, it is important that direct communication is involved to discuss social issues like the one mentioned above. Through the course of discussions and activities involving and revolving around women, a clear message will be sent out to the community on the role and importance of women.
What we need
For the entire event, we require about US $2200. Most of it goes into buying seedlings for tree planting. A part of the fund will be required for providing food and drinks for the day, renting tents, chairs etc., paying the staff and the press and basic transportation needs.
The community is faced with another problem of large number of teenaged girls dropping out of school due to the unavailability of proper sanitation. They do not have enough money to buy sanitary towels and thus, abstain from school during their period to avoid being made fun of by the boys when their clothes have blood stains. This eventually leads to early age marriages in most cases as the girls usually stay home and are uneducated. In order to overcome this issue our team would be developing an educational program on sanitation and health for young kids at school. Through skype meetings or sending over the program structure to the teachers at the local schools, we aim to overcome this problem. In the meantime the funds that are in excess to the pledged amount will be used to buy sanitary napkins for the 800 odd school girls in 3 schools in the Masaka district.
What you get
Of course all this is only possible by your generosity. Your donations will not only make this event a reality but also achieve more long term goals of Women Empowerment and Community Cohesion. The event involves a lot of tree plantings helping achieve the community their long term goal of climate change mitigation.
 In order to show you our appreciation for your endeavoring support and trust in us we are setting up a system for perks based on your contributions. Check out the right panel for a list of what you can get.
Other Ways you can help
We understand that it’s not always possible to contribute monetarily even though one has the urge to make a difference. Don’t worry, we have something else in mind for you. Post the link on your social media pages including Indiegogo share tools and promote our campaign to all your friends and colleagues.

story:
Help us found a tour company that offers walking tours for small groups. Localite Tours go to the best spots and hidden places of the San Francisco Bay Area. Localite Tours will challenge and improve what people expect from a tour company, and inspire people to be local everywhere they go.

In the works, we've got a Pork Tour of Chinatown and Old Oakland, an after-work Retro Cocktail Tour, and the From Scratch Tour exploring the why and how of handmade goods. We’re launching soon! Our first tour to heads out on March 23, 2013, but we greatly need your help.
Please help this vision of ours come true! 
Who and what are behind Localite Tours?

We're Serena Laing and Gretchen Ludwig, and we are determined to rejuvenate the tour business and give people an alternative to the status quo of guided tours. Forget megaphones, double decker buses, forced-enthusiasm, and memorized guide scripts, Localite offers a new generation of guided experiences.  We put to use our international and cultural studies degrees, our years writing guidebooks, and our savvy for sleuthing about to uncover the most excellent local experiences. 
Our tours expose the truth behind places; we draw out the essence of what people mean when they call a place home. Well-researched and designed around themes, the tours we create explore each place from many angles. Localite Tours will focus on the history, art, culture, people, cuisine, politics and more, offering a dynamic perspective of the neighborhoods we visit.
Localite Tours are fun, unique and insightful! 
We’re at the crossroads of Ready, Set, Go! But, we are in need of fuel!
Why does Localite need funds to start walking tours?

+We need to pay for our test tours. With our minimum goal of running each tour twice before launching, we need funds to get these tours going before we've got paying guests. 

+We need to pay for marketing efforts! If no one knows about Localite we are sure to sputter out. We have a comprehensive marketing plan that has to be fully rolled out in order that these storytelling experiences succeed. We need to tell a lot of people about this vision of ours, and how they can take part.

+Website development and maintenance. The software needed to run our site and allow everyone to book tours has been selected, but it is not free. We want the level of service we offer to be across-the-board great.

+Book keeping software & services. 

+Documenting the stories we glean. We're creating videos to keep a record of all the tales from the past and present on our tour routes. We've also planned to film more experiences in areas where we're not running tours. We've got the camera, Final Cut, a tripod, and we are assembling a team to make our tours available via the internet. This is a key component so we don't lose the research we are doing, and the cross sections of narratives can be preserved for the future. 

Why Localite Tours are so important to us:

We believe that tours can be a vehicle for understanding. By interacting with places and people in a way that showcases their specialities and talents, tour-goers gain new ways of engaging with the world. If you're living in the neighborhood you'll get a mini vacation without leaving our town; if you're visiting you will get the most personal and pithy slice of the inspiring East Bay and beyond.

Our tours capture the stories that have wandered off - some are hiding in dusty books, some are deep in the minds of local craftspeople, chefs, and business owners, some are lost on microfiche, others come from the mouths of anthropologists and historians and the generations of elders who know the secrets that have long since been paved over. We are natural-born documentarians, and we want to bring back the multifaceted oral histories of the Bay Area and beyond.

Localite Tours is here to connect people and share stories. Help us see this through!

Thank you’s for our treasured funders!

Link to our favorite views.
For $25, Localite will send you a link to a self-guided tour of some of the Bay Area's most spectacular Vistas!

Fancy Napkins.
For $50, we will send you a pair of reusable, snazzy, Localite screen-printed napkins.

Gift certificate for a Localite tour.
For $200, we will send you a transferable e*gift certificate to take a tour with Localite.

Private custom tour!
For $500, Localite will take you and a friend on a customized private tour of the Bay Area City of your choice. (After all, we have written five guidebooks to the place…) We will build a tour around your interests and the location you would like to explore. Leave it all up to us and we will surprise you.



Help us spread the word:

Anything helps, even if you can't contribute funds, help us reach our goal by:

+Sharing this campaign! Don’t be afraid to pass the word on about our IndieGoGo campaign, you never know who is interested and may be able to help.

+Spread the word! Send your friends and family our way, especially if they are in Northern California!

Learn more about us at: www.Localitetours.com

Have a look at our pretty pictures of interesting places: http://instagram.com/localitetours/

Tweet with us at: https://twitter.com/LocaliteTours

+Email us! If you are a business in the SF Bay Area and would like to discuss partnering so some way, email us! If you have ideas, stories, places you think should get some exposure, email us!

Info@Localitetours.com

What's next?

Our initial tour offerings include: The From Scratch Tour, The Pork Tour, The Urban Flowers Tour, The Retro Cocktails Tour, and The Traveling Feast Dinner Tour. 

Next up are tours in Silicon Valley, Livermore Valley and San Francisco.

...And this is just the beginning... We plan to go big and eventually spread into other areas of California and the United States. We have miles and miles of ideas. We’d love for you to be a valued founding member of our team!

story:
We started Roaring Forties Press (www.roaringfortiespress.com) a few years ago to publish books that show readers a different world than they are already familiar with. Now we’re expanding the range of the authors we give voice to by acquiring books that we love that have been published in other countries (and sometimes in other languages) so we can share them with American and UK audiences.

As the world becomes ever more interconnected, writers outside the US and the UK have much to tell us about both their world and ours. Roaring Forties Press is raising money to give some of these authors a voice in the US and the UK. Roaring Forties Press has a unique opportunity to obtain rights to half a dozen books that are sure to change readers’ perception of notions as huge as the universe and as tiny as one man’s story of finding himself in new emotional territory when his wife disappears.

We’re raising $20,000, which will be used to acquire rights and produce books that have already been published in other countries and to which we have already been offered the rights. If we don’t reach our full goal, we’ll use the funds that we do raise to produce as many books as possible!

With your help, we can give these engaging writers the chance to reach a larger audience.


When you support our New Voices campaign, you will receive the following:

$10: If you believe in giving excellent storytellers a chance to be read in the US and the UK, consider supporting our effort by giving $10. We'll send you an ebook version of any of our current titles.

$25: Advance Ebook: An advance electronic copy of the first book we publish under the New Voices program.

$50: Advance Ebook and Print Book: An advance electronic copy and an advance print copy of the first book we publish under the New Voices program.

$100: Supporter of a Different View: A mention on our website on a page called Supporters of a Different View (and advance copies of the first couple books we publish under this program).

$250: Acknowledgment in Print: A shout-out in the acknowledgements section of the books we publish with this funding (and all the above).

$500: Advance copies of all the books we publish under this program (and all the above).

$1000: We’ll set up a meeting with one of our authors (and all the above).

$2000: Personal Tour of NYC: Next time you’re in NYC, we’ll arrange a personal tour of Dorothy Parker’s New York with best-selling author Kevin Fitzpatrick. And of course all the above!

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

My name is David Reese and I have a Smokehouse. I make BBQ, and Seafood. I also have a catering licensce. I am from Memphis, TN and I encorporate that background into my BBQ.

Here on Cape Cod, we have long summers and even longer winters. We also have lots of people who leave Cape Cod because they are having a hard time finding a job. Finding work is never easy but in this particular economy it is even harder, especially on the Cape. With this vision, we can change that.

Thanks to the Department of Agriculture, we now have a way to keep our business running year round. It's called the Farm-to-School Program. This program allows selective small busineeses (that qaulify) such as ourselves to sell our Seafood drirectly to the schools in the Commonwealth of Massachussetts.

With this new program, we went out and did taste testings at schools all over the Cape and the results are in. 90% of the students said they wanted our seafood cakes, casseroles, seafood (shepherd's) pies as part of their lunches.

There are over 400 school districts in the Commonwealth, we have 6 schools lined up and we are on our way to contracting many more.

Right now, our equipment can process hundreds of our seafood products in a day, we want to change that to thousands. But to do that, we need equipment and that is why we are fundraising.

Which is where you come in. By contributing to our goal, you will be helping us purchase new equipment to make, process, sell, and deliver our products to the schools. With this new equipment, our business will be able to provide year round work in a pleasant working environment with good wages to the everyday person.

Help us make it possible for people to live on Cape Cod!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word, help us achieve our goal.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About Bo Twal

Hi, I'm Deborah Fisher. I have 25 years of design and sewing experience and am the Director of the non-profit Bright Hopes Collaborative Quilt Project.

I’m working with an amazing group of women to build a new non-profit organization called Bo Twal -- “cloth kiss” in Haitian Creole -- and we’re reaching out to you to help us fund the launch. Our mission is twofold: First, we’ll provide lovely, soft, handmade cloth dolls to children in underdeveloped countries. Second, we’ll create a much-needed source of income in these countries for members of the sewing cooperatives that will be making and distributing the dolls. Our project will begin in Haiti and expand to other countries.

Our Financial Plan

With the exception of this campaign and our initial launch, our organization is designed to be self-sustaining. We’ll accomplish this through the sale of doll patterns and kits (the first of which is our “Sewing Smiles” pattern), offered via our web page and our Etsy site.

We need to raise $2,450 for our launch of Bo Twal. These funds will be used for:

  • $1,150 for the first print run of “Sewing Smiles” doll patterns
  • $255 for the initial production of 20 dolls
  • $475 to cover the costs of incorporating as a nonprofit
  • $570 to cover our attorney, accountant, and other professional fees

If we do not meet our goal, we’ll scale back the size of our launch as needed. If we raise more than our goal, we’ll increase our initial production run to 50 dolls (or more) and consult with an additional nonprofit professional to assist with our incorporation paperwork.

To Thank You for Your Support

We have a number of delightful perks to thank you for your donation. Depending on your level of support, we’ll send you: a mini Bo Twal tote bag; a mini doll that’s been designed especially for our launch campaign; your own full-size “Sewing Smiles” doll; or a combination of these items for larger contributions.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for your interest in our campaign and the Bo Twal organization! We hope you’ll be able to support us with a donation. There are many other ways to help, as well, including:

  • Sharing this campaign with your friends via email, facebook, and twitter using the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Visiting and and sharing our Etsy site -- botwal.etsy.com -- where doll patterns and kits will soon be available.

story:
Addis Skatepark built Ethiopia's first skatepark at the Besrate Gabriel Kebele Youth Center in central Addis Ababa. Local youth helped create their own community skatepark and learned from our team of over 60 international skatepark builders about construction. We are currently setting up a free on-site loaner program to make skateboarding equipment accessible to everyone. 

Help make the biggest possible impact with the skatepark loaner program and Contribute Now

Addis Skatepark on opening day April 16th. Pictures of the build available in the gallery

Why a loaner program?

Addis Skatepark provides a space to inspire creativity and community through skateboarding, accommodating the growing demand for skateboarding in a safe place. Excitement among local youth during the creation of Addis Skatepark already showed the immense impact the skatepark will have on their community. With the loaner program, we want to make sure that everybody has access to skateboarding. Listen to this BBC interview with Addis Skatepark to find out more: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p03r1nmc

BBC interview about the loaner program available at  www.bbc.co.uk

Construction was led by Make Life Skate Life

Make Life Skate Life is a non-profit organization that works with local skateboarding communities throughout the world to create free of charge concrete skateparks. Projects are led by professional skatepark builders and involve local communities in the planning and construction process. 

Local youth helped to build their own skatepark.

Addis Skatepark is operated by Ethiopia Skate

Ethiopia Skate is a local community of skateboarders based in Addis Ababa working to promote the accessibility of skateboarding throughout the country and create opportunities for urban youth to feel empowered, hopeful, and creative in their lives. Since 2013, Ethiopia Skate has been able to provide access to skateboarding equipment to over 150 kids across Ethiopia. Classes will be taught regularly and an on-site loaner skateboard program will be operated to provide free of charge skateboards, safety equipment, and skate shoe rentals, so that all youth can enjoy the skatepark, even though most can not afford to purchase their own gear.

Thanks for your support!

Help us get the word out about the Addis Skatepark campaign by sharing the project with friends and family.

For the latest project updates, follow @addispark on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. You can reach us at addisskatepark@gmail.com.

Show your support for Addis Skatepark and Contribute Now! All donations go through Make Life Skate Life, a German registered non-profit organization.

concrete skateparks. Projects are led by professional skatepark builders and involve local
communities in the planning and construction process. Local youth helped to build their own skatepark. Addis Skatepark is
operated by Ethiopia Skate

Ethiopia Skate is a local community of skateboarders based in
Addis Ababa working to promote the accessibility of skateboarding
throughout the country and create opportunities for urban youth to feel
empowered, hopeful, and creative in their lives. Since 2013, Ethiopia Skate has
been able to provide access to skateboarding equipment to over 150 kids across Ethiopia. Classes will be taught regularly and an on-site loaner skateboard program will be operated to provide free of charge skateboards, safety equipment, and skate shoe rentals, so that all youth can enjoy the skatepark, even though most can not afford to purchase their own gear.


Thanks for your support!
Help us get the word out about the Addis Skatepark campaign by
sharing the project with friends and family. 
For the latest project updates, follow @addispark on Facebook,
Instagram, and Twitter. You can reach us at addisskatepark@gmail.com.
Show your support for Addis Skatepark and Contribute Now! All
donations go through Make Life Skate Life, a German registered non-profit
organization.

story:
The Lake Alabaster Box - website

"In less than 5 minutes, if you can't put your hands on ALL of your important Personal or Estate Planning information then please support this Campaign with ANY amount that you can afford!" (i.e. Life Insurance policies, a Will, Power of Attorney, a Medical Directive, letters to each of your children, or pics of your family and college friends, etc.) 

If we obtain a "minimum" of 300 to 500 people that support this Project with at least a $20 contribution each, (between April 23 and April 25 at 7:00am EST) for a total of $6,000 to $10,000 for TLAB, then each person will be entered into a raffle drawing, for a chance to win a free trip to Austin, TX. 

Five (5) individuals along with one companion, will be flown to Austin, TX in Coach Class, for our Grand Opening (from any where in the world, from the airport closest to their home city.)   These five (5) individuals and their one companion, will also receive a three day, two night free stay at a hotel in Austin, Texas.  There will be five (5) contributors selected from this LAST pitch effort, for our new Tech Start-Up.

People can experience having a natural disaster occur like a tornado or flood.  And even have their homes burn to the ground, and lose ALL of their important documents!

Our Mission here at The Lake Alabaster Box, is to ensure that every individual, regardless of their income level, race, country of origin, religion, or sexual orientation, has access to the best affordable, confidential, secure, and reasonably priced Estate Planning Service, 24-hours a day, and 365 days a year.

As a 3rd-Party provider, we are totally committed to providing families, with the "first" opportunity for everyone in their family all over the world, to have a secure and confidential place to electronically store and protect their individual Estate information at a minimal, annual cost.  People say "Well I have a sibling, or my children, or a cousin, or someone that I really trust!" 

Well, those ARE some of the people who have taken, or will take advantage of you or your loved ones.  We are asking for your support, as we have spoken with numerous people who say SOMEONE in their family has been taken advantage of "that they trusted!"  Or, sadly they have a friend who just finished medical school and died unexpectedly at the young age of 31, leaving their family to decide whom he wanted to receive his prized possessions. 

We do NOT provide legal services!!  Usually, it costs approximately $100 - $500 per hour to meet with an Estate Planning attorney, and we realize most people can't afford those service fees.  But, Indiegogo is allowing us to help you and your families, to be at the forefront of a widely needed and affordable service. 

We read everyday how celebrities, and others who have massive fortunes, are in battles over their deceased loved one's Estates.  Well, if there are problems between their families after their death, the majority of us don't stand a chance of being in control of our Estates after death..............until NOW!

The Lake Alabaster Box will be offered all over the world, not just in the U.S.  But, we can't do it without your support........at any level that you can afford!

So, unless you know the exact day you're going to die, please support The Lake Alabaster Box, and be entered into the raffle for our Grand Opening in Austin, for EVERY $20 you contribute!

Thank you in advance for your consideration!

Respectfully, 

Merike Manley, for "The Lake Alabaster Box"

story:
Who We Are

When this company was created, donors in the Pacific North West invested in giving women the opportunity to take the feeling of empowerment for themselves. Not surprisingly, this idea worked! After one year of successful business, She Moves Mountains has hosted 40 clinics and worked with over 300 women and counting. Not to mention, created an increasingly prevalent scholarship program called The JoJo scholarship that funds one new woman a month to participate in a clinic for an entire year.  

Now, we want to create this on the east coast, starting with Chattanooga, Tennessee.

Chattanooga will be the center point, serving women from Atlanta, Nashville, Asheville, Memphis, Knoxville, Huntsville, Birmingham and other surrounding cities. Your favorite clinics from She Moves Mountains Pacific Northwest will be held here.

We will be hosting five different clinic types from September-May.

These instructional clinics will be taught by an all-female staff of professional rock climbing guides certified through the American Mountain Guide Association.

Our clinics are for all levels of experience from the beginner climber who has never put on rock climbing shoes to the daily crusher at the gym looking to broaden her abilities on sport or trad outside. Meanwhile, we're creating a community of confident women who can dominate whatever objective they set their mind towards. 

To make this happen we need a little help. Here's what your donation will go towards.

 

1. Equipment

We want to offer gear essentials to our clients without any additional cost. That includes:

·       Adjustable Harnesses

·       Helmets

·       Rock Climbing Shoes

·       Belay Devices

·       Rock Climbing Ropes 

·       Quickdraws 

·       Steel Locking Carabiners

·       Anchor Setups  

·       Non-Locking Carabiners

·       Traditional Climbing Equipment

·       Crashpads

 

2. Guide Training

This entails the ability to bring in a certified guide from the AMGA with a higher certification to help with extensive guide training and education.

3. Miscellaneous

We will need funds for liability insurance, licensing, crag maintenance, marketing, and money to cover the cost of this campaign.

 

The Impact

The purpose of women-specific events is not to exclude men; it is to uplift and empower women. 

We live in a world where women are underrepresented in leadership roles across the board - from the outdoor industry and guiding to government and top executives or CEO's. According to the American Mountain Guide Association, less than 12% of certified climbing guides are female.

As female rock climbers, guides, and business owners - She Moves Mountains is our opportunity to challenge this disparity. Our hope is that our work will encourage other women to do the same. She Moves Mountains provides opportunities to grow as rock climbers, but the dream is that climbing will give women the confidence to take on any challenge. 

The business model of She Moves Mountains is a proven success and is one of the many reasons why we want to bring this to the East Coast. We feel these opportunities could benefit an innumerable amount of women on our side of the country just like it has for people in the Pacific Northwest.

Here are some thoughts from Chattanooga climbers who believe in the importance of these clinics:

"Climbing has been dominated by males for a long time.  Males and females are completely different when it comes to their bodies, obviously.  Getting training advice from a male rock climber will provide some useful tips but getting that advice from another female would be more beneficial in the long run.  Having women-specific clinics makes it easier for females to ask different questions and be more open.  We are wired differently - so getting advice and tips from other females will ultimately get us to the results we are looking for faster." 

Kasia Pietras, Regional Director of Route Setting at MetroRock Climbing Gym

 

"Female climbers are equally as capable as their male counterparts. We see this proven every day in our local gyms, at the crag or boulder field, and during competitions. That being said, the methods in which male and female climbers approach, consume, interpret, and apply climbing and training skills can vary greatly. 

At its core, education, regardless of the topic, is entirely about finding the best method of learning, understanding, and application of knowledge. The folks at She Moves Mountains are making climbing education accessible and approachable for women in environments where they have been traditionally underrepresented." 

Cody Grodzki, Director of Route Setting at High Point Climbing Gym

 

Why Contribute?

Put simply, we love what we do and want to share it with others. The empowerment gained from our rock climbing clinics will give the women of our community a foundation and confidence to take on any challenge.

Please help us in our endeavor.

Thank you to our sponsors for the support!

story:
Short Summary

Brii the Baker here, and I would absolutely LOVE to make my hobby into a Part Time Gig!!!  I absolutely love to bake and I've noticed and heard that cupcakes are my specialty!! Cupcakes are just the right amount of love, sweet, and fun any person could have.  My all time favorite cupcakes to make are Cookies and Cream cupcakes; but I'd love an excuse to make all kinds of cupcakes I've thought up, concocted or swapped!!

Basically, for everything (web site, supplies, commercial kitchen, branding, shipping items) I would need $4,400. Eeks! Slightly steep but well worth it!!  I will use absolutely only the freshest ingredients (such as in my strawberry lemonade or lemon basil cupcakes, or a better chocolate for the cookies and cream cupcakes; and even the finest top quality gluten free flour for the gluten sensitive). I will also need to pay rent at the commercial kitchen I would rent (Commercial Kitchens, thank you for being amazing) and finally, money for the most comprehensive, kick-ass cupcake site you've ever seen!

I'm a girl who loves to feed the world and feels she does it best through cupcakes. I have yet to disappoint with any cupcake I've made, and I would just love to prove myself on a national scale that I am amazing at what I do.  Any money funded (thank you in advanced!!) yet hasn't reached my goal, will stay in my savings account until I reach my goal in some form or another.

Can't contribute?  That's quite alright!! https://twitter.com/Brii_The_Baker and we can swap recipes and discuss baking. :)
