story:
I’m Joanne Reeves-Baker, a transformation expert with years of working in the personal development industry. I have lived my entire adult life in pain. I have lost jobs, friendships, relationships. I have had surgeries and the heartbreak of infertility. I am strong, I am weak. I am brave, I am scared. I have an illness, but it does not have me.

I live my life with strong choices and in control, I accept my path and no longer live in despair or frustration or anger.

It has been a long road, there have been suicidal times, there have been pain free times. 

I was diagnosed with endometriosis at 18.

I was diagnosed with adenomyosis at 34.

I had a hysterectomy at 35, an oophectomy is currently scheduled.

For these diseases modern medicine is baffled. They don't know why it happens and they don't have any way to cure it.  

Only ways of treating the symptoms with science based pharmaceutical drugs and drastic life-changing surgeries. I also investigated complementary therapies and pain management strategies. 

Thus, I am one of the healthiest sufferers of this disease I know, my body is in great condition, my mind is in great condition.  I don’t sabotage the quality of my life because I live with an illness.

This health is because of the choices that I made along the way. Information that I learned. Things that I tried.

It is these tips and strategies which I am going to get out there to guide other sufferers in coping with their condition.

There are over a million women worldwide who are suffering from this disease, in pain, in silence, feeling alone, desperate and that life is not worth living.

All their stories are my story.  But my story could change their outcome, their sanity, their pain.

I am not just writing this book for my fellow endo-sisters. I’m writing it for their loved ones, the ones who have to watch them in pain, feeling helpless, not knowing what to do. My book will tell the sufferer how to communicate with friends and family and how to help them be there to support and care.  This is a vital piece for any endo sufferer.

Support is lacking for many conditions like Endometriosis.  The medical profession can only do so much, but the impact on the emotional and mental state is profound.  A book is a way of giving support to the world wide community affected by endometriosis.

All funds received will go toward the costs of getting the book published. This includes taking time off work to write, a top class editor, publishing costs, audio book costs and PR to promote the book to the endo sufferers I have yet to reach through other means.

Should I not be able to raise the funds to publish the book, I will make the book available in e-format and/or MP3.

If you can’t contribute, please do help me by spreading the word of this campaign.  You can share this page on all your social media as an easy way to support my mission.

You can read a sample of my story on this guest blog. http://bit.ly/1dHKLWL

story:
Our Mission

Hi, my name is Dan & I have the dream of owning a restaurant in a small community.  I have the hope of building strong community ties & promoting healthy lifestyle choices in our children, as well as helping to bring families closer together.

I strive to bring people the best food & service their money can buy.  Part of my dream is giving back to the community as a whole, by revitalizing the local economy.  This can be accomplished through giving free culinary lessons to the community and contributing to the local schools with programs involving local businesses.  In addition to the culinary education, I will also be sponsoring local youth sports to promote a healthy lifestyle.

In recent years it has become a thing of the past in many families for them to sit down to a meal together.  Sadly this has lead to a breakdown of the family unit in America, which could be at the heart of many issues that have become a topic of local & national news & debate.  Such as the increase of obesity in our youth, school shootings, the decline of grade point averages in our schools & several other points of concern.

I also have the dream of offering a community service in the form of providing FREE meals to low-income families so they can enjoy fine, healthy dining thereby increasing the amount of quality time families spend together.  This will give the opportunity to experience and participate in family time that may not be available otherwise.

By helping fund us you will be helping to better a small town in many ways:

  • Stimulating the local economy
  • Bringing food education to the community
  • Supporting FREE cooking lessons at the restaurant
  • Helping us provide FREE meals to low income families
  • Sponsoring Local Youth Sports Team(s)


What is Needed & What You Get

When our goal is reached it will be used toward the purchase of the building & land for the restaurant & gardens.  It will also help fund the Free cooking classes & Food education classes & Community Outreach for the local schools.  In addition it will also help in the sponsoring of the youth sports team(s) as well.

For every donation of $20 or more you will receive a great gift, be it a Free Dinner, Dinner for Two, Dinner for four, Breakfast or even a dish named after you on the menu!**

Even if our goal is not reached we will use all available funds to advance our goals to the maximum potential.


The Impact You Have By Helping

In addition to helping the local schools with meals & support, you will also be helping to fund the classes we will be offering for children & their families on growing their own fresh produce & herbs organically at no cost to them.


You will also be helping to aid us in funding the FREE culinary & nutrition education classes for children & their families to help promote healthy lifestyle choices on a long term basis through having the knowledge of good foods & eating habits.

All of these programs are designed to not only educate & entertain, but to help to strengthen the family bond.

By helping fund us you are not only helping a small town, but helping to bring families closer together!


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate you can still help:

  • By spreading the word about us!
  • Like us on Facebook
  • Share our campaign with the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you're in our area you can volunteer to help with community programs we will be offering!

Thank you for your support!!

**All Gift Perks will be distributed by email gift certificates redeemable at our restaurant

story:
Funding for My Tarot Business

I am Elizabeth Palladino, founder and instructor of New York Intuitive Tarot Classes. I'm known to my friends and students as "Beth." I have been involved in Tarot since I was in college 35 years ago. I only read for myself until 2002 when I started studying Tarot with Wald and Ruth Ann Amberstone of The Tarot School.

I became a professional Tarot card reader in 2003, and followed this as an avocation while working as an indexer and assistant editor at the H. W. Wilson Publishing Company. After almost 30 years at Wilson, I was laid off in 2009. I couldn't find any other work in the field, and began teaching my Tarot classes in June of 2012. I find teaching Tarot so much more rewarding than my former career in reference publishing.

I offer my classes through Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/New-York-Intuitive-Tarot-... (You can see the most of the information without being a member of Meetup or of the group, including past and future classes, and reviews and comments.) The attached pitch video is a 36-minute class on the Twos of the Minor Arcana so that you can have a short example of what one of my online classes might be like. In fact, most of my in-person or online classes are at least two hours in length.

    What I Need and What I'm Offering You

    • At this point, I need money to cover past expenses I incurred while teaching my classes. These expenses included classroom rental, class materials (including handouts), equipment such as computers and printers, and financing for attending professional conferences to network with my Tarot colleagues. The last thing I want to do is to raise my class fees or start charging monthly dues to the members of my Meetup group.

    • I'm offering Tarot readings of varying lengths and free access to some of my classes, including the in-person classes in Manhattan, the online Webinar versions of these same classes, recordings of past online classes, and private Tarot lessons. Once you choose a perk, either a Tarot reading or class, you can schedule a reading at any time that is convenient for you or take any available class. The perks have no time limits, except those that have a year or more duration, and that duration is based on the timing of the first reading or class.

    • I have based my goal on what cash I need to completely pay off past expenses. However, even if I fall short of that goal, any money I receive will go toward paying off these expenses. I would be extremely grateful for any help you can give me.

    Why Tarot Classes Are Important

    In my humble opinion, Tarot is one of the best tools for self examination and for helping you to figure out your own path through the maze of life. I know from my own experience at studying Tarot that you learn a whole lot more than just how to read the cards. You learn about yourself. It becomes a life-affirming vehicle that you can also use to help other people find their way through life. I'm also hoping that my students are discovering these wonders of Tarot; and the feedback that I'm getting is that they are.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please share this campaign with your friends or use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out. I'm slowly but surely developing a reputation as an excellent Tarot instructor and insightful Tarot reader. I just need a little help to keep my business up and running while I penetrate the market further. I would be grateful for any help you can give me and not just money. Thank you for your consideration.

story:
**** The youtube video represents S.A.M.E. Cafe in Denver  (So All May Eat). Chico's 1st donations-only cafe will join S.A.M.E. Cafe and more than 45 others in the U.S. in guaranteeing that "everyone has a place at the table."


Food is a good equalizer ; there's no difference between the haves and have-nots.         Soul  Kitchen -- Patron    


100th Monkey Community Café: Where Everyone Has a Place at the Table

Help Fund an Experiment in Generosity!

A dedicated group of Chico residents is building something new and exciting: 100th Monkey Community Cafe -- a nonprofit, Pay-As-You-Can cafe. By reaching our fund-raising goal of $30,000, we will join 45 other cafes in the U.S. in this farm-to-table, community cafe movement. Our Community Cafe Task Force is working hard to make this happen, and we are asking for your help in the form of a financial donation at any level you can give.

What Is a "Pay-As-You-Can Community Cafe?

The community cafe model is based on a sound and just economic principle:     If everybody gives what they have, everybody gets what they need. Here in Chico, we live in one of the world's largest bread baskets where we are surrounded by an abundance of organic, locally grown food – more than enough to provide “a place at the table” for all, regardless of means. Pioneered at Salt Lake City's One World Cafe in 2003 and followed by S.A.M.E. Cafe (So-All-May-Eat) in Denver in 2006, pay-as-you-can cafes now number 45 + in the U.S. These include F.A.R.M. Cafe (For-All-Regardless-Of-Means) in North Carolina, Bon Jovi's Soul Kitchen in New Jersey, and more than a dozen Panera Cares Cafes (Panera Bread Co.) nationwide.

Key objectives of the donations-only community cafe are 1) to reduce food insecurity and food waste 2) to create a cohesive, giving community where all have access to organic, locally grown food, regardless of means and 3) to foster a sustainable, “farm-to-table” connection in our local communities.

How Does It Work?

According to the inspired testimony of existing cafes, it works beautifully! There are no set menus as talented chefs use what is in season locally to prepare nutritious meals, and there is no set price for menu items. Instead, customers choose one of the following options:

  1. Pay what you would typically pay for a comparable meal (“suggested donation”)

  2. Pay more than the suggested donation.

  3. Pay less than the suggested donation.

  4. Pay by giving an hour time in cafe service.

Customers who work-in-exchange for nutritious, (mostly) organic meals, receive invaluable work-training experience to support greater access to employment in the food service industry and more. For many, being able to give to the cafe workplace their talent and time helps restore personal dignity and deepens their connection to the whole community.

100th Monkey Community Cafe Needs Your Help –Today!

To reach our goal of raising $30,000, the Community Cafe Task Force needs your donation of any amount. We have witnessed our community's generous giving to such treasures as The Bookstore on Main St. in order to keep it open and to Pageant Theater to help it “go digital.” We know every dollar given will secure the foundation of Chico's first community cafe – an enterprise that will give back ten-fold.

We believe Chico is well-primed to join the community cafe movement. Our task force is working diligently to make it happen. We hope you will contribute what you can to help us serve our first wholesome meals at our new 100th Monkey Community Cafe in August!

story:
Easter Seals Playground

After years in an inadequate building, Easter Seals acquired and renovated a new building. The state of the art center is bright, inviting and most importantly, accessible to the children we serve. However, the need to have an appropriate playground is critical. The importance of play goes well beyond the development of social skills. It has incredible impact on the therapeutic needs of the children we serve. This playground will help develop gross and fine motor skills and provide important vestibular input.

Help Make Play Accessible

It is easy to take play for granted. But for children with physical disabilities, access to things such as swings and slides can be challenging at best. Yet, the benefits of such play are tremendous. In addition to being one of the great joys of childhood, play for children with disabilities can have incredible therapeutic impact.

"Children learn as they play. Most importantly, in play, children learn how to learn." O. Fred Donaldson.

Play provides:

  • An opportunity for children to explore their environment
  • Increased activity
  • Increased movement
  • Fresh air
  • New opportunities for learning

Funding Is Critical For This Playground

As a mission based organization, Easter Seals works to ensure high-quality programs to the community we serve. State funding and budget have created economic challenges. Through the support of our community, we are able to overcome many of these challenges. Your support of this playground will have impact that will last a lifetime for the children who play on it. With the support of a challenge grant, each dollar we raise will be matched! Therefore, your support will have double the impact!

Looking To Help In Another Way?

This playground is truly a work of the community. In addition to charitable contributions, we need help putting it all together. On August 23rd, we need 200 volunteers to make this playground a reality. If you would like to be a part of that, please sign up at: http://www.volunteermatch.org/search/opp1740800...

story:
Short Summary

I am Bertrand Kima, a formally trained Bioinformatician with a series of IT training such as Web Development, BA/QA, Oracle, IT for Business, and Web Analysis. I have played the role of an entrepreneur since 2010 when I founded Kimberts Solutions – a Baltimore based technology firm. I am one of the co-founders of Njorku – a web based career and recruitment platform for Africa.

I have been in the IT industry for over 5 years with focus on Front End development. I am very proficient with HTML(5), CSS3, mySQL, JavaScript, jQuery, Adobe Creative Suites, Microsoft Office, just to name a few. I have some understanding of PHP and Python - and willing to learn more. I have worked in several capacities within the industry to include Consulting, Business Analysis, Front End development, and customer support.

The NJL platform is a very complex one that combines various functionality from the largest Job boards and recruitment platforms from across the web - yet, easy to use. Due to its complexity, this project requires intensive labor, time and resources. It was on that note that my team decided to setup this campaign to enable us get support from individuals who are passionate about technology and its role in cutting down cost in the HR industry. 

You will notice that the NJL website is available for the public - please feel free to try it. We came up with an initial rough design for the desktop version to give contributors and potential investors an idea of what NJL has in store for them. A mobile version will follow. Funding for NJL till date came from our individual paychecks. Funds raised from this campaign will enable us expand our team with more creative gurus who will assist in modernizing NJL's UI/UX as well as take NJL to its next level. It will be an honor for NJL to be the factor that will bring down an organization's operational cost so they can focus on growth and expansion - just because of your contribution.

What We Need & What You get

Our team seeks to raise about $60,000 (USD) to cover the development of NJL's next series of modules, servers, marketing and logistics. We intend to contract some gurus to assist in upgrading the design and develop more modules. In order to enhance our users' experience, we intend to migrate into better and faster servers. In addition to the above, creating awareness by means of engaging in some paid ads - both online and offline as well as performing SEO are part of our initial marketing strategy. 

While we do not have a lot to offer you for your contribution, we will do our best to provide you with long lasting memories, which we will also keep for ourselves so we can always remember you. We intend to provide each contributors with at least one NJL-branded material as our way of saying "Thank You". Branded materials will carry the NJL logo and will include but not limited to stationery items, Office supplies, Shirts/T-shirts, and bags . We also plan to offer 100% free services and several long term discounts to contributors. Please see the Perks Section for details.

We know our Perks are not very unique to you. However, they are unique to us. We will forever remember anyone who goes out of their way to support us in this journey which we are just about to start.

Should we by any means not reach that target, we will economize whatever we get and prioritize to the best of our abilities to develop the most essential features that will be beneficial to our users. Of course this might slow down progress because we will have to work part time on NJL so we can maintain our current jobs in order to raise additional funds to operate. Given that we believe in this project as one that we have been called to do, we know that failure is not an option. Nothing can stop us.

    The Impact

    NJL is not just a job board like the many others out there. It is a full HR Management system that carries a job board and a career & recruitment services application as a plus. Moreover, the embedded job board / career & recruitment services application will be a combination of most of the popular competitors across the web. This makes NJL a one stop solution for every organization's full HR needs. Despite all the above, the cost of using NJL is currently set to be less than the average cost of all its competitors. Our main goal is to help organizations save time and money so that they can focus on growth. When they grow, they expand and find the need to hire more talents and therefore reduce the unemployment rate - We all can one day get a job.

    The NJL idea originated from the success of Njorku, as Temi (NJL's founder), out of her admiration for Njorku, wanted to get a little more creative by coming up with a solution that has no geographical limitation. She then brought the ideas up to Bertrand (one of Njorku's co-founders)  for further analysis and execution.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Although we would love to see everyone contribute even a dollar to help us achieve this dream, please feel no pressure. People are "broke" including us and that explains the reason for this campaign - requesting your support. So we understand if you cannot afford to donate. Well, there are other ways to support us. Just share the link and help spread the word to your friends and relatives so they can be on the lookout for their next job search platform - thank you.

story:
El Refugio Mezcal

For centuries, crafting and consuming mezcal has been a sacred custom for the indigenous peoples of Mexico. Used for births, baptisms, weddings, funerals, and a fuel to get through a hard day of work, mezcal is more a way of life than a spirit. It ties the people into a community and the community to the land. Creating the finest mezcal is both an art and a science that is passed down through generations, imbued with spirituality and a deep respect for ancestral belief and tradition.

Today, those deep-rooted connections to land and community feel particularly remote. As we persevere through the present uncertainty and isolation, we hope that this magical spirit will help you feel a bit more connected to humanity and the world we share.

 

Our story

In Baja California Sur, just as you enter the town of Todos Santos, lies a humble, family-run restaurant serving some of the best mezcals in the world: El Refugio Mezcaleria. 

Husband and wife duo Rachel and Noel opened El Refugio in 2016 to share the incredible mezcals they had discovered in villages across Mexico with their friends and family. Noel and Rachel regularly travel to remote regions in Guerrero, Puebla, Michoacan, and Oaxaca, seeking out extraordinary mezcaleros who craft artisanal mezcals in the traditions of their ancestors. They bring back the most complex, surprising agave spirits, typically produced in batches under 200 liters, that would otherwise never be available outside of the community.

The result is an exceptionally distinct and extraordinary spirit that makes you reconsider everything you thought was true about mezcal.

For years, Americans and travelers from around the world have been asking how to get El Refugio mezcal at home. So far, the answer has been “make room in your suitcase, we’ll sell you what we can!” 

In March, as a result of the global health crisis, El Refugio had to close its doors. Their hope is to reopen in a new, more spacious location in November to continue sharing their passion for these rare mezcals and the culture that brings them into being. To achieve that, they’re bottling up the last—and best—of their stock.

As fans of El Refugio, we’re teaming up with Rachel and Noel to bring these mezcals to the States for the first time. In sharing this exceptional spirit with the people who want it most, we hope to save El Refugio, and also bring a bit of magic to the world in a time of fear and chaos. 

 

Mezcal the way it was meant to be created

For centuries, mezcal has been made by indigenous Mexican communities for festivals, ceremonies, and celebrations; its cultural and spiritual significance is palpable. It’s a spirit that is best when made in small batches where every batch is unique. There are dozens of species of agave, and where and how the agave grows, as well as particular techniques of the mezcaleros, their beliefs, and even their community traditions, influence the flavor. 

As mezcal has grown in popularity in the US, large brands have begun to mass produce it -- but when made through an industrial process, the spirit loses its flavor, complexity, and the fundamental ties to the communities that produce it. Above all, it loses that element of the mystic that sets mezcal apart from all other spirits.

El Refugio mezcals are an exploration of story and connectivity, rather than an analysis of flavor. They rely on the intuition of Noel and his brother, Ismael, who come from a long line of mezcaleros in Guerrero. They do not cater their selection to the foreign palette -- an exceptional mezcal does not need to be tamed or toned down. El Refugio celebrates the cultures and customs of these master mezcaleros, honoring the art and science they have perfected through generations of producing mezcal. 

This is mezcal the way it was meant to be created. In sharing it with you, we hope to ignite your sense of wonder and adventure. 

 

The origin of El Refugio Mezcalería

To understand the magic of El Refugio, you have to understand the people behind it.

Rachel, a world traveler with an entrepreneurial spirit, and Noel, an Aztec dancer, cook, and self–taught cosmologist from Guerrero, first met in an Aztec sweat lodge in Zihuatanejo in 2012. Seven months later, they landed in Todos Santos and reconnected with Noel's heritage: mezcal. 

Two years passed of sharing artisanal mezcals and Noel's home-cooked meals with friends and visitors, until the fare became too good, the groups too large, and Rachel's patience for cleaning the tiny kitchen stretched too thin. Hence was born the idea of El Refugio. They opened their doors not knowing what would happen, only aiming to recreate the very atmosphere that had evolved around their home dining room table. 

El Refugio quickly transformed into one of the most respected mezcalerias and native Mexican restaurants in the region, thanks to their talent for sourcing incredible mezcals and Noel's wizard–like ability to capture and recreate the flavors of Guerrero, Oaxaca, and Puebla.

Their mission from day one has been to create a community gathering point to share the richness of indigenous Mexican cuisine and culture. We're honored to help advance that mission by sharing these mezcals far beyond the walls of the mezcaleria for the first time, and we hope you treasure getting to know them as much as we have.
story_txt: El Refugio MezcalFor centuries, crafting and consuming mezcal has been a sacred custom for the indigenous peoples of Mexico. Used for births, baptisms, weddings, funerals, and a fuel to get through a hard day of work, mezcal is more a way of life than a spirit. It ties the people into a community and the community to the land. Creating the finest mezcal is both an art and a science that is passed down through generations, imbued with spirituality and a deep respect for ancestral belief and tradition.Today, those deep-rooted connections to land and community feel particularly remote. As we persevere through the present uncertainty and isolation, we hope that this magical spirit will help you feel a bit more connected to humanity and the world we share. Our storyIn Baja California Sur, just as you enter the town of Todos Santos, lies a humble, family-run restaurant serving some of the best mezcals in the world: El Refugio Mezcaleria. Husband and wife duo Rachel and Noel opened El Refugio in 2016 to share the incredible mezcals they had discovered in villages across Mexico with their friends and family. Noel and Rachel regularly travel to remote regions in Guerrero, Puebla, Michoacan, and Oaxaca, seeking out extraordinary mezcaleros who craft artisanal mezcals in the traditions of their ancestors. They bring back the most complex, surprising agave spirits, typically produced in batches under 200 liters, that would otherwise never be available outside of the community.The result is an exceptionally distinct and extraordinary spirit that makes you reconsider everything you thought was true about mezcal.For years, Americans and travelers from around the world have been asking how to get El Refugio mezcal at home. So far, the answer has been “make room in your suitcase, we’ll sell you what we can!” In March, as a result of the global health crisis, El Refugio had to close its doors. Their hope is to reopen in a new, more spacious location in November to continue sharing their passion for these rare mezcals and the culture that brings them into being. To achieve that, they’re bottling up the last—and best—of their stock.As fans of El Refugio, we’re teaming up with Rachel and Noel to bring these mezcals to the States for the first time. In sharing this exceptional spirit with the people who want it most, we hope to save El Refugio, and also bring a bit of magic to the world in a time of fear and chaos.  Mezcal the way it was meant to be createdFor centuries, mezcal has been made by indigenous Mexican communities for festivals, ceremonies, and celebrations; its cultural and spiritual significance is palpable. It’s a spirit that is best when made in small batches where every batch is unique. There are dozens of species of agave, and where and how the agave grows, as well as particular techniques of the mezcaleros, their beliefs, and even their community traditions, influence the flavor. As mezcal has grown in popularity in the US, large brands have begun to mass produce it -- but when made through an industrial process, the spirit loses its flavor, complexity, and the fundamental ties to the communities that produce it. Above all, it loses that element of the mystic that sets mezcal apart from all other spirits.El Refugio mezcals are an exploration of story and connectivity, rather than an analysis of flavor. They rely on the intuition of Noel and his brother, Ismael, who come from a long line of mezcaleros in Guerrero. They do not cater their selection to the foreign palette -- an exceptional mezcal does not need to be tamed or toned down. El Refugio celebrates the cultures and customs of these master mezcaleros, honoring the art and science they have perfected through generations of producing mezcal. This is mezcal the way it was meant to be created. In sharing it with you, we hope to ignite your sense of wonder and adventure.  The origin of El Refugio MezcaleríaTo understand the magic of El Refugio, you have to understand the people behind it.Rachel, a world traveler with an entrepreneurial spirit, and Noel, an Aztec dancer, cook, and self–taught cosmologist from Guerrero, first met in an Aztec sweat lodge in Zihuatanejo in 2012. Seven months later, they landed in Todos Santos and reconnected with Noel's heritage: mezcal. Two years passed of sharing artisanal mezcals and Noel's home-cooked meals with friends and visitors, until the fare became too good, the groups too large, and Rachel's patience for cleaning the tiny kitchen stretched too thin. Hence was born the idea of El Refugio. They opened their doors not knowing what would happen, only aiming to recreate the very atmosphere that had evolved around their home dining room table. El Refugio quickly transformed into one of the most respected mezcalerias and native Mexican restaurants in the region, thanks to their talent for sourcing incredible mezcals and Noel's wizard–like ability to capture and recreate the flavors of Guerrero, Oaxaca, and Puebla.Their mission from day one has been to create a community gathering point to share the richness of indigenous Mexican cuisine and culture. We're honored to help advance that mission by sharing these mezcals far beyond the walls of the mezcaleria for the first time, and we hope you treasure getting to know them as much as we have.

story:
Short Summary

Since the height of 2009's Great Recession, I (Gregory Turner II), and countless others have struggled to find their voice, purpose and meaning to life. I got fired from a job, refused to take out another school loan for a meaningless degree; I was bogged down by what societies idea of success was for me. With my back against the wall and what felt like defeat, I asked myself where and how do I find happiness? Ah, small business ownership, fashion and retail. After a year of pop up shops and an e-commerce website, I had to find the next best thing. Witness: FRiNGE boutique, the idea of creating a unique shopping experience, through an authentic and approachable perspective.

This campaign embodies the idea that with passion, hard work and determination, one can fully chase their dreams as long as it is from the heart and will impact a community bigger than themselves. FRiNGE has done just that, it has and will continue to provide a medium for the likes of inspiring small businesses. Periodisa, a Columbus based publisher, will facilitate writing workshops, host book readings and sell their books in store. Artists will connect to the Short North Arts district through our designated Gallery space. Artisans and furniture makers will have an approachable and comfortable home to try entrepreneurial ventures by selling their products. Lastly and most important, we want to be an anchor and advocate for the Northern end of the Short North. The blocks between 4th and 5th avenues have struggled to become stable, with FRiNGE Boutique we will get a retail anchor and advocate that is dedicated to uplifting our community.  

With your help we can make FRiNGE even better and complete a few more projects for our new space at 1177 N High. Contributors will help us achieve; signage for the exterior, new electrical for the interior, a fresh coat of paint, outfitting a new dressing room, and purchasing reclaimed fixtures for the retail space itself.  I can't wait until you're able to wear a FRiNGE shirt and proudly tell people where they can buy it, or experience the retail experience Periodisa has for you in our book section, and to kick your feet up on furniture upcycled by local craftsman. Although this campaign is important to me, these projects are very beneficial to the community. We want you to enjoy the impact it will have on this last stretch connecting the Short North to The Ohio State University and Weinland Park. Indiegogo provides the perfect platform for FRiNGE to get an independent start, considering so many other crowdsourcing mediums were not a good fit.

What We Need & What You Get

FRiNGE needs your help converting our pop-up shop to a full boutique:

We are asking for $5550 to make some in store improvements, outdoor improvements, and the purchase of fixtures, and inventory from local craftsman and artisans. You’re investing in the hyper-local community and neighborhood by helping us purchase product and services from these benefactors: Origo Branding Co., Opal Stackhouse, Matt Reese Photography, Allison Meade’s Old Soul Studio, HotCards Columbus, Traxler Tees, Thought Co, 400 West Rich st, family owned Ace Hardware in Olde North Columbus, Periodisa Publishing, Adam W Jax, Make Believe Monsters, Rich and Sami Co., Extinct Clothing Co., Free Clothing Co., and The Columbus Idea Foundry.

 Here are the perks and rewards! (Please include address and size instructions)

  • $5 FRiNGE logo sticker: This FRiNGE logo sticker will stick with you in the stickiest of situations. 
  • $25 FRiNGE Zebra Icon Tee: The FRiNGE Zebra Icon remains nameless and has never been printed on a T-Shirt. Be the first to wear it amongst the 50 people who contribute at this level. This FRiNGE reward also includes the FRiNGE logo sticker and 1' button.
    • $50 FRiNGE Party and Swag Bag: Enjoy meeting some of the people that help got FRiNGE thus far. At entry, you'll be greeted with the awards above in a swag bag. You'll meet the owner, branding team, community  and we'll enjoy great live music from one of Columbus' best upcoming DJ's. There are only 50 of these. So catch the swag while it lasts. This FRiNGE reward also includes all the perks listed above. Bag includes: FRiNGE Premiere Poster, Tee, 1"button, sticker and surrounding business gift cards. The FRiNGE Premiere Poster: 1 color screen print on 100# French Paper 18" x 24''. Edition of 75, hand numbered and signed by the owner. Created by Richie Raygun
  • $105 FRiNGE soft launch and access pass: The weeks leading up to the FRiNGE Grand Open, you will be amongst a small group of invitees for a sneak peek look at our store concept. This FRiNGE reward also includes all the perks listed above.
  • $500 FRiNGE Wall of LiFE: Become a permanent fixture in our store with your name permanently etched into our Wall of LiFE. You'll enjoy witnessing your name being placed when you come to one of the invite only soft launch parties. This FRiNGE reward also includes all the perks listed above.
  • $850 FRiNGE Chicago Weekend Getaway: A $400 a night value, this Lake-house has 3 bedrooms, 4 bathrooms. It sleeps 10 people. Fully loaded with a Double sided fireplace in Living room and front screen porch. Enjoy beautiful views of Lake Kai. Relax in the master bedroom's jacuzzi tub. Loft area has 2 sleeper sofa's and a full bath is a great space for kids. This home has 1 Queen, 2 Fulls and 2 Futons. You can cash in this reward as soon as our campaign ends. This FRiNGE reward also includes all the perks listed above. 

The Impact

  • Our space at 1177 N. High St is on the fringes of three unique and growing neighborhoods in Columbus; The Short North Arts District, The University District, and Weinland Park. Our space is 1300 sq. ft. 1100 sq. ft. of that is dedicated to the shopping experience. Twenty percent (20%) of our store is based on our t-shirt business that is sourced from local screen printers and graphic designers. An additional thirty percent (30%) of our space is dedicated to give apprentice artisans, furniture makers a chance to give the entrepreneurial desire a shot. They will have their own dedicated retail space in which they’ll be promoted and guided with help from organizations like The Economic Community Development Institute. Fifteen percent (15%) additional space is dedicated to Periodisa Publishing and Filigree literary magazine. They will host writer’s workshops on Mondays and their books and literature will be for sale in a unique retail experience. The remaining thirty five percent (35%) will be dedicated to outside wholesale accounts that FRiNGE has sourced nationally and internationally. We believe that with your impact and investment this model will lay a great foundation, together we will reinvigorate the Garden Theatre District.
  • Help grow the Short North’s Garden Theatre District as we anchor the area with our unique retail experience that is authentically inspired. We’ll join neighbors such as Rivet, What The Rock, Short North Stage, Travonna, Stonewall Columbus, Royal Factory, Brothers Drake Meadery, and Middle West Spirits.
  • Our record 8 months of sustainable growth and the success of pop up shops and community festivals just scratched the surface of our potential. The pop up shop model really helped draw foot traffic to the troubled area, and brightened up the neighborhood with minor improvements made to the space. With your contribution we can continue to grow with the area around us as a permanent fixture in the neighborhood.

 Other Ways You Can Help

Some may not contribute, but here’s how you can help:

  • Get the word out and help us raise awareness: share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and other social media outlets. Volunteer and or pass out information about this campaign. Talk about this endeavor while at the bar or even with your family and friends.
  • Use our Indiegogo share tools.

 Help us get to Live life on the other side of FRiNGE!

 Thank you.

Gregory A Turner II,

Owner

FRiNGE

story:
Since 2007, Wellness City Challenge, an action-oriented organization, has been aligning local resources, laying solid ground work and gaining recognition in support of its efforts to improve health with nutrition education.

Our mission is to mobilize community resources, to empower citizens, to improve health through nutrition, education and physical activity. Through daily classroom education, a model program is being developed that will be expanded from community to community.

This model program is unique from other models in that it is wholistic in approach. It utilizes a garden to kitchen approach with a focus on the STEM education methodology. It also engages the family, community including business and industry experts to ensure a "real life" approach to education is implemented. It is a "movement" to change the food, change the future by transforming communities.

Sustainable Hospitality Pathway

A main facet of our program is the Sustainable Hospitality Pathway.

Sustainable Hospitality is a hands on academic program at Mt. Diablo High School (MDHS) with a focus on health and sustainability in the hospitality and tourism industry.  The pathway falls under the International Hospitality and Tourism Academy (IHTA).

Pathway Mission

The Sustainable Hospitality Pathway, a rigorous, relevant and innovative career-technical-education program, will prepare MDHS students in the growing fields of:

• healthy food service

• agri-tourism

• eco-tourism

• outdoor recreation

• greening traditional tourism

The Pathway connects students to opportunities with local businesses, public agencies, non-profit organizations and higher educational institutions to meet the health, economic and ecological challenges of the 21st century!

What do they teach?

From garden to plate, they are teaching students the fundamentals of creating healthy meals from scratch and what a real meal looks like.  Every school day, the students are in the professional kitchen classroom cooking, in the garden, or in the environmental education classroom, learning about and experiencing REAL FOOD. They are gaining skills that are essential to good health for themselves and for their community.

Goals for the Program

The goal is to change the palates and minds of the students, teaching them to cook and garden, as well as learning how food impacts health.  They are giving them the skills necessary to change the food for our community. The students call themselves “Wellness Warriors”.

In an effort to positively influence school lunches, the goal is to utilize the students and classroom as a test lab for new meal ideas for the school cafeteria as they shift their menus to reflect the new USDA guidelines.

In addition to their in-school program, their goal is to use their new kitchen after-hours for community cooking classes to reach the parents, staff and larger community of Concord, CA to expand their impact.

story:
I Want To Make The Impossible, Possible!


My name is Bernhard Rumstadt, I'm a surgeon from Germany and my dream is to build a surgical clinic in Burkina Faso, one of the poorest countries in the world. A clinic for those, who would normally be unable to afford treatment.

Why I'm doing this? With the longstanding wish to assist in the provision of developmental aid, I originally approached large NGO's and began to inquire about how I could be of use during my vacation time. However, I soon discovered that there is no way to provide active support for short periods of time, within large organisations.
It was then, that the idea to form a new independent aid organisation came into being. Over the past 12 years I have visited Burkina Faso on numerous occassions to perform operations and work together with the local doctors.  These visits allowed operations, that under normal circumstances would be too complex, to be performed.

Through doing this free of charge, we are able to not only help the patients, but also provide the African doctors with valuable training and experience. Besides that we were able to build up a farm that provides bread and work for around 500 women, as well support to a neighbouring school of 450 children. In addiiton to this, more than 100 orphaned children are supported by our sponsorship program.

Our vital work and various experiences, have provided the entire team with the confidence and the know how, to successfully embark upon our biggest project to date, the building of a local clinic. Our unique working concept, that allows surgeons to come and operate for short periods of time, guarantees us a lively clinic. One that can provide vital help to the regions highly deserving population.

In January 2013 we laid the foundation stone for the clinic.

What We Need

Since the idea for the clinic arose in my head, I have spoken to more than 500 donors - major companies, foundations, institutions and wealthy people. Thanks to their generosity we were able to raise more than 350,000 US dollars. At the time, we believed this would be enough. However, as we started to build the foundations we encountered a major setback. A massive rainfall highlighted the fact, contrary to our soil evaluations, that during rainy periods the ground would turn to marsh. This meant that the whole clinic needed to be placed 1.6 ft higher on top of a platform and the foundations dug deeper. The extra costs incurred were not anticipated.


Meanwhile all the walls and ceilings are in place and electricity is being installed. But still we need an extra 50,000 US Dollars in order to finalise this huge project. We are confident that we are able to secure half of the amount from our supporters, but that still leaves a further 25,000 $. That is were you can help and become a part of our project. I personally guarantee that - thanks to the fact that we have no administrative fees at all - your help will go directly into the project.

The Impact

Burkina Faso
Burkina Faso is a country situated on the border of Mali, Nigeria, Benin, Togo and Ghana, in West Africa. The former French colony, previously known as 'Upper Volta', gained its independence under this name on the 5th of August 1960. It was President Thomas Sankara who changed the name to Burkina Faso, which means 'land of the honourable' or 'honest land', on the 4th of August 1984.

Burkina Faso is one of the poorest countries in the world. Today, despite the large range of cultural diversity and a lack of stability, the various ethnic groups live together peacefully. Regular and reoccurring drought periods are of great concern for the majority of the population, who work as farmers.

The current healthcare system in Burkina Faso means that the patient must pay all of their own medical costs, except when giving birth and vaccinating a child. The doctor to patient ratio is severely out of balance, and it is made even worse when factoring in the level of qualified doctors. There are thousands of people in desperate need of surgery, who simply cannot afford it. We can provide them with operations, free of charge.

Clinic concept
The clinic will consist of 10 beds, where it will be possible to perform surgical, urological and gynaecological operations. The clinic is to be managed by Dr. Sedogo, who thanks to a scholarship provided by our foundation, trained for three years as a surgeon in Togo, as well as spending a year in Germany. The clinic will be staffed by skilled personnel who have trained, and worked together with the foundation, to provide medical aid for over 10 years. Through uniting the African culture with European medical standards, we are providing a high level of service, that is completely unique in Burkina Faso.
The clinic has been built on a piece of land, given to us by the local population, in Leo. Leo is the town within which we have been successfully providing medical aid since 2001. Leo is situated on the best connected road between Ghana and the capital city of Burkina Faso, Ouagadougou, which is approximately two hours drive away. The clinic itself will be built directly on this road, therefore making it highly accessible. This is of particular importance during the rainy season.


Economic concept
Due to the state of the Burkinian healthcare system, a clinic must be financially independent. One of the key concerns for us, is providing treatment for the patients who need it, irregardless of whether they can pay for it. There are people in Burkina Faso, in the middle or upper classes, who have no problems when it comes to paying for medical treatment. These classes tend to live in or around the capital city and can therefore easily reach the clinic. Through the provision of a high medical standard, the clinic is an attractive prospect to this group of possible patients. This means that the treatment of wealthier inhabitants can easily finance the running of the clinic, allowing the clinic to care for those who cannot afford it, free of charge.

Political Concept
The construction of a clinic is supported whole heartedly by local politicians. This is clear from, amongst other things, the gift of the land itself on which the clinic will be built. The building of the clinic has been arranged with the Health Minister himself. Surgeons for Africa is not only a certified foundation in Germany, but also in Burkina Faso. This means that we have permission to build clinics and initiate medical aid projects, throughout the entire country.

Architectual concept
Through a special technique, discovered by our architect Francis Kere, clay bricks are combined with concrete. These bricks are sourced from local suppliers and produced using traditional building methods, which comply with modern day structural requirements. Additional materials such as laterrite will also be used, as they fit naturally within the colours of the African landscape.
Climate control is achieved through the construction of high ceilings and in particular, the unusual and exceptional roof construction. A normal roof construction blocks rising heat. Through our ingenious and innovative roof technique, the roof is constructed in a V form. This allows for the heat to be drained using a ventilation system constructed within the walls and roof. By constructing the building in such a way, it also allows for the natural wind flow to aid air extraction.
This further optimises climate control within the building and functions in temperatures of up to 50 degrees. Thus creating a pleasant and comfortable environment for patients to recuperate in. During the rainy season the roof serves as an aid in collecting rainwater which is then stored in a cistern.  Thus solving one of the main, and well known, problems in the Sahel region in an effective way.

Environmental concept
The building of the clinic should not only serve as an example of successful medical developmental aid, but also provide a workable environmental role model. The intensive use of solar energy is planned and this will fulfil a large proportion of the predicted energy expenditure. It is thanks to the donation of solar panels by the firm SolarWorld, that this is made possible. In addition to this, a biological water purifier will be installed, one of the first ever in Burkina Faso. Water needs will be met through the collection of rain water, which can then be heated using solar power. The construction of an ecological waste disposal plant is also planned.

The Architect

After our decision to build a surgical clinic in Burkina Faso, and with high hopes that we would be able to finance and complete such a project, the search began for a suitable architect.
It was whilst working with the late popular film and theatre director Christoph Schlingensief, who is well known thanks to his work on the African Opera House Project in Burkina Faso, that I came to meet Francis Kéré. Francis Kéré was born in Burkina Faso and left his childhood home at an early age in order to attend school. He then went on to receive a scholarship that enabled him to study Architecture in Germany.

Currently, Francis Kéré owns an architecture firm in Berlin through which he plans and works on a range of worldwide international projects. He has also been nominated for and received numerous architectural prizes.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the money you can still support us.

As marketing expert
Want to spend one year in Africa? Or even just six months? Do you speak French? Maybe you even have a sponsor who could support you in setting up the clinic together with us? Currently we are looking for a marketing expert to promote the new clinic, mainly to wealthier inhabitants of Burkina Faso who tend to live near the capital city. Through the provision of a high medical standard we are sure that the clinic will be attractive to this group of possible patients. Through their treatment we will be able to operate on the poorer people for free.

As a doctor
Alongside our continual medical support of the local population, the clinic will act as a platform and base for various international surgical support initiatives. In general, larger organisations require doctors to make themselves available for extended periods
of time. It is not always possible for doctors to take long periods of time out from their working lives, in order to provide help and support in Africa. However, thanks to the unique infrastructure of our clinic, it is ideal if not better to organise short trips of 1 – 2 weeks. Groups of doctors from various hospitals are able to fly out to Burkina Faso, where they are collected from the airport and taken to stay in guest houses. It is then possible for the doctors to work alongside local doctors and perform specialised urological, gynaecological, paediatric and plastic surgeries. All of which are performed for free. In the meanwhile, African doctors are provided with experience and
intensive training as well as an understanding of good after care. The costs of flights and medical supplies have to be covered by the participating doctors or by a sponsor they acquire for themselves.

If you are interested in helping please get in touch with us.
story_txt:
I Want To Make The Impossible, Possible!
My name is Bernhard Rumstadt, I'm a surgeon from Germany and my dream is to build a surgical clinic in Burkina Faso, one of the poorest countries in the world. A clinic for those, who would normally be unable to afford treatment.Why I'm doing this? With the longstanding wish to assist in the provision of developmental aid, I originally approached large NGO's and began to inquire about how I could be of use during my vacation time. However, I soon discovered that there is no way to provide active support for short periods of time, within large organisations.It was then, that the idea to form a new independent aid organisation came into being. Over the past 12 years I have visited Burkina Faso on numerous occassions to perform operations and work together with the local doctors.  These visits allowed operations, that under normal circumstances would be too complex, to be performed.Through doing this free of charge, we are able to not only help the patients, but also provide the African doctors with valuable training and experience. Besides that we were able to build up a farm that provides bread and work for around 500 women, as well support to a neighbouring school of 450 children. In addiiton to this, more than 100 orphaned children are supported by our sponsorship program.Our vital work and various experiences, have provided the entire team with the confidence and the know how, to successfully embark upon our biggest project to date, the building of a local clinic. Our unique working concept, that allows surgeons to come and operate for short periods of time, guarantees us a lively clinic. One that can provide vital help to the regions highly deserving population.In January 2013 we laid the foundation stone for the clinic.What We Need
Since the idea for the clinic arose in my head, I have spoken to more than 500 donors - major companies, foundations, institutions and wealthy people. Thanks to their generosity we were able to raise more than 350,000 US dollars. At the time, we believed this would be enough. However, as we started to build the foundations we encountered a major setback. A massive rainfall highlighted the fact, contrary to our soil evaluations, that during rainy periods the ground would turn to marsh. This meant that the whole clinic needed to be placed 1.6 ft higher on top of a platform and the foundations dug deeper. The extra costs incurred were not anticipated.Meanwhile all the walls and ceilings are in place and electricity is being
 installed. But still we need an extra 50,000 US Dollars in order to finalise 
this huge project. We are confident that we are able to secure half of the amount from our supporters, but that still leaves a further 25,000 $. That
 is were you can help and become a part of our project. I personally guarantee that - thanks to the fact that we have no administrative fees at all - your help will go directly into the project.The ImpactBurkina FasoBurkina Faso is a country situated on the border of Mali, Nigeria, Benin, Togo and Ghana, in West Africa. The former French colony, previously known as 'Upper Volta', gained its independence under this name on the 5th of August 1960. It was President Thomas Sankara who changed the name to Burkina Faso, which means 'land of the honourable' or 'honest land', on the 4th of August 1984.Burkina Faso is one of the poorest countries in the world. Today, despite the large range of cultural diversity and a lack of stability, the various ethnic groups live together peacefully. Regular and reoccurring drought periods are of great concern for the majority of the population, who work as farmers. The current healthcare system in Burkina Faso means that the patient must pay all of their own medical costs, except when giving birth and vaccinating a child. The doctor to patient ratio is severely out of balance, and it is made even worse when factoring in the level of qualified doctors. There are thousands of people in desperate need of surgery, who simply cannot afford it. We can provide them with operations, free of charge.Clinic conceptThe clinic will consist of 10 beds, where it will be possible to perform surgical, urological and gynaecological operations. The clinic is to be managed by Dr. Sedogo, who thanks to a scholarship provided by our foundation, trained for three years as a surgeon in Togo, as well as spending a year in Germany. The clinic will be staffed by skilled personnel who have trained, and worked together with the foundation, to provide medical aid for over 10 years. Through uniting the African culture with European medical standards, we are providing a high level of service, that is completely unique in Burkina Faso. The clinic has been built on a piece of land, given to us by the local population, in Leo. Leo is the town within which we have been successfully providing medical aid since 2001. Leo is situated on the best connected road between Ghana and the capital city of Burkina Faso, Ouagadougou, which is approximately two hours drive away. The clinic itself will be built directly on this road, therefore making it highly accessible. This is of particular importance during the rainy season.Economic conceptDue to the state of the Burkinian healthcare system, a clinic must be financially independent. One of the key concerns for us, is providing treatment for the patients who need it, irregardless of whether they can pay for it. There are people in Burkina Faso, in the middle or upper classes, who have no problems when it comes to paying for medical treatment. These classes tend to live in or around the capital city and can therefore easily reach the clinic. Through the provision of a high medical standard, the clinic is an attractive prospect to this group of possible patients. This means that the treatment of wealthier inhabitants can easily finance the running of the clinic, allowing the clinic to care for those who cannot afford it, free of charge.Political ConceptThe construction of a clinic is supported whole heartedly by local politicians. This is clear from, amongst other things, the gift of the land itself on which the clinic will be built. The building of the clinic has been arranged with the Health Minister himself. Surgeons for Africa is not only a certified foundation in Germany, but also in Burkina Faso. This means that we have permission to build clinics and initiate medical aid projects, throughout the entire country.Architectual conceptThrough a special technique, discovered by our architect Francis Kere, clay bricks are combined with concrete. These bricks are sourced from local suppliers and produced using traditional building methods, which comply with modern day structural requirements. Additional materials such as laterrite will also be used, as they fit naturally within the colours of the African landscape.Climate control is achieved through the construction of high ceilings and in particular, the unusual and exceptional roof construction. A normal roof construction blocks rising heat. Through our ingenious and innovative roof technique, the roof is constructed in a V form. This allows for the heat to be drained using a ventilation system constructed within the walls and roof. By constructing the building in such a way, it also allows for the natural wind flow to aid air extraction.This further optimises climate control within the building and functions in temperatures of up to 50 degrees. Thus creating a pleasant and comfortable environment for patients to recuperate in. During the rainy season the roof serves as an aid in collecting rainwater which is then stored in a cistern.  Thus solving one of the main, and well known, problems in the Sahel region in an effective way.Environmental conceptThe building of the clinic should not only serve as an example of successful medical developmental aid, but also provide a workable environmental role model. The intensive use of solar energy is planned and this will fulfil a large proportion of the predicted energy expenditure. It is thanks to the donation of solar panels by the firm SolarWorld, that this is made possible. In addition to this, a biological water purifier will be installed, one of the first ever in Burkina Faso. Water needs will be met through the collection of rain water, which can then be heated using solar power. The construction of an ecological waste disposal plant is also planned.The ArchitectAfter our decision to build a surgical clinic in Burkina Faso, and with high hopes that we would be able to finance and complete such a project, the search began for a suitable architect.It was whilst working with the late popular film and theatre director Christoph Schlingensief, who is well known thanks to his work on the African Opera House Project in Burkina Faso, that I came to meet Francis Kéré. Francis Kéré was born in Burkina Faso and left his childhood home at an early age in order to attend school. He then went on to receive a scholarship that enabled him to study Architecture in Germany. Currently, Francis Kéré owns an architecture firm in Berlin through which he plans and works on a range of worldwide international projects. He has also been nominated for and received numerous architectural prizes.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you don't have the money you can still support us.As marketing expertWant to spend one year in Africa? Or even just six months? Do you speak French? Maybe you even have a sponsor who could support you in setting up the clinic together with us? Currently we are looking for a marketing expert to promote the new clinic, mainly to wealthier inhabitants of Burkina Faso who tend to live near the capital city. Through the provision of a high medical standard we are sure that the clinic will be 
attractive to this group of possible patients. Through their treatment we will be able to operate on the poorer people for free.As a doctorAlongside our continual medical support of the local population, the 
clinic will act as a platform and base for various international 
surgical support initiatives. In general, larger organisations require 
doctors to make themselves available for extended periodsof time. It

from their working lives, in order to provide help and support in 
Africa. However, thanks to the unique infrastructure of our clinic, it 
is ideal if not better to organise short trips of 1 – 2 weeks. Groups of

where they are collected from the airport and taken to stay in guest 
houses. It is then possible for the doctors to work alongside local 
doctors and perform specialised urological, gynaecological, paediatric 
and plastic surgeries. All of which are performed for free. In the 
meanwhile, African doctors are provided with experience andintensive
 training as well as an understanding of good after care. The costs of 
flights and medical supplies have to be covered by the participating doctors or by a sponsor they acquire for themselves.If you are interested in helping please get in touch with us.

story:
Here's who is talking about us! 

The Ecoprenurist...

Read about us in the WSJ here! 

Featured in Cincinnati News! 

Inhabitat! A great read

 

Clean Technia! 

A great article from Blue Living Ideas


We genetically enhanced bacteria and can use them to turn sewage into electricity. Yeah, you're gonna want to read this...

My name is Cody Harrison and my goal as an entrepreneur is to help solve the water and energy crises we are entering.

Despite all of the media attention on preserving the global environment, there is still a huge problem that gets less attention than it deserves: the rapid build-up of waste-water, sewage, and sludge. The United Nations expects global population to rise to nearly 10 Billion by 2050. People, that's a lot of poo...

Not only is our fresh water supply in jeopardy, but we also generate an astounding amount of harmful waste-water every year from municipal sewage, manure slurry from concentrated animal feedlot operations (CAFOs), stick water from animal rendering plants (Google at your own risk…), and Hydrogen Sulfide-rich beer brewing wastewater, among others. Around the globe, treatment systems struggle to keep pace and often operate based on the premise that “dilution is the solution.” As a result, a massive amount of fresh water is “wasted” trying to deal with the dirty water.

Here at Pilus Energy, we have a better idea. Take what we now think of as "waste", and turn it into a renewable source of electricity, while also cleaning water, and producing valuable biogases. Our patented technology can tap into the estimated 1100 Terawatt hours of energy stored in waste molecules (enough to power about 275 million homes for a year, every year). We are able to extract this energy using a combination of synthetic biology, and fuel cell technology. We utilize our genetically enhanced Bacterial Robots (or BactoBots as we call them) to metabolize the contaminants in the water. So far we have two Bots. RemediBot (or Remi for short) is simply added to the water freely, whereas our GalvaniBot is housed in a fancy fuel cell called an electrogenic bioreactor (or EBR). There, Galvani is able to produce electricity, H2O, and valuable biogases and chemicals. Whaddya say? Throw us a few bucks and let us prove what this stuff can do.

And build a bigger one of these!

V 4.0 Prototype EBR

What We Need & What You Get

Our initial goal is $50,000. If we can raise that amount, we can hire a mechanical engineer and design then build our new bench-level prototype complete with sensors and wi-fi data transfer. This is a critical step in building a full size industrial prototype, and will yield important data concerning how the BactoBots perform using different wastewater feedstocks and reactor orientations. This will occur at the EPA's Testing and Evaluation facility in Cincinnati.

Stretch goal #1: If we can raise $75,000, we will be able to begin running wastewater through the EBR and begin to get more data on operating conditions (temperature, pH, etc.), performance properties (remediation, electricity, biogas production, etc.), and remediation properties (BOD, COD, hydrogen sulfide, etc.)

Stretch goal #2: If we can somehow raise $150,000, we'll build a 100 gallon reactor and we'll do our absolute best to make sure it is outfitted not only with wifi but also with what I like to call the Star Trek package; graphene sheets and carbon nanotubes for maximum surface area.

If we can do that we'll be well on our way to completing the pre-pilot phase and well prepared to build a 30,000 gallon industrial scale prototype at the Metropolitan Sewer District of Cincinnati's wastewater treatment plant.

Check out this letter of support from Cincinnati's Metropolitan Sewer District!

And don’t worry this is NOT a donation. We’ve got some crazy cool perks including, awesome stickers, live stream with our very own genetic Mozart, Pablo Pomosiello, the “polaroid hipster package”, legit blueprints and CAD files, t-shirts, 3D printed figurines, synthetic bio art, a full on reactor and lessons how to use it for $250, DNA messages incased in jewelry, and even a trip to Spain.

Click Here to ZOOM IN on this graphic


Also, Check out some of our swag here (clothing and fun promotional items)

Since you made it this far, you can check out our draft COMIC BOOK script on the house- appropriate for ages 14 and up (language)

If we don't meet our goal we will still begin the process, and simply go as far as the money takes us. The first step is hiring a mechanical engineer to create the CAD (computer-aided design) drawings of the new reactor (should cost less than $10k). Next we have the sensors + wifi installed (this will cost ~$20k). Next the software development must take place (another $20k). The materials and assembly for the reactor itself will actually be less than $500 (graphene and nanotubes will make the next one slightly more expensive). 


The Impact

While our energy supply is in turmoil, more than 1100 TeraWatt hours of energy is stored as waste molecules and transported as wastewater.

The lack of clean water is a crisis that only increases with population growth and development.

Ecosystems and public health are at risk. At risk from mining and drilling - at risk from pollutants, poisons, and pathogens - and we are at risk of resulting economic loss, conflicts, and higher production costs.


Check out the FULL SIZE version of this graphic

We can provide cities the opportunity to reduce their wastewater handling expense (as well as the freshwater used during treatment), while creating their own renewable source of fossil-free energy, plus valuable chemicals that can be processed into renewable products. PLUS the carbon and renewable energy credits (RECs), odor control, and reduction of pathogens! Is this a no-brainer yet?

Water is one of the most fundamental resources of civilization, enabling trillions of dollars in value each year. When combined with reliable electricity and basic raw materials, one can accomplish almost anything. With your support we can help heavy polluters and developed economies deal with waste water and provide rural communities the opportunity to gain value from their waste. This technology can be used to help developing countries steer economic development away from harmful activities like poaching endangered species, deforestation, or drugs, and toward more productive ones. Together, we have the opportunity to implement a system that can relocalize economies, provide high tech jobs, and valuable products allowing developing and developed countries alike to continue moving toward a cleaner future for everyone.

If you are seeking to reduce your carbon footprint, help solve the world's clean water problem, or create renewable electricity then please consider giving to this project! 

As a company with domestic and international expertise (see our Team section below) and a commercial scale pilot currently planned at the Environmental Protection Agency's outpost in Cincinnati, OH, Pilus Energy can help bring this technology around the globe by licensing our “wetware” (intellectual property/synthetic biology expertise) and selling our consumable “hardware” (Genetic Rights Management keys). These GeRM keys provide critical security for the BactoBots by preventing them from being stolen or escaping into the environment.

Genetic Rights Management (GeRM) keys are trade secret, inert, non-toxic molecules that are added to the feedstock before it comes in contact with the Bots. If the keys are not present in the feedstock the BactoBots will self-destruct starting with their DNA and RNA.


If you need a little inspiration in your life

By now you may have noticed that empowerment of local economies is one of the themes of this technology. While we seek to transform the world with our technology, we also want to inspire and enable people to believe they can save the world themselves. Some people just need the right tools and the opportunity to take their fate into their own hands. Those are the people we are counting on to change the world with this technology. People like the women in this video. Or the children in this one. If you're still not inspired to join in on this crazy vision for a world powered by poop maybe Justin Hall-Tipping, Charlie Chaplin, or Fahad Al-Attiya can light a fire for you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute monetarily you can still help!

We ask that you help get the word out and make some noise about the campaign! This noise is what determines if we get featured on the front page of Indiegogo, which is a huge benefit.

If this project interests you but you can't contribute for whatever reason please share it with your friends! Indiegogo to make it easy with the share tools right below the video, or this custom share page we made makes it easy as well.

And of course, nothing beats good old fashioned word of mouth advertising!

If you want to know more...

Whether you are a potential investor wanting to engage in due diligence or a scientist interested in helping to improve the technology we'd be happy to discuss providing more info such as documents explaining the business plan and model, pro forma financials, whitepapers explaining the science, etc. Please feel free to contact me by leaving a comment on this page or sending a message to info@pilusenergy.com

You can also learn more about how the technology works (and see some pictures of past prototypes), or check out our Facebook            Twitter            YouTube channel      Press Releases, and Blog to see what we've been up to. 

Risks and challenges

Every project has potential obstacles such as production delays and collaborator mishaps. The important thing is to recognize obstacles, address them, and overcome them. If we reach our Indiegogo goals, nothing is going to stop us from accomplishing the objective of this project: scaling up our BactoBot technology.

However, we are worried some people might be apprehensive to support a project whose end goal is just a slightly larger version of the product, but scaling up incrementally is an inevitable and crucial part of the development process before building an industrial scale prototype. Our hope is that with another successful proof-of-concept it will be easier to get traditional funding.

Another challenge is government regulation, which is always a bit of a wild card. There will be safety testing and certifications we must obtain to keep moving forward, and bureaucracy might slow us down. One of the issues here is the fact that the wild-type bacteria (before modification) is “bio-safety level 2”. Despite the fact that we took the teeth away from the junkyard dog (engineered out some of the virulence) we still have to follow these protocols, but we are fully aware of the rules and ready to comply.

All that being said, we at Pilus Energy are fully confident we can overcome these challenges and bring the world an exciting new technology to solve a pressing issue!

"Boring" Stuff, unless you're into this kinda thing :)

Pilus Energy, LLC was founded in January, 2009 in Cincinnati, OH. It is developing economically sustainable alternative clean technology (cleantech) energy solutions. Its parent company, Bacterial Robotics provides the BactoBot™ synthetic biology technology, which is based upon bacterial metabolism that cleans wastewater while producing electricity, important gases, and chemicals. At the cellular scale it does this 17x more efficiently than fermentation. Pilus Energy's business model is to license to water solution experts a low-cost, scalable electrogenic bioreactor (EBR) platform, and then provide the genetics rights management (GeRM™) keys as consumables to the EBR platform. To date, Bacterial Robotics has spent approximately $800k developing the Pilus Energy technology. This money produced a powerful synthetic bacteria we call P.a galvanii, about a dozen lab-scale prototype EBRs, a patent in continuation with divisionals in the US, and patents filed in Hong Kong, China, India, and the European Union. We now need approximately $1 million and 18 months to bring this to the industrial wastewater market.
