make some noise about the campaign! This noise is what determines if we get featured on the
front page of Indiegogo, which is a huge benefit.
If this project interests you but you can't contribute for
whatever reason please share it with your friends! Indiegogo to make it easy
with the share tools right below the video, or this custom share page we made makes it easy as well.
And of course, nothing beats
good old fashioned word of mouth advertising!
If you want to know
more...
Whether you are a potential investor wanting to engage in due
diligence or a scientist interested in helping to improve the technology we'd
be happy to discuss providing more info such as documents explaining the
business plan and model, pro forma financials, whitepapers explaining the
science, etc. Please feel free to contact me by leaving a comment on this page
or sending a message to info@pilusenergy.com
You can also learn more about how the technology works (and
see some pictures of past prototypes), or check out our Facebook            Twitter            YouTube channel      Press Releases, and Blog to see what we've been up to. 
Risks and challenges
Every project has potential obstacles such as production delays
and collaborator mishaps. The important thing is to recognize obstacles,
address them, and overcome them. If we reach our Indiegogo goals, nothing is
going to stop us from accomplishing the objective of this project: scaling up
our BactoBot technology.
However, we are worried some people might be apprehensive to
support a project whose end goal is just a slightly larger version of the
product, but scaling up incrementally is an inevitable and crucial part of the
development process before building an industrial scale prototype. Our hope is
that with another successful proof-of-concept it will be easier to get
traditional funding.
Another challenge is government regulation, which is always a
bit of a wild card. There will be safety testing and certifications we must
obtain to keep moving forward, and bureaucracy might slow us down. One of the
issues here is the fact that the wild-type bacteria (before modification) is
“bio-safety level 2”. Despite the fact that we took the teeth away from the
junkyard dog (engineered out some of the virulence) we still have to follow
these protocols, but we are fully aware of the rules and ready to comply.
All that being said, we at Pilus Energy are fully confident we
can overcome these challenges and bring the world an exciting new technology to
solve a pressing issue!





"Boring" Stuff, unless you're into this kinda thing :)
Pilus
Energy, LLC was founded in January, 2009 in Cincinnati, OH. It is developing
economically sustainable alternative clean technology (cleantech) energy solutions.
Its parent company, Bacterial Robotics provides the BactoBot™ synthetic biology
technology, which is based upon bacterial metabolism that cleans wastewater
while producing electricity, important gases, and chemicals. At the cellular
scale it does this 17x more efficiently than fermentation. Pilus Energy's
business model is to license to water solution experts a low-cost, scalable
electrogenic bioreactor (EBR) platform, and then provide the genetics rights
management (GeRM™) keys as consumables to the EBR platform. To date, Bacterial
Robotics has spent approximately $800k developing the Pilus Energy technology.
This money produced a powerful synthetic bacteria we call P.a galvanii, about a dozen lab-scale prototype
EBRs, a patent in continuation with divisionals in the US, and patents filed in
Hong Kong, China, India, and the European Union. We now need approximately $1
million and 18 months to bring this to the industrial wastewater market.

story:
(English version below)

Mi hijo Diego era un niño sano, feliz y muy dicharachero que disfrutaba como todos los niños de su niñez.

Hace tres años le paso una de esas cosas inevitables con los niños y que cambian por completo tu vida y sobre todo la de ellos. Le había dicho a Diego, como creo hacemos todos los padres, que no se metiera cosas en la boca, pero aquella noche no me hizo caso...
Mi hijo Diego se tragó un tapón de los oídos, un pequeño tapón. Desgraciadamente ese tapón se quedo encajado en la vía respiratoria e hizo que Diego se asfixiase....
Entró en el hospital en parada cardio respiratoria y tras reanimarlo por segunda vez su corazón volvió a latir. Lamentablemente pasaron 12 minutos sin que su cerebro recibiera oxígeno, lo que provocó una lesión cerebral severa.
El diagnóstico de los médicos fue fatídico " su hijo está en estado vegetativo permanente, nada se puede hacer, pensamos que no llegará al año de vida en este estado".
Creí morir, pero gracias a la mirada de mi hijo no lo hice, así que, ignoré lo que aquellos médicos me dijeron y me puse a buscar soluciones.
Encontramos a otras familias de casos similares que nos dieron grandes consejos. El más importante, no rendirse nunca.

Y así empezó nuestra lucha...
Llevamos tres años haciéndole terapias a Diego , terapias que solo se pueden hacer de forma privada y que son carísimas, pero que han valido la pena...
Gracias a la solidaridad de la gente y a una campaña de recogida de tapones continua, hemos ido pudiendo pagar las terapias necesarias.

Mi hijo Diego no solo ha salido del estado de coma, si no que contra todo pronóstico está recuperándose. Los médicos no dan crédito.
Diego ha recuperado la vista, el oído, ya come, mueve todo su cuerpo, reconoce, empieza a emitir vocales.
Y lo mas importante, Diego VUELVE A SONREÍR.
Después de estos tres años de lucha y optimistas por sus signos de recuperación, este mes de Agosto de 2015, hemos viajado a Bangkok para hacerle a Diego el tratamiento que puede hacer que recupere de nuevo su vida, su niñez.

Es un tratamiento con células madre, pero para que sea completo lo tenemos que realizar dos veces en un año, nosotros hemos conseguido el dinero para el primer tratamiento, pero desgraciadamente es todo el dinero que nos quedaba, por eso NECESITAMOS TU AYUDA , NECESITAMOS RECAUDAR FONDOS para hacer el tratamiento completo y conseguir que Diego vuelva a hablar y caminar.
Después de tanta lucha no podemos quedarnos a mitad de camino....

Usar paypal es muy fácil, pero si quieres hacer una transferencia también la puedes hacer a una cuenat solidaria que tenemos desde hace varios años.
NUMERO DE CUENTA IBAN : ES54 0182 0573 1102 0162 6620

                                                      ENGLISH VERSION

My name is Diego and I have been fighting for three years to recuperate from an accident.


My son Diego was a healthy, happy and very talkative child who was enjoying his childhood like any other kid.


Three year ago one of those things that just happens to kids, happened to Diego, and changed our lives forever, above all for him.  I always told Diego, as I think all parents do, not to put things in his mouth, but that night he didn´t listen to me…


My son Diego swallowed a small earplug which, unfortunately got lodged in his windpipe and he couldn´t breath.


He got to the hospital in cardio respiratory arrest and after trying to revive him for a second time his heart started beating again. Unfortunately his brain went for 12 minutes without receiving any oxygen, which caused severe brain injury.


The medical diagnosis was fateful, "your child is in a persistent vegetative state. Nothing can be done.  We don´t think he will live for even a year in this state."


I thought I would died, but thanks to the look in my son’s eyes I didn´t. I ignored what the doctors told me and I looked for solutions.


We found other families with similar cases that gave us great advice. Most importantly, never to give up.


And that’s when our fight began...


For three years Diego has been undergoing various therapies, therapies that can only be done through private practices and are very expensive. But they have been worth it...

Thanks to people’s solidarity and a non-stop campaign to collect bottle caps, we have been able to pay for the necessary therapies.


My son Diego has not just come out of the coma, but against all odds, he is recovering. The doctors don't understand how.


Diego has recovered his sight and hearing. He is eating. He can move his whole body.  He can recognize people.  He is starting to make sounds.


And most importantly, Diego is smiling again.


After three years of struggle and optimism for his signs of recovery, this August 2015, we traveled to Bangkok to give Diego the treatment can help him get his life back, get his childhood back - a treatment with stem cells.


But to complete this treatment, he needs to have it twice in one year. We have the funds for the first treatment, but unfortunately this is all the money we have left.  This is why WE NEED YOUR HELP.  WE NEED TO RAISE FUNDS to complete the treatment and for Diego to walk and talk again.


After fighting for so long we can´t stop halfway...

story:
As an artist...

individuals trust you with what they want to express. They trust that your talents can give them a product that is valuable in quality, as well as memories. With Photography, I love being the one person that someone counts on to create something that lasts forever. Not a photograph on a piece of paper, but a full memory... something that makes you remember how you felt on that day, how everything was, and the emotions you were going through. This is what is important to me; Being expected to bring a tear to your eye once you see the final photograph. I want to be THE person you can trust on getting quality work from.

I am starting this campaign to help start the beginning steps of turning my passion into an actual business. By this time next year, I am turning my passion into a full studio business. Planning on specializing in engagements/weddings, but still doing a little bit of everything. This business plan is my baby, literally. The only thing stopping me is, of course, finances. There are a few things that I need to acquire that will help my business plan become (in every sense of the word) successful. 


What I am looking to acquire,

This funding completely goes into the gear and advertising that I need.

Gear:
- 2 lenses; one for micro details for special occasions & a wide-angle for weddings.

- Harness; Having one arm can be VERY tricky when handling two camera bodies during a wedding session. A harness will help me get around easily and use my cameras effectively. 

- A new camera bag; My old camera bag is super bulky and not very safe for my equipment. It is expensive if anything happens to the gear while in the bag.

- Advertisement; sadly, it is not free to get the word fully out there. The ad fees are for my website, Facebook ads, and paper ads. 

- Education; taking a few online classes for business, etc. Educating myself on how to become successful to insure that I am going down the right path. 

I plan to divide and conquer,

Helping others create memories in a beautiful timeless fashion is what I am striving for.

I am striving towards a better self and developing new skills daily. I've been able to help myself enough to build my clientele, book some weddings for 2016, and advertise myself. But it only goes so far until I get stuck, because once I need to up the striving, money becomes the issue. I only get money through any painting, drawing, or photography that I am requested to do, so money can be sparingly. 

I don't plan on just getting this money with no thought to return the gesture! Check out the perks for more info. ;)


If you can't donate today, no worries!

I know that the economy is still rough and a lot of others are in the same boat as I am! But if you could please share/spread the word, it would be fantastic! <3

story:
Building community. Empowering families. Strengthening Winnipeg.

Let's be real.

The North End of Winnipeg has a bad rep. 

Crime and vice are the most readily associated concepts when thinking of this neighbourhood.

At the North End Family Centre, we are working hard to change that.

The North End Family Centre is a place where everyone is welcome. We believe everyone deserves a friend, a community, a family. We offer services that range from a cup of coffee and a listening ear to free laundry and means to escape poverty. We believe in the North End and its potential.

That is why we dedicate every day to making sure people in our community have an easier day and a place of refuge from the stigma of poverty. No strings attached.

The North End Family Centre dedicates resources to help people get out of poverty, which has a direct economic impact on the neighbourhood. This is proof that compassion makes the world a better place.

We currently serve more than 1400 people a month with great results. People who visit the centre become connected to their community and are then supported when they make changes in their lives. We would love to offer our services to more people. But to do so we need more space and more resources. We are moving to a new, larger location where we hope to significantly increase our capacity to impact individual lives, families, and an entire neighbourhood. 

WE NEED YOUR HELP! Your donation is important to every user of the centre. Your donation will go to a compassionate cause that can change our neighborhood and our city for the better.

It's time to improve the North End's reputation, and you can help with a couple of simple clicks.

Check out the AMAZING perks we have for you! Support us.  Support the wonderful families of the North End.  Support a healthy and vibrant Winnipeg!

story:
Short Summary

Tree Shepherd CEO Colin Crooks is the pioneering social entrepreneur in residence for Lambeth Council and has 20 years experience in developing social enterprise. He is driven to relieve poverty by encouraging positive enterprising activity within the estates of Lambeth and more recently Southwark.

Tree Shepherd trains, nurtures and supports people from challenging backgrounds to get enterprising, however the main issue for many remains the cost of getting going. The Forest Foundation is key for providing much-needed grants for people who would otherwise struggle and might even give up.

He is a keen cyclist and on 30th April will be cycling in WHOOSH - a cycle run from Swansea to Fishguard to Skegness - a gruelling 6 day bike ride covering 470 miles with 36,800 ascent and wants to raise £5K to support the Forest Foundation.

The goal of £5K means that 10 - 15 individuals can be supported to start their businesses and pay for such things as a sewing machine, a microwave, a cash card reader, ladder & tools, a market stall, a website or business cards.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The money raised will go to a package of start-up grants that 10 - 15 people will benefit from. 50% will be specifically to support 18-30 year-olds.
  • Donors are invited to attend celebratory launches and network events and to see the start-up business in action.
  • Donors will be recognised and acknowledged as supporters of the Forest Foundation
  • Our goal is to raise £5K

The Impact

Tree Shepherd has a wealth of experience in helping give people the confidence to know that they can be an entrepreneur and can turn their lives around.  In 2013/14 they successfully reached out into Lambeth's estate communities - engaging with 147 people. Since then, this number has increased to 200. Just over a third of all participants go on to start test-trading or setting up in business.

The campaign will make a huge difference in supporting up to 15 people to start a business which in turn will have a hugely positive impact on their families.

It is these beneficiaries that the Forest Foundation is providing grants to.

For more on the social impact of Tree Shepherd go to:

http://treeshepherd.org.uk/our-impact/

    Risks and Challenges

    The risk regarding the bike ride is health, fitness, stamina, battling the elements and the bike making the 470 miles. Colin was born with a cycle helmet on and has considerable experience in long distance cycling. He is fully prepared to meet the challenges head on.

    Other ways to help

    Please spread the word!

    Also feel free to offer in-kind support for the beneficiaries of the Forest Foundation grants in the form of volunteer enterprise mentoring, support and advice with business elements such as book-keeping, marketing, branding or business planning.

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
—Join The Healing Movement & Honor All Ancestors

For the past 25 years, a dedicated group of Indigenous people and their supporters have annually taken the Big Foot Band Memorial Ride to remember and honor those who were massacred at Wounded Knee.

Gathering from all walks of life and all parts of the globe, they ride by horseback together through the snow for eight days, along with walkers and runners, retracing the journey made by Chief Spotted Elk [Big Foot]. 2015 marks the 125th anniversary of the Wounded Knee Massacre that took place on December 29th, 1890.

This journey is one of deep healing. As the “tribe” travels the steps of this sacred path together, they reflect, pray, and draw close to Earth, to ancestors and to all who are suffering at the hands of others in the world today. At the end of the ride, they host a powerful ceremony — restoring the sacred in our lives, building community and helping to heal our shared world.

This journey is significant not just locally but for our larger society. It’s about healing the unresolved history of war that has left deep scars on Indigenous Peoples and in the hearts of people everywhere.

It is time to heal the family of planet earth and come back into unity and wholeness.  This ride requires facing physical and emotional hardships in the service of restoring the human family.

While you may not be able to participate directly in the ride, by joining with us in solidarity and financial support, you are creating bonds of friendship, alliance, and support to heal a history of suffering and pain.

You can help heal past wounds and open up the possibility for peace in our future!  Become part of our global network of prayers, offerings, and support forming for the riders and for the shared intention to create a new possibility.

We Invite you to sponsor a Rider and support the horses.  

It costs $300 per rider (or walker) for the entire journey — including food, shelter, support personnel, and medical attention. Your contribution will also go to feed and care for the horses during the eight-day sojourn in the snow. ALL amounts are welcome. Donate in the right column of this page.

You can become an integral part of this important movement for peace. You can help heal this ancient wound.  You can help create a more peaceful and harmonious future for the human family. Additional proceeds will go toward supporting this sacred work in the world. Please contribute whatever amount you’re moved to — no amount is too small!

Healing Hearts at Wounded Knee Global Ceremony

Indigenous Peoples around the world are bringing back ceremony, bringing back healing practices, bringing back the sacred into our lives...

It is with the sacred that we can end massacre. It is with the sacred that we can heal. It is with the sacred that we can make this “great turning” to save our connections with one another, with our sacred planetary home and with the Divine.

Join us, pray with us, pledge with us. All peoples are invited — Indigenous and non-Indigenous alike — to hold Ceremony with us at 12 noon local time on Tuesday, December 29th wherever you are on the globe.

In addition to contributing what you can to support the riders at Wounded Knee, please go to your sacred sites and pray with us, join the global ceremony. Pray for peace, for healing, for the possibility that we would unite as one global family and together end violence and suffering.

Our Mission

We, humankind, continue to be wounded, heart-speared by all forms of massacre almost daily. We continue to create and perpetuate broken hearts and anguish… and we are suffering.

We believe the time to heal is NOW! We are inviting all people to join us in unity and determination to end mass eradication of people and their cultures. We are using this unique opportunity to collectively begin a great and momentous turning.

Thank you for Supporting our Riders, Joining us in Ceremony& Making our Healing Journey Possible!

We could not be carrying this message or continuing this work without your support. Donate today, any amount will make a difference.

Be an integral part of this important movement for peace. No amount is too small!

For more information, to Support the riders and to Join us in ceremony, please visit http://healingheartsatwoundedknee.com
story_txt: —Join The Healing Movement & Honor All AncestorsFor the past 25 years, a dedicated group of Indigenous people and their supporters have annually taken the Big Foot Band Memorial Ride to remember and honor those who were massacred at Wounded Knee.Gathering from all walks of life and all parts of the globe, they ride by horseback together through the snow for eight days, along with walkers and runners, retracing the journey made by Chief Spotted Elk [Big Foot]. 2015 marks the 125th anniversary of the Wounded Knee Massacre that took place on December 29th, 1890. This journey is one of deep healing. As the “tribe” travels the steps of this sacred path together, they reflect, pray, and draw close to Earth, to ancestors and to all who are suffering at the hands of others in the world today. At the end of the ride, they host a powerful ceremony — restoring the sacred in our lives, building community and helping to heal our shared world.This journey is significant not just locally but for our larger society. It’s about healing the unresolved history of war that has left deep scars on Indigenous Peoples and in the hearts of people everywhere.It is time to heal the family of planet earth and come back into unity and wholeness.  This ride requires facing physical and emotional hardships in the service of restoring the human family.While you may not be able to participate directly in the ride, by joining with us in solidarity and financial support, you are creating bonds of friendship, alliance, and support to heal a history of suffering and pain.You can help heal past wounds and open up the possibility for peace in our future!  Become part of our global network of prayers, offerings, and support forming for the riders and for the shared intention to create a new possibility. We Invite you to sponsor a Rider and support the horses.  It costs $300 per rider (or walker) for the entire journey — including food, shelter, support personnel, and medical attention. Your contribution will also go to feed and care for the horses during the eight-day sojourn in the snow. ALL amounts are welcome. Donate in the right column of this page. You can become an integral part of this important movement for peace. You can help heal this ancient wound.  You can help create a more peaceful and harmonious future for the human family. Additional proceeds will go toward supporting this sacred work in the world. Please contribute whatever amount you’re moved to — no amount is too small!Healing Hearts at Wounded Knee Global CeremonyIndigenous Peoples around the world are bringing back ceremony, bringing back healing practices, bringing back the sacred into our lives...It is with the sacred that we can end massacre. It is with the sacred that we can heal. It is with the sacred that we can make this “great turning” to save our connections with one another, with our sacred planetary home and with the Divine.Join us, pray with us, pledge with us. All peoples are invited — Indigenous and non-Indigenous alike — to hold Ceremony with us at 12 noon local time on Tuesday, December 29th wherever you are on the globe.In addition to contributing what you can to support the riders at Wounded Knee, please go to your sacred sites and pray with us, join the global ceremony. Pray for peace, for healing, for the possibility that we would unite as one global family and together end violence and suffering. Our MissionWe, humankind, continue to be wounded, heart-speared by all forms of massacre almost daily. We continue to create and perpetuate broken hearts and anguish… and we are suffering. We believe the time to heal is NOW! We are inviting all people to join us in unity and determination to end mass eradication of people and their cultures. We are using this unique opportunity to collectively begin a great and momentous turning.Thank you for Supporting our Riders, Joining us in Ceremony& Making our Healing Journey Possible!We could not be carrying this message or continuing this work without your support. Donate today, any amount will make a difference. Be an integral part of this important movement for peace. No amount is too small!For more information, to Support the riders and to Join us in ceremony, please visit http://healingheartsatwoundedknee.com
